title: british columbia citizens' assembly on electoral reform
description: an independent, non-partisan assembly of 160 randomly selected bc residents, mandated to examine the current provincial election system and suggested alternatives. their final report and recommendation was submitted to the public and the final decision was put to a referendum.

title: minneapolis neighborhood revitalization program
description: the minneapolis neighborhood revitalization program (nrp) was established in 1990 to empower local residents in the process of revitalizing inner city neighborhoods, allowing them to take an active role in setting priorities, designing projects, and overseeing their implementation.

title: wenling city deliberative poll
description: one of china’s most innovative forms of reinventing democracy occurred in 2005 in zeguo township, wenling with a deliberative poll to engage citizens in democratic decision-making regarding the allocation of resources for infrastructure projects.

title: citizens' forum europe
description: citizens' forum europe was designed to allow disaffected eu citizens to explore their priorities and preferences and to launch a public debate about shaping the future of europe. 16 resolutions followed the process and participants discussed their demands with mep candidates.

title: biobanking in british columbia
description: two deliberative forums involving members of the public from across the province. participants were tasked with considering the ethical and social implications of biobanking and to formulate recommendations for policymakers.

title: californiaspeaks
description: californians came together in a statewide conversation that gave the public a voice in shaping the state's health insurance policy as it underwent reform. independent evaluations show that the expressed priorities were reflected in resulting legislation.

title: transportation priorities project (clark county, washington)
countywide community forums (king county, washington usa)
description: intended to engage citizens in consultative forums, the countywide community forums were used in king county for citizens to deliberate on various relevant topics and subsequently relay their concerns to public officials.

title: philadelphia: tight times, tough choices
description: a civic forum initiated in order to engage citizens in the process of deliberation and decision-making on how philadelphia's budgetary resources should be allocated. the results were presented to the city council.

title: daly city community budget forums
description: daly city successfully used participatory budgeting forums to engage residents in democratic deliberation regarding the allocation of local resources. the municipality has plans to continue engaging the public on matters relating to the budget and other issues.

title: brea city budgeting
participatory budgeting in berlin-lichtenberg
description: berlin-lichtenberg enabled citizens to make and evaluate suggestions on allocating the borough's  €31 million discretionary budget. using online and face-to-face exercises, the democratic process encouraged agreement in policy decisions, but had limited representation.

title: portsmouth listens 2005 city master plan study circles
description: a 2-year, 3-round program of dialogue-to-action circles organized by portsmouth listens to involve community members in the drafting and implementation of the city master plan. ideas from the dialogue were included in the plan and various citizen-driven initiatives were started.

title: alternative public hearings in andhra pradesh (vizag, india)
municipal health councils (brazil) test22
community-managed clinics and health watch committees (bangladesh)
the royal commission on the future of health care in canada (2001-2002)
description: the royal commission was an 18-month public inquiry mandated to consult and engage in dialogue with experts, politicians, and citizens on the current state and future potentials of canada's public health system. the commission produced 47 recommendations.

title: high school participatory budget (poitou-charentes, france)
participatory budgeting (tower hamlets, london, uk)
australia's first citizens' parliament
description: australia's first citizens' parliament was a large-scale three-day deliberation in canberra between randomly-selected citizens who addressed how the australian government could be strengthened to better serve the people. their 13 proposals were presented to parliament.

title: citizens' reference panel on health technologies in ontario, canada
description: the 2008 citizens’ reference panel on health technologies produced evidence-based recommendations on the ethical and societal issues that residents thought should inform the use of health technologies in ontario’s health system.

title: participatory budgeting in salford, uk
democratic innovations in germany
mayor's youth and families initiative summit
front porch forum
kerala people’s campaign for decentralized planning
description: in order to address the state's democratic deficit the “people’s campaign for decentralized planning” gave all 1,214 local governments in kerala new functions and powers of decision making such as partial authority over state developmental expenditures.

title: power2010
description: power 2010 was a campaign to reform the parliament of the united kingdom by engaging the public in the process of determining which reforms they would like to see enacted.

title: hard times, hard choices: michigan citizens deliberate
deliberative polling in marousi, greece
description: a deliberative poll was used by the pasok party in marousi to select candidates, in order to make the process more democratic, and reconnect with their ancient greek historical roots. results show opinions changed among participants, who largely found the process to be effective.

title: open government initiative (usa)
dialogue with the city
description: dialogue with the city’s aim was to engage the citizens of greater perth in developing a planning strategy to make the capital of the state of western australia the “world’s most livable city by 2030.” the large scale deliberation considered issues such as sustainable development, housing and employment in the area.

title: chicago's participatory budgeting project
description: due to declining public confidence and civic participation, chicago's government decided to implement a participatory budgeting initiative to re-engage citizens in the process of democratically deciding infrastructure priorities and how resources should be allocated.

title: porto alegre participatory budgeting cycle 2005-2007
description: porto alegre was the first city to use participatory budgeting as a method of democratic innovation. the process has undergone some changes over its 30 years, and this case focuses on its use during the 2005-2007 budgeting cycle.

title: ontario citizens' assembly on electoral reform
description: ontario's citizens' assembly was charged with examining the current electoral system, learning about alternative models and determining which is best suited for the provincial legislature. the assembly's final recommendations were defeated in a public referendum.

title: san francisco online voter guide
participatory publics in brazil
description: participatory publics were implemented in brazil to increase democratic deliberation given high levels of social exclusion, thereby linking them to formal political officials and allowing them to engage in processes of democratic decision-making processes to pursue their concerns

title: asuw student senate
description: the associated students of the university of washington (asuw) created a student senate in order to engage diverse voices in the process of advising on issues relevant to students.

title: 1st inuit youth symposium on the inuit language
description: the 1st inuit circumpolar youth symposium was held from august 15-19, 2005 to bring together inuit youth from around the world in order to unify the inuit community through strategies for preserving the inuit language and fostering true commitments to language restoration.

title: new mexico department of transportation citizen conferences
description: citizen conferences, each composed of 8-10 new mexico adult citizens and lasting one day, were spearheaded by the new mexico department of transportation to gather public input, so that the department can best meet the transportation needs of its citizens.

title: tillamook bay national estuaries project
description: established as a non-profit in 2002, the tillamook estuaries partnership claimed funding and governing autonomy from the epa over the stewardship and restoration of the estuary. the tep partners with federal, state, and local agencies, as well as ngos.

title: edmonton citizen panel 2008
description: in 2008, the city of edmonton in collaboration with the university of alberta, initiated a citizen panel to engage citizens in participatory processes of consultation regarding edmonton's budget priorities.

title: 2010 university of puerto rico strike
description: the upr strike of 2010 (or huelga del 2010 de la universidad de puerto rico) began on april 21, 2010 as a 48-hour strike at the university of puerto rico río piedras campus when negotiations broke down with administration regarding several student issues.

title: global forum on modern direct democracy
description: the global forum on modern direct democracy is the "oldest and largest global conference on participatory and direct democracy." a global forum focused on a different issue and located in a different country takes place each year.

title: shimer college assembly
icelandic national assembly 2009
description: the first event in a three-year process of constitutional reform, the national assembly was the outcome of a popular campaign for greater public participation and was convened and carried out in collaboration with political officials.

title: listening to the city
description: listening to the city was a 21st century town meeting held in new york city which brought together citizens in an open dialogue on rebuilding lower manhattan after the terrorists attacks of september 11, 2001.

title: san mateo deliberative poll on housing
description: facing a housing crisis that would have social and economic implications for the county, san mateo initiated a deliberative polling event to give residents the chance to learn and then deliberate on the growing issue and democratically decide how they were to address the problem.

title: civicus world assembly
description: the civicus world assembly is an annual gathering which connects concerned citizens, civil society, governments, donors, and businesses in order to tackle the world's most pressing challenges.

title: developing a framework for a mental health care strategy for canada (2008-2009)
description: the mental health commission of canada produced a robust model for collaboration across federal, provincial, and territorial jurisdictions for the development of a pan-canadian mental health strategy.

title: the 2010 uk youth parliament at the house of commons
citizen participation in science and technology project "cipast" (e.u.)
description: a three-year deliberative policy consultation with eu on science, technology, and innovation.

title: tomorrow's europe
description: tomorrow’s europe, categorized as europe’s first transnational deliberative poll, aimed to stimulate democratic participation and establish a european union that was closer to its citizens. gains in knowledge on various social and economic issues affecting the eu were made.

title: san francisco urban-rural roundtable
description: the san francisco urban-rural roundtable involved bringing together food producers and urban businesses to develop recommendations and strategies to form a working foodshed and support agriculture in california.

title: community policing in chicago beat meetings
mississauga-halton citizens' reference panel integrated health services plan
description: the mississauga-halton local health integration network (lhin) commissioned mass lbp to convene a 36-resident reference panel to deliberate on health trends and issues before drafting recommendations for the lhin's integrated health service plan.

title: bolivian democratic development
international youth leadership conference
community planning in scotland
description: in order to engage scottish community members on local-level decision-making regarding issues that affect them, community planning was implemented based on a statutory framework, sponsored by the scottish government.

title: the unified new orleans plan
description: the unified new orleans plan is a comprehensive plan for the city of new orleans developed following hurricane katrina. the plan was drafted using participatory methods including grass-roots outreach, online consultations, district meetings and community congresses.

title: warwick junction urban renewal project (durban, south africa)
artworks creative communities 'get your pen out' homelessness project
description: the "get your pen out" project enabled people from the bradford district to use creative writing to explore their experiences with homelessness, aiming to challenge public perceptions.

title: kentucky school councils
mondragón co-operative corporation: participatory business management
description: mcc uses co-operative business management as its guiding principle of internal governance and decision-making. the corporation stands for participatory worker empowerment through share-ownership, participatory decision-making, and equitable payment.

title: gacaca courts: community justice in rwanda
description: the gacaca courts were community court hearings to convict the 1994 rwandan genocide's perpetrators, a unique and large-scale national experiment of a community judicial system.

title: northern ireland pensioners' parliament (2011)
developing a national strategy for rural canada
description: following a rural research workshop, attendees collaborated in order to develop a national strategy for rural canada.

title: "porto le mie idee" participatory planning in carrara, italy
description: “porto le mie idee” was a citizen-led initiative for those living in marina di carrara to adapt a new water-front construction project to the needs of the community. participation was extensive and recommendations resulting from the workshops were heard by the mayor.

title: recife participatory budgeting
description: recife, brazil has used a three-pronged participatory budgeting scheme since 2001 to allow citizens to engage in democratic-decision making as it relates to the allocation of resources in their city, with increasing participation levels over time.

title: integrazione project on roma settlement in italy
description: integrazione was a deliberative process to foster integration of roma settlements in italy by engaging communities in policy formulation, promoting social empowerment and dialogue between communities, and changing political and personal opinions.

title: public debate on the living will (turin, italy)
description: this mini-public (dibattito pubblico sul testamento biologico) was supported by tuscany region, turin and florence municipality. it aims were to debate and vote on the living will in its various aspects.

title: no a la costanera norte
participatory budgeting in saione, italy
description: the district of saione launched a participatory budgeting exercise called “proponiamo insieme, decidiamo insieme" ("proposing together, deciding together”). the project lasted from july 2009 to december 2009. the resulting budget was drafted according to the citizens' request.

title: "together we design acque chiare park" participatory planning (reggio emilia, italy)
collaborative planning in pistoia, italy: "sbertoli villas and the city"
description: “sbertoli villas and the city” (le ville sbertoli e la città) was a participatory process that involved citizens, local associations, and professional associations in a public debate to determine the future of the sbertoli villas and the green system surrounding the city asylum.

title: participatory budgeting in san marcello pistoiese, italy
description: san marcello pistoiese's participatory budgeting initiative, "facciamo i conti...insieme" engaged citizens in the deliberative and decision-making processes of determining investment priorities.

title: grenoble neighbourhood councils (conseils de quartier) 2002-2014
description: france mandates the use of neighbourhood councils in all large cities. councils serve as purely consultative bodies and do not have the power to directly change policy. due to its success, grenoble's council system was replaced with a more empowered version in 2014.

title: participatory urban planning in ospizio district (reggio emilia, italy)
“partecipappennino”: participatory socio-economic multi-year plan in tuscan-emilian apennine national park, italy
description: the tuscan-emilian apennine national park set up a participatory process to involve local residents in formulating the “piano pluriennale economico e sociale per la promozione delle attività compatibili" (socio-economic multiyear plan for the promotion of compatible activities).

title: neighbourhood recovery programme "quiero mi barrio" (chile)
description: to improve the quality of life of socially vulnerable neighbourhoods in chile, the "i love my neighbourhood" ("quiero mi barrio" in spanish) neighbourhood recovery programme was implemented in 2006, involving local actors in reconstructing their physical and social environments.

title: "io conto" ("i count”): participatory budgeting in arezzo, italy
description: participatory budgeting in arezzo enabled citizens to participate in allocating local resources for green areas and public works, aiming to improve citizens' knowledge of local administration and promote a sense of community and shared responsibility.

title: participation days in angers, france
description: in 2011, participation days in the french city of angers involved two days of themed workshops for participants to discuss civic projects in their city with public officials and experts.

title: 'la bottega del futuro' workshop in casamassima, italy
description: a future workshop in casamassima, italy enabled citizens from various sectors to engage in public debate and deliberation on themes of wellness and quality of life; environment; innovation, culture, and knowledge; and economy and labour.

title: the alta valle del solano community map
la reina sustainable development project (chile)
description: participatory urban projects were developed in the la reina commune of santiago, chile with a focus on sustainable development, thereby engaging local stakeholders in consultative processes on municipal management and the use of public spaces.

title: yungay's establishment as a national heritage site (zona tipica, chile)
description: residents in defence of yungay neighbourhood opposed the municipality's urban development project and mounted a campaign to preserve the neighbourhood's historic and cultural heritage by having it recognized as a national heritage site (zona tipica)

title: south east ontario citizens' reference panel on the integrated health services plan
description: the objective of the citizens’ reference panel was to help the south east local health integration network (se lhin) set priorities by drawing upon recommendations from a panel comprised of residents of south east ontario.

title: "progettiamo insieme la nostra piazza": participatory town planning in montale, italy
description: citizens deliberated on the renovation of public squares in montale, italy, taking different perspectives into account, including those of minorities and disabled individuals. the result was a successful participatory decision to make some major construction modifications.

title: "il padule che vorremmo" (the wetland we want) public engagement in ponte buggianese, italy
description: the italian municipality of ponte buggianese engaged various stakeholders and citizens living near the fucecchio wetland in order to collaboratively plan sewage treatment system improvements and guidelines for the development of the wetlands.

title: "cisternino 2020" participatory planning workshop in livorno, italy
description: in january 2008, the municipality of livorno decided to experiment with an innovative type of decision-making process concerning the renewal and the future use of the 'cisternino', an ancient building historically used for water supply.

title: now we do the math "ora facciamo i conti": italy’s first deliberative poll
description: the regione lazio held the first deliberative poll® ever conducted in italy to get the views of 150 randomly selected citizens about difficult budget choices facing the region.

title: the district of columbia neighbourhood action initiative
“let’s turn the table!” participatory budgeting (marghera, italy)
"il paesaggio partecipato": participatory landscape design in scansano, italy
description: participatory landscape design was implemented in scansano, italy to promote awareness on the identity and economic issues that the area was facing as well as to engage the local population in contributing to addressing those issues.

title: youth participatory budgeting in colle di val d'elsa
description: the first participatory budgeting event in colle di val d'elsa, italy occurred in november 2009, when young residents were engaged in the democratic and educational process of allocating municipal resources to their preferred youth-centred projects.

title: participatory planning workshop "belvedere-parco giardino campagna" (zola predosa, italy)

description: a participatory process was initiated by the municipality of buonconvento in tuscany, italy to engage citizens in proposing updates to the town's structural plan. the local administration committed to taking into account the proposals or explaining why they departed from them.

title: participatory market redesign "laboratorio mercato" (bologna, italy)
german social democratic party (spd) online forum 2011
description: to open up the social democratic party (sdp) to democratic participation, they invited germans to contribute to their policy on digital society, which would become part of their federal election platform, via the internet.

title: "idee in piazza" (ideas in the square) in figline valdarno, italy
description: a participatory project was led by the italian municipality of figline valdarno to engage citizens in formulating ideas for reorganizing the market square.

title: public engagement in five colorado school communities
uniontown cares: auburn university's role in community building
description: auburn university set out to assess the civic health of uniontown and to engage the community by creating a representative focus group of residents to deliberate on local issues. citizens have utilized this new public space to identify and take ownership of community problems.

title: participatory transportation planning "buona mobilità" (emilia-romagna, italy)

title: participatory urban planning in saione, arezzo, italy
description: community members and local government representatives collaborated on an urban planning project to identify needs and priorities for regenerating the saione district. the process promoted active citizen participation and helped to rebuild trust and belonging.

this is a plaza (madrid, spain)

title: uzzano - "a school for all"
participatory capital investment program (kavaja, albania)

description: to engage residents in the process of renewing piombino's municipal square, a social and cultural centre in the italian city, a series of workshops, assemblies, and information sessions were used.

description: the municipality of florence initiated a participatory project to engage citizens on the renovation of the sant’ambrogio/ghiberti area of the city. local government decided to implement the outcomes of the project, but this act was blocked after a change in the local administration.

description: amherst's representative town meetings were both consultative and legislative. elected representatives had the power to vote on municipal legislation while unelected members of the public were free to propose agenda items, attend and speak on proposed measures.

description: strong starts for children (ssfc) in albuquerque, new mexico, usa, was a citizens' deliberation with the aim of ameliorating childhood education for marginalized and underserved youth.

shaping america's youth 21st century town meetings on child obesity
description: shaping america's youth organized a series of town meetings in order to engage families and communities in the process of deliberating on solutions and barriers to improving the health and nutrition of youth.

description: consultative process to generate the agenda for the social development of the municipality of san pedro garza garcía nuevo león, mexico.

description: this participatory project was undertaken by a team of researchers to stimulate a citizen action project (pac) in las brisas, mexico, allowing citizens to engage with issues affecting their community, successfully leading to the implementation of security-related ideas.

description:

description: this case details the main and first planning instrument for the young los ríos region.

description: this case details two multi-option referendums relating to state independence.

description: in bucharest, a growing number of city dwellers are fighting for bicycle rights and bicycle-friendly infrastructure. supporters began self-organizing in the mid 2000’s and have become a powerful presence in the urban landscape, using strategies of protest and mobilization.

description: the 2000 japanese consensus conference saw a group of randomly-selected citizens hear from both expert and lay panels, deliberate, and present recommendations to government regarding the risks and use of genetically modified food.

description: to promote citizen engagement and interest in municipal affairs, the italian municipality of reggio emilio implemented participatory budgeting.

description: originating in queensland, australia, community cabinets spread throughout the country as a means to engage citizens in democratic processes of consultation on regional policies and priorities. support for the initiative has waned with reductions in federal funding.

description: this project engaged the public in planning how to redesign the old farmer's market in bologna, in order to improve its use and enhance the urban environment.

description: a review of a state-wide ballot initiative on mandatory minimum criminal sentences. using oregon's unique system of citizens' initiative review, participants deliberated for several days to deliver an informed judgement which was circulated to state ballot voters.

description: a review of a state-wide ballot initiative on the regulated distribution of medical marijuana. using oregon's unique system of citizens' initiative review, participants deliberated for several days to deliver an informed judgement which was circulated to state ballot voters.

description: the 3-year commonground initiative informed and engaged citizens on the challenges and opportunities regarding early childhood development and education. through dialogues and capacity-buidling/action planning, new policies were developed in collaboration with civic leaders.

description: 'shared challenge, shared solution' was a public engagement process using a citizens’ advisory panel to provide recommended service changes to balance the hospital's budget. the cap's recommendations were accepted by the local health authority without amendment.

title: our health. our perspectives. our solutions: citizen engagement on new brunswick's health system
description: the first large-scale citizen engagement initiative undertaken by the new brunswick health council (nbhc), the three-phase process attracted over 300 participants and provided recommendations to health system partners on what is required to build a citizen-centred health system.

title: deliberative poll on korean reunification (seoul, south korea)
description: on saturday august 11, 2011, a stratified random sample of 193 residents of seoul and its surrounding metropolitan area gathered to discuss the korean unification issue, including the conditions, timing, and consequences of reunifying the two koreas.

title: planning health together - "programmiamo insieme la salute" (grosseto, italy)
raymond, new hampshire's community conversation: a collaboration of positive raymond and new hampshire listens
participatory budgeting with sms (jarabacoa, dominican republic)
california proposition 31 (2012)
oregon citizen's initiative review on measure 85: corporate tax spending
description: a review of a state-wide ballot initiative on corporate tax spending. using oregon's unique system of citizens' initiative review, participants deliberated for several days to deliver an informed judgement which was circulated to state ballot voters.

title: city of canada bay citizens' panel on council services
description: in 2012, the city of canada bay council convened a citizens' panel to obtain the advice of citizens in making decisions for the range and quality of council services for the period 2014-18. the citizens' panel worked in parallel to a randomly selected group of council staff.

title: oregon citizens' initiative review on measure 82: privately run casinos
deliberative poll on japan's energy and environmental policy options
description: a deliberative poll was used by japan's government to consult public opinion on nuclear energy's future after the fukushima daiichi disaster. the process resulted in increased knowledge among participants and a government pledge to eliminate nuclear energy dependence by 2030.

title: south east local health integration network clinical services roadmap community engagement project
description: the south east local health integration network of ontario, canada, developed a community engagement process in 2011 in order to consult local residents and stakeholders on the region's health care system through a deliberative process.

title: canadian senate public consultations on mental health, mental illness and addiction services (2006)
description: the purpose of this deliberation was to provide recommendations for improving the range, quality and organization of mental healthcare services within canada’s healthcare system.

title: 2007/2008 new mexico citizen conferences on transportation
description: with a declining transportation budget, the new mexico department of transportation (nmdot) hosted a series of citizen conferences to allow citizens to create policy recommendations for a budget that would meet their needs.

title: citizens' dialogue on the long-term management of used nuclear fuel
description: a series of citizens' dialogues across canada were initiated in order to engage randomly selected citizens on how used nuclear fuel should be managed in the long-term.

title: citizens' dialogue on sharing funds for a better canada
description: a citizen’s dialogue on sharing public funds between the federal and provincial governments to improve quality of services and competitiveness across canada, occurred in december 2005 to january 2006. the results helped governments identity the policy preferences of the public.

title: canadian house of commons sub-committee on persons with disabilities public consultations
description: the subcommittee on persons with disabilities, supported by the canadian house of commons, launched a 13-week e-consultation from december 3, 2002 to april 3, 2003 to engage citizens on the operation and shortcomings of the canada pension plan disability program.

title: new hampshire community conversations on expanded gambling (2010)
belo horizonte participatory budgeting
new hampshire public conversations on outdoor recreation
the new hampshire public conversations on outdoor recreation
citizens' dialogue on canada’s future:  a 21st century social contract
description: post-war canada has seen significant changes in demographics, governing institutions, and welfare policies. hoping to reaffirm its uniting goals, values, and expectations, a series of choicework dialogues brought 400 citizens together to determine "the kind of canada we want."

title: new south wales public deliberation on energy generation
description: the objective of the citizens' jury on energy economics and security for new south wales for the public accounts committee of the nsw parliament was to agree on a recommended course of action with regard to alternative forms of energy generation in nsw.

title: bürgerforum 2011
description: the citizens' forum aimed at involving more citizens in deliberative processes, enabling them to identify pressing political issues and discuss solutions, awakening their interest in democratic participation.

title: social consensus building, kagoshima, japan
description: kagoshima's three-year project to maintain environmentally sustainable growth in the tourist attraction town of yakushima involved engaging citizens in scenario workshops in order to facilitate social consensus-building.

title: oregon citizens initiative review 2010 measure 74
community budget in monheim
use of delphi method to develop a horse control strategy in penticton, bc
description: a delphi-based approach was used to engage the public in searching for a solution to roaming horses invading the rural area around penticton each winter. some horses belong to the neighboring indian band, but ownership, jurisdiction, and responsibility for the issue is disputed.

title: citizens' manifesto for european democracy
brazil national consultations for country progress report on aids
irish constitutional convention (2012-2014)
description: the convention on the constitution was established in ireland to discuss proposed constitutional amendments; 66 randomly selected irish citizens met from 1 december 2012 and sat until 31 march 2014.

title: islands nationalforum 2010
citizen participation in the revision of the regulatory communal plan of estación central
description: estación central's regulatory communal plan needed revision due to its disarticulation with the reality of estación central and the heterogeneity of the territory; this revision process involved engaging community members on their opinions for the new plan.

title: no to the costanera norte coalition
description: a citizen-led effort against a proposed development project.

title: indonesian direct democracy experiment
description: emerging from the kecamatan development project, the indonesian direct democracy experiment was developed in order to measure the benefits of direct democracy on citizen satisfaction and political legitimacy in a community, as compared to the traditional town meeting.

title: hampton (virginia) deliberative governance
geraldton 2029 and beyond
description: geraldton 2029 and beyond is a project which uses civic deliberation and social media as a means to strengthen democratic engagement in the pursuit of sustainability in the coastal australian city.

title: bridgeport (connecticut) community conversations
collaborative online lawmaking: brazil's e-democracia
description: using the e-democracia online portal, citizens from across brazil can access information regarding the legislative process, comment on draft bills, and interact with congressional representatives.

title: democratic school of hadera
description: the democratic school of hadera is a democratic school in hadera, israel that was founded in 1987 to bring democratic values to education and the personal development of children.

title: participatory budget saving in solingen
mitreden-u: a dialogue on germany's national sustainability strategy
"dresdner debatte" on the neumarkt redesign
description: the first dresdner debatte (dresden debate) involved an open, online public dialogue between residents, politicians, and urban planners on the neumarkt reconstruction of historical streets and facades. it aimed to open contact between citizens and government to improve transparency.

title: participatory redesign of tempelhof airport (berlin)
national conversation on public health and chemical exposures
citizens' panel on edmonton’s energy & climate challenges
description: a 56-member citizens' reference panel commissioned by the city of edmonton to weigh in on the development of an energy transition plan. the recommendations of the panel were accepted by the administration and integrated into the final energy transition strategy.

title: openparlamento
congreso visible
decentralized governance in tanzania
description: efforts to decentralize tanzania's government began in 1972 but have been hampered by a lack of civil education, poor legislative efforts, and few accountability mechanisms. the process continues with emphasis placed on public participation and demand-oriented service delivery.

title: the decentralization of ethiopia's political system
description: ethiopia's 1994 constitution granted regional and local governments wide-ranging powers of self-management. the process of devolving power from a historically centralized, authoritarian state has been slow and is heavily focused on building individual and institutional capacity.

title: greater cairo urban poverty initiative (egypt)
the commonwealth of burnsville, minnesota
description: burnville's local government openly encourages and facilitates citizen involvement in public management contributing to a commonwealth-style community which emphasizes the public rather than private good.

title: five-year plan to increase community involvement in portland (oregon)
in action with citizens! learning about new forms of citizen participation in the netherlands
the european citizens' consultation (2006 agenda-setting event)
description: the european citizens’ consultations brought together over 1,800 citizens from 27 eu member states to deliberate on the future of the european union. this case describes its first phase, a 200-person agenda-setting event held in brussels from october 7–8, 2006; the event was followed by national consultations from february–march 2007 and various follow-up events in 2007. [1]

title: family-centred employment project (australia)
description: the family-centred employment project aims to help local jobless families move into education and employment via scoping, service mapping, and community engagement. it was implemented in three test sites, namely broadmeadows (vic), goodna (qld), and mansfield park (sa).

title: lübeck citizens' conference on health care modernization (germany)
description: 23 randomly-selected lübeck citizens took part in a participatory citizens' conference where they deliberated on how to modernize german health care in order to provide policy recommendations for the government.

title: radioactive waste management plan (belgium)
participatory chinatown (boston, 2010)
participatory budgeting in rosario, argentina
description: in the city of rosario in argentina, the government used the method of participatory budgeting to allow citizens the opportunity to engage in the process of decision-making when it came to allocating resources in their communities.

title: toronto community housing's tenant participation system
description: toronto community housing's tenant participation system used participatory budgeting to facilitate neighbourhood planning of social housing and development in low-income neighbourhoods which would reflect the needs of residents.

title: olanet - ohio latino affairs network
campaigning for the right to information in india
moscow commissions fair and service to commissions awards
queensland growth management summit
nhs virtual participation groups
abuja town hall meetings
description: nigeria's capital city, abuja, held a series of public town hall meetings to increase transparency and trust between local government representatives and citizens. the meetings were meant to call back to a democratic culture rooted in nigerian tradition.

title: mongolia's citizens' hall
description: the mongolian citizens’ hall provides the means to receive, consider and incorporate public suggestions and concerns into draft legislation being considered by the parliament, and when necessary, to help facilitate consensus among social groups, factions, and political forces.

title: rethinking methods of online participation: "io partecipo +" (emilia-romagna, italy)
bantay sangkay: a community driven development (cdd) approach
building a better colorado through civic engagement
imagine durban
paducah gaseous diffusion plant future vision project (kentucky, usa)
toronto civics 101
description: toronto civics 101 was a civic literacy and engagement program launched in 2009 that aided the local public in understanding their government and their personal and community role in building a greater city.

title: latvia 2030 sustainable development strategy drafting
the moldovan network of rural volunteering centres for water
'we vote' : voting rights campaign in germany
description: "the ultimate aim of this campaign is to establish voting rights on the local level for all residents that live in germany for at least 5 years, a right that eu citizens already have after living only 3 months in germany."

title: independent custody visiting in police detention facilities in sofia
description: the project involved independent civil monitoring of police detention facilities to ensure the protection of human rights. the long-term goal was to promote transparency and accountability in police work, while enhancing the confidence of local communities in the police.

dulverton sensible spending participatory budget (somerset, uk)
description: dulverton parish council has been implementing pb since 2009, and developed an innovative approach in 2013 which involves a number of organisations and budgets that are spent in dulverton, involving locals in deciding how they can best be spent.

title: participatory budgeting in ruthin's cae ddol park (denbighshire, uk)
description: in 2009, denbighshire county council implemented participatory budgeting in order to enable local residents to engage in the democratic process of deciding how to allocate £25,000 in cae ddol park to replace a paddling pool.

title: your voice your choice: blaby community forum participatory budgeting (leicestershire, uk)
description: three blaby community forum participatory budgeting events were undertaken in june 2009, leading to the city-wide "leicestershire together" participatory budgeting process to engage local residents in deliberation on spending priorities.

title: castlefield and oakridge participatory budgeting (high wycombe, uk)
description: the castlefield and oakridge area of high wycombe advanced a community-led participatory budgeting scheme in order to allocate £55,000 from the connecting to communities fund. it was intended to address local issues and enable local residents to engage in the democratic process.

title: the boston placecheck project: participatory budgeting in lincolnshire, uk
description: five neighbourhoods in boston borough in lincolnshire used participatory budgeting to allocate small grants, allowing communities to decide what projects were needed based on their own criteria, aiming to empower the local community and engage them in democratic decision-making.

title: milton keynes' "glow in the park, vote in the dark" participatory budget (uk)
description: this case details how milton keynes council in the uk initiated a participatory budgeting project where local communities engaged in the process of deciding how to allocate resources, thereby engaging with one another and democratic processes.

title: u-choose participatory budgeting in cornwall, uk
description: three participatory budgeting events were carried out by cornwall in pengegon, parc an tansys and gwelmor, redruth north, and treneere, aiming to promote local influence over democratic decision-making on the allocation of small grants.

title: voice your choice participatory budgeting in manton, worksop, nottinghamshire
description: this case study details the methods and tools used by organizers to achieve high numbers of participation during the two years manton community alliance in worksop, nottinghamshire held participatory budgeting events to build trust and increase democratic involvement.

title: safta youth participatory budgeting 2009 in stockton-on-tees, uk
description: the st. ann’s funding team awards for young people 2009 (the safta’s) was a participatory budgeting event that engaged youth in the democratic decision-making process of allocating resources toward projects that were aimed at improving the quality of life in disadvantaged areas.

title: “berkhamsted ideas delivered”: youth participatory budgeting in hertfordshire, uk
description: a legal agreement between dacorum council in the county of hertfordshire, uk, and the developer of a housing estate in berkhamsted, had secured a £50,000 fund for sporting activities in the area, allocated through a participatory budgeting process which young people managed.

title: "it's up2u" participatory budgeting in tameside, manchester, uk
description: in march 2009, nearly 200 people, including young people turned out to participate in deciding how to spend £35,000 which included funding from both greater manchester police and tameside police division as well as the home office funds.

title: acorns' your voice, your choice participatory budget (scunthorpe, uk)
description: your voice, your choice was one of lincolnshire home office's community safety participatory budgeting pilots which was given £20,000 for allocation in scunthorpe, uk.

title: participatory budgeting on crime and local safety in eastfield, scarborough, uk
description: in 2009, the english town of eastfield implemented participatory budgeting, giving residents the opportunity to engage in the democratic-decision making process of voting on which projects they thought should be funded to address local crime and safety concerns.

title: st. asaph's "your city, your choice" participatory budgeting (denbighshire, wales)
description: the town of st. asaph in the welsh county of denbighshire implemented a participatory budgeting pilot in 2008 in order to engage local residents in the democratic decision-making process of allocating resources to address community cohesion, safety, and environmental concerns.

title: east devon section 106 fund participatory budgeting (devon, uk)
description: in order to effectively allow local residents, particularly young people in the community, to engage in the democratic process of directing funds toward play and recreation design in east devon, uk, a participatory budgeting event was implemented.

title: participatory budgeting on highways in east salford, lancashire, uk
description: in order to effectively allow local residents to engage in the democratic process of allocating resources toward proposals on highways and transportation in east salford, participatory budgeting events were implemented.

title: "your borough, your say": participatory budgeting in great yarmouth, norfolk, uk
description: in 2009/10, great yarmouth borough council in the county of norfolk, uk, had numerous participatory budgeting pilot events in order to engage community members in the democratic decision-making process of allocating resources, in part from the community cohesion fund.

title: adeyfield “you choose” participatory budgeting (hemel hempstead, uk)
description: the town of adeyfield in hertfordshire county, uk, initiated a participatory budgeting event referred to as "you choose" in order to let local stakeholders democratically decide how £50,000 would be allocated in their community as part of their localism agenda.

title: parr investment grant voting day: participatory budgeting in st. helens, uk
description: in 2008, parr neighbourhood management in st.helen's, uk, implemented a participatory budgeting process to allocate its investment grant, with the hopes of engaging local residents in democratic processes and improving their connection to elected officials.

title: morecambe "in your hands" participatory budgeting (lancashire, uk)
description: in 2008, the coastal town of morecambe in lancashire, england, implemented participatory budgeting to give local people the chance to participate in the democratic process of deciding how public money is spent.

title: claremont and weaste's devolved highways budget
description: in order to effectively allow local residents to engage in the democratic process of directing funds towards highway and transportation projects in the claremont and weaste community of salford, uk, a participatory budgeting event was implemented.

title: "the village spend": participatory budgeting in coedpoeth, north wales
description: in 2006, the community council in the village of coedpoeth, north wales, decided to engage community members in hte process of allocating precept funds through a participatory budgeting process, making it the first community council in the uk to do so.

title: buckinghamshire county participatory budgeting
description: buckinghamshire county council took a different approach to participatory budgeting. rather than trial a small grants pot, as many cities have when starting out, buckinghamshire piloted 4 different kinds of pb at once, aiming to integrate pb as the way they engage the community.

title: participatory budgeting in wigan, greater manchester, england
description: in 2008-2009, the english town of wigan implemented participatory budgeting in order to distribute £20,000 to various community organisations whose projects were thought to improve the community. the initiative allowed democratic engagement in decision-making processes.

title: "keighley decision day": participatory budgeting in bradford, west yorkshire, uk
description: the bradford local strategic partnership decided to engage local residents in the distribution of £130,000 for the 2006/07 neighbourhood renewal funding in keighley using the method of participatory budgeting.

title: the people's fund in east end and hendon, sunderland, uk
description: as one of five pilot participatory budgeting projects using the community chest approach, the people's fund in east end and hendon, sutherland, allowed local residents to have a say in how to allocate resources to address their concerns and improve relations with city council.

title: harrow's open budget (london, uk)
description: the london borough of harrow's local council opened up their budget to public consultation regarding how resources should be allocated in 2006/7. to engage the public in the democratic process, they implemented an open assembly of local residents and an ongoing monitoring panel.

title: e-people citizens' relation management platform (south korea)
description: e-people, a multilingual online platform that uses e-petitioning, bottom-up proposals, and online policy discussions, aims to address people's complaints against south korean government agencies, and encourage public participation in democratic processes to improve policy.

title: tunza international youth conference on climate change 2009
description: in 2009, the tunza international youth conference on climate change involved over 800 youth gathering to address environmental issues, as part of korean secretary-general ban ki-moon's un campaign to obtain public support for an international climate agreement.

title: the inclusive social media initiative
description: e-democracy is one of the oldest innovators of online participation[1] and their inclusive social media initiative was an attempt to expand the use of online issues forums among social diverse, lower income communities typically excluded from digital forms of engagement.[2]

title: the national public order conferences (brazil)
reforming the indigenous health system in brazil
description: in brazil, the special secretariat for indigenous health was appointed to implement a new model of state-provided health care based on differentiated health needs of minority groups and indigenous participation in order to respect constitutional guarantees of indigenous autonomy.

title: ireland participatory democracy pilot 'we the citizens'
description: a 2011 citizens assembly known as 'we the citizens' was designed in dublin, ireland, to assess whether participatory democracy would encourage citizens to participate and feel more involved and to investigate an alternative method for ensuring political legitimacy.

title: canada's world dialogue series
description: as a three-year citizens’ dialogue for identifying a new direction for canadian foreign policy, canada's world dialogue series initiative advanced democratic development and hoped to inspire residents to develop and promote their own vision for the future of international policy.

title: ideal-eu social networking platform
description: an online information and discussion hub was designed to help the european parliament raise awareness on the topic of climate change and energy among the eu citizens, especially the new generations, and to propose the most appropriate policy responses at all institutional levels.

title: la plata multi-channel participatory budgeting (argentina)
description: la plata's participatory budget combined offline and online channels of participation to lower the time costs of exclusively face-to-face, deliberative events. the multi-channel approach has been successful in drawing a larger number of participants from diverse demographics.

title: participa en andalucía: e-democracy platform in spain
description: as an online platform that acts as an intermediary between andalusian towns and citizens, specific issues and action items can be discussed and voted upon by registered users. policy proposals can also be submitted to municipal governments, some having been officially adopted.

title: osale: estonia's eparticipation platform
description: the estonian website, osale, allows government agencies to publish policy plans, legislation, and provisions for public consultation in order to improve transparency and citizen participation in decision-making.

title: participatory report on solid waste management in gopeshwar, india
description: gopeshwar was struggling with the issue of cleanliness and subsequent lost tourist revenue, so participatory research in asia (pria) was invited by the indian municipality to prepare the participatory detailed project report on solid waste management.

title: "your say, your way": participatory budgeting in luton, uk
description: in the town of luton in bedfordshire, england, a participatory budgeting initiative known as "your say, your way" was used to allow local residents to engage in community decision-making regarding how funds would be allocated to address the most pressing area-specific issues.

title: study circles in kuna, idaho
description: spurred by changing demographics and community growth in the 1990s, the kuna alliance for a cohesive community team (act) initiated a community-wide study circles programme, the oldest in the us, for a grassroots democratic deliberative process.

title: cdc's public engagement pilot project on pandemic influenza (2005)
description: the purpose of the cdc's 2005 public engagement pilot project on pandemic influenza (pepppi) was to inform decision-makers about the public’s priorities for the use of pandemic influenza vaccine during a period of anticipated shortage.

title: terzo veneto: e-democracy portal in italy
description: this case highlights the online platform terzo veneto, a project designed in the veneto region of italy in order to allow citizen engagement in democratic processes while offering civic education through games, a youtube channel, and a citizen's dictionary.

title: "pot of gold": participatory budget in adur district, england
description: the district of adur in west sussex, uk, initiated a participatory budgeting initiative, referred to as "pot of gold", in order to let local stakeholders democratically decide how £120,000 would be spent in their community.

title: be birmingham's small area participatory budgeting (handsworth and lozells, uk)
description: in order to empower local communities in the city of birmingham (uk), participatory budgeting pilot projects started in the small areas of handsworth and lozells, allowing residents to engage in democratic decision-making regarding the allocation of local resources.

title: ‘your voice, your choice’: participatory budgeting in blaenau gwent, wales, uk
description: in the welsh county of blaenau gwent, a participatory budgeting project known as "your voice, your choice" was used in 2010 to allow local residents to engage in democratic decision-making regarding how funds would be allocated for community safety.

title: bristol city council e-participatory budgeting
description: bristol, england initiated an online participatory budgeting initiative in collaboration with delib in order to let local stakeholders democratically decide how £15,000 would be allocated, by submitting and rating ideas on the website.

title: community empowerment through participatory budgeting in carlisle, uk
description: in order to empower local communities in the city of carlisle (uk), participatory budgeting pilot projects started in harraby and longtown, allowing residents to engage in democratic decision-making regarding the allocation of local resources.

title: participatory budgeting in cumbria, uk
description: in the english county of cumbria, participatory budgeting was made possible through the neighbourhood forum grants, thereby allowing local members of communities to engage in democratic decision-making regarding the allocation of resources.

title: 'up2u' youth participatory budgeting on healthy eating on the isle of wight, uk
description: on the isle of wight, a participatory budgeting program known as up2u began  in freshwater and totland in order to engage youth in deciding which healthy eating projects to direct funds toward, allowing them to learn about both democratic decision-making and healthier lifestyles.

title: community budget in fife, scotland (2009-2011)
description: from 2009 to 2011, the county of fife in scotland piloted participatory budgeting, in order to engage community members in democratic decision-making and allow them a say in how local funds are managed.

title: youdecide participatory budgeting in gosport, england
description: in the english town of gosport, hampshire, a participatory budgeting initiative gave community members the chance to democratically engage in the allocation of local funds, ultimately involving 5,000 households.

title: corby's participatory budgeting on community safety (northamptonshire, uk)
description: in the town of corby, northamptonshire, a participatory budgeting initiative allowed residents to participate in deciding how best to spend local funds on making their communities safer.

title: participatory budgeting by devon and somerset fire and rescue
description: this case details how devon and somerset fire and rescue service initiated a participatory budgeting project in 2012 where local communities engaged in the process of deciding how to spend received funds, thereby engaging with one another and democratic processes.

title: the decentralization of venezuela's political system
description: under the leadership of hugo chavez, venezuela began a program of decentralization and popular participation in 1998. efforts to decentralize power have included a rewritten constitution as well as state recognition of popularly elected, citizen-led communal councils.

title: "voice your choice": participatory budgeting in huntingdon, uk
description: as part of huntington's voice your choice project, the north ward gave residents the chance to engage in participatory budgeting where they could vote on projects to direct funds to, facilitating greater democratic education in the community.

title: 'it's up 2 u £500k': participatory budgeting in durham county, uk
description: in 2013, durham county council initiated a project known as "it's up 2 u £500k", giving local residents the opportunity to collaborate and decide where to direct the funds in their budget, hoping to allow them a say over local issues and increase their democratic engagement.

title: islington people's project in finsbury park ward (london, uk)
description: in finsbury park, located in london's islington borough, local residents were given the opportunity to vote on which project they felt funds should be directed towards, as a democratic initiative to increase citizen involvement.

title: frodsham participatory budgeting (cheshire, uk)
description: participatory budgeting was used in frodsham, of cheshire, england, to involve local communities in deciding where local funds should be directed. the 2011 project promoted democratic engagement.

title: ‘people-proofed’ budgets in herefordshire, england
description: in order for local communities to become more democratically engaged and have an avenue for their local concerns, the hampton bishop parish council in herefordshire used participatory budgeting to "people-proof" their proposals.

title: hampshire county's 'have your say' participatory budgeting
description: as part of a national project in the uk to have more communities engage in public consultation projects, hampshire county council implemented participatory budgeting in 2012, called "have your say" to allow citizens to engage in democratic processes.

title: diocese of lichfield's 'practising generosity' participatory budgeting
description: in this 2012 case, the bishop of lichfield's annual lent appeal proceeds were divided via the participatory budgeting method within the diocese of lichfield in canterbury to address poverty, thereby engaging local community members in the democratic process.

title: crowdsourcing off-road traffic laws in finland
description: an experiment of citizen participation using “crowdsourcing” to collect feedback and ideas on new legislation on off-road traffic routes. deliberation and opinion formation was analysed in order to determine the efficacy of online forms of participatory policy-making.

title: indian talk show "satyamev jayate": bringing national awareness to social issues
description: a unique democratic innovation to educate the public and bring national awareness to suppressed social issues, such as corruption in healthcare, the indian talk show, satyamev jayate, meaning "truth alone prevails", inspires audiences to pressure government for systemic changes.

title: crowdsourcing in political decision-making and legislative processes in finland
estonia's people's assembly 'rahvakogu' on government spending
description: using an online platform and a 'deliberation day', the estonian government sourced proposals for the country's electoral laws, political party law, and government spending, due to concerns about bribery.

title: our place: the uk's nationwide neighbourhood participatory budget programme
description: in order to decentralize control over public budgets and improve democratic engagement, particularly regarding services, the uk implemented a nationwide neighbourhood participatory budgeting program, now referred to as "our place".

title: theyworkforyou.com - informing voters online about uk parliament
description: theyworkforyou is an online participatory website intended to promote democratic education and access to governance for uk residents and citizens, by providing information on the votes and policies of members of parliament (mps).

title: tameside's "you choose" participatory budgeting (manchester, uk)
description: you choose is a participatory budgeting initiative run by tameside council in greater manchester, in order to allow local community members to engage in the development of plans to use public funds sustainably.

title: prince edward county citizens' assembly on county representatives
description: in 2013, prince edward county commissioned a citizens' assembly to review the size of city council. selected at random using a civic lottery system, 23 residents deliberated over three saturdays and presented their recommendations which the council did not adopt.

title: 2010 participatory budgeting in atibaia, brazil
description: in 2010, a participatory budgeting project was undertaken in atibaia, one of many brazilian cities to engage in this democratic initiative in order to increase citizen engagement on issues affecting their communities.

title: participatory budgeting in santa cruz, cape verde
description: one of four participatory pilot projects in cape verde, the santa cruz participatory budgeting was implemented to increase citizen engagement and access to the governance of their communities. a website was created to document the experience.

title: communities creating racial equity initiative
description: an initiative to support community coalitions in using public engagement and problem solving to create greater racial equity, using the dialogue to change approach.

title: grassroots jerusalem's mapping and storytelling project
description: the mapping and storytelling project designed and led by the palestinian ngo grassroots jerusalem amplifies the voices of jerusalemite communities by means of participatory democracy.

title: the e-agora project: participatory budgeting in ipatinga, brazil
description: europe's e-agora prompted a participatory budgeting initiative in ipatinga, brazil, allowing the city to use various communication technologies from latin america and europe, both online and offline, to incentivize citizen participation with the goal of revitalizing democracy.

title: youth participatory budgeting in rosario, argentina
description: in order to improve social inclusion, youth participatory budgeting was implemented in rosario, argentina in 2004. known as ppjoven, it was intended to engage youth in the democratic decision-making process.

title: participatory budgeting in cordoba, andalucía
description: in 2001, participatory budgets were initiated in the city of cordoba, andalusia, to allow citizen involvement; the city typically had solid citizen participation. this pilot experiment followed the porto alegre model, with many similarities in organization, phases, and time.

title: participation days in angers
the creation of la guardia indígena (indigenous guard) in colombia
description: in response to a history of violence on colombian indigenous communities and threats to their resources such as water, an indigenous guard was legally recognized to act as a security force for them. the guard also interacts with indigenous councils.

title: multi-stakeholder participatory planning of subsidized housing in puente alto, chile
description: the solidarity housing fund was created in chile to allow low-income families to not only apply for subsidized housing, but be part of the planning process, giving them a sense of agency; this initiative involved joint decision-making between government and local communities.

title: participatory budgeting in cruz alta, brazil
description: introduced by brazil's worker's party in 2005, cruz alta implemented participatory budgeting to include citizens in deliberation regarding how resources will be distributed. this initiative has led to a resurgence of civil society and new perspectives on state-society relations.

title: the biobank project tasmania - a community consultation
description: with an inclusive project that emphasized the engagement of citizens who will be especially affected by biobanks, faculty at the university of british columbia led by michael burgess began a deliberative process on potential population biobanking in tasmania.

title: "motiemarkt" participatory budgeting in enschede, netherlands
description: the municipality of enschede in the netherlands holds an innovative participatory budgeting event called the ‘motiemarkt’ (resolution-market) every fall, allowing citizens and civil society groups to convince elected officials on their budget proposals.

title: g1000 citizens' summit in amersfoort, netherlands
description: the g1000 amersfoort was a citizens' summit in the netherlands that was aimed at supplementing regular representative democracy by having citizens deliberate on the newly-elected city council's agenda.

title: project madison - crowdsourcing online feedback on us legislation
description: in late 2011, the opengov foundation and its founder, us congressman darrell issa (r-ca), launched an online platform called the madison project to solicit and crowdsource comments, feedback, and suggestions for edits directly from the public on drafts of bills.

title: pilot project for a political participation panel in heavitree, uk
description: a pilot project initiated by local resident of heavitree, ditch townsend, this case involves the construction of a sizeable group of residents for future political participation panels through door-to-door recruitment.

title: citizen participation approach: reinventing the city of lac-mégantic
description: the reinventing the city approach was adopted by lac-mégantic following a 2013 tragedy. the city allows citizens to share their ideas and visions for the future; the goal of designing is a plan for the reconstruction of the city center focused on the good of the community.

title: civic engagement in iranian schools: transforming the approach of educators
description: established in 2011, afrooz online school of civic education gives iranian educators insight into the practice of democratic citizenship; they experiment in the classroom to foster experiences for students to think independently and analytically about their surroundings.

title: the european citizens’ consultation 2009
description: the european citizens’ consultation in 2009 (ecc09) was a participatory cross-border experiment, aiming to promote deliberation among eu citizens and ultimately present proposals to decision-makers. ecc09 failed to influence policy but increased participant attachment to the eu.

title: europolis: deliberative polling® on the european union
description: the europolis project used deliberative polling to show european union parliamentarians the positive effects of engaging in deliberation on the participants, their opinions, and their participation level in the eu.

title: opengov.gr - the greek open government initiative
description: greece implemented an open government initiative to increase transparency, deliberation, collaboration, and accountability in governance.

title: public petitions in the german bundestag
online consultation on higher education in north rhine-westphalia, germany
description: in 2014, an amendment to the higher education act of the german state of north rhine-westphalia (the so-called "hochschulzukunftsgesetz") came into effect, after the ministry of innovation, science and research consulted online with groups which would be affected by the new law.

title: noise action plan (lärmaktionsplan) in dortmund, germany
description: in 2012, dortmund began an online project to expand a city noise map, the base for plans targeting noise reduction as required by environmental protection policies and laws. citizens could report noise problems and to-be-protected areas, with results used for analysis and debate.

title: internet-based cooperative standard setting at the faculty of mathematics and natural sciences at the heinrich heine university in düsseldorf
wir wollen deinen kopf! - reintroducing participatory regional politics in baden-wuerttemberg
description: in 2012, the german state of baden-wuerttemberg successfully reintroduced the "verfasste studierendenschaft" which allowed students  to participate in regional politics, especially in matters concerning universities, particularly through an online co-governance project.

title: liquidfriesland
ezürich - ideas competition for the digital future of the city of zurich
study commission "internet and digital society"
renovation of the stadium pool, bremen
case study on interactive landscape planning at the elm
besser-studieren.nrw
youth lead the change: boston’s youth-focused participatory budgeting project
description: in 2014, the city of boston initiated “youth lead the change,” the nation’s first participatory budgeting process focused exclusively on youth. its goals included civic education and engagement, and the inclusion of youth voices that are typically marginalized from politics.

title: demos: online civic participation in buenos aires' legislative debates
description: the demos project was a participatory initiative designed to enable civic participation in the debates about high-profile legislative proposals in buenos aires, argentina, using open-sourced software developed by the non-governmental organization, democracia en red.

title: undp supports democratic constitution project in tunisia
description: the united nations development program supported citizen engagement and consultation, consciously making an effort to include women and youth, on a new democratic tunisian constitution, which was successfully adopted by the nation's constituent assembly in 2014.

title: the u.s. campaign for a presidential youth council
description: the campaign for a presidential youth council is a youth-led, non-partisan initiative with the goal of having the u.s. president establish an advisory youth council for suggesting effective design and implementation of policies that affect them.

title: project "bairro limpo": community waste management in brazil
description: poor waste management and mobility issues in low-income brazilian communities led to the "bairro limpo" (or "clean neighbourhood") project aimed at fostering collective environmental responsibility among the public while encouraging community-building.

title: democracy in practice: democratic student government program in cochabamba, bolivia
description: democracy in practice’s 2014 student government program ran in three bolivian schools. the pilot project involved randomly-selected student governments, thereby enriching student's personal development and experience with the consensus-making of democratic governance.

title: nouabook: connecting citizens and members of parliament in morocco
description: nouabook is an online citizen-mp engagement platform in morocco, launched by the non-profit, simsim-participation citoyenne, allowing citizens to engage directly with members of parliament and voice their political opinions.

title: youthdebates online discussion forum
description: youthdebates.org is an online, youth-run forum that allows youth to discuss their political views on current events and continuing issues. it hosts discussions about a variety of politically-relevant issues, such as education, economics, and immigration.

title: participatory budgeting in yanjin county
description: after the yanjin county-supervised village finance system reforms were implemented, the government initiated a participatory budgeting project in two townships to ensure funds were allocated responsibly.

title: northern gateway pipeline – community advisory boards
description: complying with the environmental review process of the joint review panel, enbridge inc. sought public input from a wide range of stakeholders including organizations, landowners, and aboriginal groups regarding the feasibility of a northern gateway pipeline from alberta to b.c.

title: san diego district attorney's youth advisory board
description: the san diego county district attorney’s office engages diverse at-risk high school students to design public service campaigns for their peers that address difficult choices and issues their communities face daily.

title: 'your manassas community resources app': issue reporting & citizen information
description: the "your manassas community resource app” combines features of a standard "city hall" smartphone application with an integrated activities and events platform. this innovation allows for reporting issues to the city, and also better informs citizens about citywide events.

title: los angeles neighborhood councils
description: to unite disenfranchised parts of the city, the citizens of los angeles voted the neighborhood council system into the city charter in 1999; they have created a citywide community of volunteers, increasing civic participation and making government more responsive to local needs.

title: national citizen's initiative on romania's labour code
description: a legislative proposal initiated by the national union block demanding numerous amendments to romania's labour code. the initiative gained the required 15,000 signatures and was submitted to parliament for debate. many of the initiative's proposals were enacted into law.

title: deliberative polling on vermont’s energy future
description: before deciding on future energy options in vermont in the face of two expiring major electricity contracts in 2007, the vermont department of public service wanted to consider the views of the general public, so they held a deliberative poll of randomly-selected participants.

title: participatory budgeting in seville, spain
description: from 2004-2013, roughly 20,000 citizens out of 700,000 took part in delegating 50% of the participatory budget (pb) in seville to select sectors; the initiative was introduced by the united left and the social democratic party coalition government.

title: my neighbourhood: online participatory budgeting in reykjavik, iceland
description: my neighbourhood is the participatory budgeting application of the online better reykjavik citizen consultation platform.

title: scotland's people's juries in social inclusion partnerships
description: under a 'listening to communities’ programme in 1998, seven people’s juries across scotland deliberated on a wide range of subjects, facilitating sessions with jurors, evidence from witnesses and presenting findings to key stakeholders to influence local decision-making.

title: grandview-woodland citizens' assembly
description: the citizens’ assembly set out values and principles shared by grandview-woodland residents, defined their vision for the future of the vancouver neighbourhood and published a set of recommendations in the form of a 30-year development plan to guide city planners' future actions.

title: combined application of deliberatorium and doparie in italy
description: the deliberatorium, online software allowing large-scale deliberation with argumentation maps, and the ‘doparie,’ an intra-party referendum tool, were two democratic innovations used in italy to encourage deliberation and improve decision-making on issues like electoral reform.

title: participatory budgeting in vallejo, california
description: in 2013, vallejo, california was the first u.s. municipality to adopt city-wide participatory budgeting to improve the city’s infrastructure and services, rebuild civic pride, engage underrepresented demographics, and increase government transparency and dialogue with residents.

title: participatory water management in district of humboldt bay
