description: the humboldt bay municipal water district designed and implemented an innovative participatory public planning process about water use, a controversial subject in a drought-prone state. the process resulted in three promising solutions that the district is pursuing.

title: american legion auxiliary's girls state program: civic education in massachussetts
description: annually, girls state takes place across the us. junior girls are brought together for a week-long program to learn about us government, develop leadership skills and learn responsible citizenship through an interactive simulated approach of assuming duties of municipal leaders.

title: participatory budgeting (budżet obywatelski) in sopot, poland
description: sopot’s participatory budgeting initiative has been criticized by its citizens and has been revised repeatedly, but remains a historic beacon of democratic innovations in poland. the process is innovative for its combination of citizen forums, committee-based scrutiny and an open

title: participatory budgeting - vallejo (ca), us
cabildo abierto in pasto, colombia
description: since 1996, the pasto municipality of colombia introduced a successful new system of participatory budgeting called "cabildo abierto" ("open council") whose aims are to discuss issues and find effective solutions by working together as a community.

title: eskil park project: participatory budgeting in haninge, sweden
description: the goals of the haninge municipality project in sweden have been to make eskil park a "living meeting place" and to test new methods such as participatory budgeting and e-dialogue. suggestions for how to invest the money were collected on the municipality website.

title: participatory budgeting in alagoinhas, brazil
description: since 2001, alagoinhas has been one of many brazilian cities to undertake a participatory budgeting initiative, which improves citizen deliberation and civic education.

title: participatory budgeting in aracaju, brazil
description: from 2001 to 2013, the city of aracaju in brazil engaged in participatory budgeting, thereby increasing citizen engagement in democratic deliberation.

title: participatory budgeting in andradina, brazil
description: from 2009 to its abandonment sometime around 2012, andradina, sao paulo used a form of participatory budgeting that involved both online deliberation and face-to-face voting.

title: participatory budgeting in araras, brazil
description: since 2009, araras, brazil undertook a participatory budgeting project, which improves citizen engagement with processes of democratic deliberation.

title: participatory budgeting in araçatuba, brazil
description: a participatory budgeting initiative to engage citizens in deliberative democratic processes has occurred in araçatuba, brazil since 2009.

title: participatory budgeting in bagé, brazil
description: ongoing since 2009, bagé, brazil has had an initiative of participatory budgeting.

title: participatory budgeting in bauru, brazil
description: since 2009, the city of bauru in brazil has been one of many cities to follow porto alegre in implementing a participatory budgeting initiative to improve democratic participation in the country.

title: participatory budgeting in bento gonçalves, brazil
description: bento gonçalves, brazil was one of many cities in the country to implement participatory budgeting, to include citizens in democratic deliberation regarding how resources will be distributed.

title: australian consensus conference on genetically modified food
description: the 1999 australia consensus conference saw a group of 14 randomly-selected diverse citizens hear from academics before being given the chance to deliberate over the role of genetically modified organisms in the food industry.

title: participatory budgeting in la marsa, tunisia
description: participatory budgeting in tunisia has been implemented in four municipalities: la marsa, menzel bourguiba, tozeur and gabès. it is a popular initiative among citizens as a move away from the oppressive authoritarian regime and toward a more integrated state-citizen relationship.

title: participatory planning in nepal
description: participatory planning (pp) was implemented by butwal sub-metropolitan city in 2014, 2015 and 2016, enabling local citizens to engage in deliberative policy-making and budgeting processes.

title: participatory budgeting in pune, india
description: participatory budgeting in pune, india is one of few cases of democratic innovations in india. initiated in 2007, the basic idea was to engage citizens in the process of budget creation by inviting their suggestions regarding municipal budget allocation through an online forum.

title: 2010 participatory budgeting in cologne, germany
description: aiming to improve transparency, legitimacy, and the ultimate results of decision-making processes, the city of cologne implemented participatory budgeting in order to engage citizens in the process of allocating local resources.

title: brazilian conferences on health
description: the building of health policy in brazil since 1986 has used empowering participatory institutions, primarily national conferences. the guidelines approved in conferences have influenced subnational executive decisions as well as the bills proposed nationally in brazil.

title: deliberative polling in the bududa and butalejja districts of uganda
description: a unique case of deliberative polling in the butalejja and bududa districts of uganda's mt. elgon region, members of the public spoke about the local issues of resettlement and land management. the initiative stands out for its success in contributing to development policies.

title: citizen participation in the 2015-2019 strategic plan of kadikoy, turkey
description: the kadıköy municipality in turkey had a 2015-2019 participatory management strategic plan. for five months, ideas collected by surveys, online forums, discussions by citizens and experts and focus meetings were shared with residents of kadıköy and included in the plan.

title: designing kadikoy’s bicycle transport and inonu avenue bike lane altogether (kadikoy, istanbul, turkey)
participatory planning process: 'region of consciousness' austria
description: the "region of consciousness" public engagement process involved citizens in the redesign of the mauthausen and gusen concentration camps to responsibly preserve historical buildings while including ideas for development.

title: participatory wastewater management in san luis obispo county, california
description: in 2008, san luis obispo county embarked on an unprecedented civic engagement effort to encourage public opinions on a community wastewater system that was needed in los osos, an unincorporated community that was entirely served by septic tanks before.

title: violence prevention by engaging youth and immigrant families in san mateo county
description: caron (community alliance to revitalize our neighborhood), an initiative of the san mateo county sheriff’s office, works with schools and youth groups to integrate immigrant families into the community, prevent gang violence, and build positive connections with law enforcement.

title: women’s forum and local workshop for gender equality in kadıköy, turkey
description: the local equality action plan of turkey's kadıköy municipality was established through the participation of local officials, universities, women’s and lgbt+ organizations, ngos, and women/lgbt+ living in kadıköy, all working towards policies of gender equality in an open forum.

title: deliberative participatory budgeting in greater geraldton, australia
description: as part of geraldton's four-year program of deliberative collaborative governance, ‘2029 and beyond’, two minipublics were created to generate trust and legitimacy around budgetary decisions.

title: participatory urban planning workshops for kadife street in kadikoy, istanbul
description: given social issues arising from the kadife neighbourhood in kadıköy, turkey flourishing over its capacity, property and bar owners, social workers, local officials and residents came together in a series of meetings and workshops on urban space, successfully reaching a solution.

title: empowering civil society and combating corruption through right to information act in rajasthan, india
description: the innovative ‘consortium of groups for combating corruption' model implemented in rajasthan, india at the local level successfully curbed corruption and generated transparency via citizen workshops on effectively seeking information on entitlements using existing legislation.

title: south australia's country cabinets
description: country cabinet is an initiative by the south australian government whereby they visit regional locations around the state and hear from local people about matters affecting them and their communities.

title: textizen: application for participatory governance in philadelphia
description: this case study chronicles the city of philadelphia’s development and implementation of textizen, a cell phone application that uses the ubiquitous tool of text messaging to increase civic awareness and participation in local government activities.

title: citizens' jury on dog and cat management in south australia
description: a citizens' jury was asked by the south australian government to explore what measures could reduce the number of unwanted dogs and cats euthanized each year in the state as well as whether de-sexing (neutering) of cats and dogs should be made compulsory in south australia.

title: “asthmapolis”: collaborative participation for city-wide health management in louisville, kentucky
south australian citizens' jury on sharing the roads safely
description: south australia’s second citizens’ jury saw a group of 37 randomly-selected south australians be tasked with finding innovative solutions as to what could be done to ensure that all road users would be able to share the roads safely.

title: black sash making all voices count community-based monitoring project
description: black sash, a non-governmental human rights organisation in south africa, partnered with making all voices count (mavc) in mid-2014 to conduct an independent community-based monitoring pilot project across the nine provinces in south africa.

title: citizen space: participatory platform for online consultation with the scottish government
description: citizen space is a software that allows the scottish government to post consultation questions online to encourage citizen participation and engagement, improving citizen-government interaction. it also allows citizens to post new topics and respond, having their voices heard.

title: citizens jury on creating a safe and vibrant adelaide nightlife
description: the first ever citizens' jury to take place in south australia was convened in 2013 to consider how to ensure a safe and vibrant nightlife in adelaide. 43 randomly-selected citizens met over six months in adelaide and produced seven recommendations to government.

title: decide.madrid.es online participatory budgeting
description: a multi-use online platform, decide.madrid.es allows residents to submit and vote on policy proposals and community project ideas. this entry focuses on the use of the platform during the idea phase of the year participatory budgeting cycle.

title: mornington peninsula shire's conversations on climate change
description: the mornington peninsula shire conversations were a series of twelve meetings held in 2008 to discuss the data of a report which had been recently published on the projected effects of climate change on western australia.

title: citizens jury on creating a safe and vibrant nightlife in sydney, australia
description: in 2014 the city of sydney council convened a citizens' jury of 43 sydneysiders to deliberate on how to create a safe and vibrant nightlife in sydney.

title: participatory budgeting in seoul, south korea
description: begun in 2012, seoul's system of participatory budgeting places emphasis on open proposals and deliberation. although resource intensive, seoul's pb is the first to be enacted in a city of over 10 million people and has a total budget of 50 billion won (40 million usd).

title: you choose: london borough of redbridge council's online budget consultation tool
description: in 2010, the london borough of redbridge council implemented the you choose budget consultation tool, aiming to broaden interactivity between the local council and its residents as well as educate citizens through democratic participation on the online consultation platform.

title: conservation through participation: management of eastern coyotes in new york state
description: a controversial 1991 legislative bill to allow year-round hunting of coyotes was withdrawn by the new york state legislature pending public input via surveys and face-to-face deliberations. the engagement strategies in this process were innovative within a wildlife context.

title: city of melbourne people's panel
description: in 2014 the city of melbourne held its first experience in participatory budgeting, the melbourne's people's panel. the panel comprised a citizens' jury of 43 melburnians who were asked by melbourne city council to comment on the council's 10-year, $5 billion financial plan.

title: participatory arts with young refugees in the uk
description: participatory arts are forms of artistic expression – through media such as drama, video, and photography – that actively engage participants in the process of making art. this article explores three cases in which participatory arts were used to engage young refugees in the uk.

title: 2012 urban planning in kadikoy district of istanbul, turkey
description: this is a teaching case-study on the workshops that residents of kadikoy, turkey participated in regarding the future of kadife street and its social impacts, intending to enlighten the complexities and trade-offs in local governance and the benefits of a participatory approach.

title: city of canada bay council policy panel
description: the city of canada bay council convened a policy panel of 24 randomly selected citizens to make recommendations about how the council could make the most of community facilities. the policy panel followed the success of canada bay's first participatory budgeting in 2012.

title: reclaim november ohio!
description: voters from ohio's heavily divided 16th district came together during three deliberative citizen election forums to identify priorities, interview the candidates, have constructive conversations around core issues, and develop a voters guide based on their findings as a group.

title: participatory evaluation of ict school education programmes (india)
citizens' jury for participatory budgeting in darebin, australia
description: in 2014, the city of darebin council used a participatory budgeting process to engage with the local community on how best to spend the $2 million infrastructure fund. darebin, in the northern suburbs of melbourne, convened a 44-resident citizens' jury to develop recommendations.

title: moorebank intermodal citizens' jury (sydney, au)
description: an organization set up by the australian government to oversee development of a new freight terminal in moorebank, a sydney suburb, established a $1 million 'local benefits fund' for the community and convened a citizens' jury of 18 local residents to decide how best to spend it.

title: marrickville citizens' jury on infrastructure
description: in 2014, marrickville council convened a citizens' jury of 30 local residents and business owners to deliberate on the trade-off between a need for investment in infrastructure and the desire to keep rates low, aiming to solve the problem with greater democratic legitimacy.

title: enabling youth participation through technology: u-report uganda
description: u-report is a sms mobile technology tool developed by unicef to empower youth voices on the social and economic issues affecting their communities. uganda was the first country to pilot and scale the innovative tool of democratic accountability, now used extensively globally.

title: noosa community jury on organic waste management
description: in 2014, noosa council, in queensland, australia, convened a community jury on organic waste management in order to reduce landfill waste. the jury was one of two deliberative processes initiated to improve the council's community engagement.

title: south australian community panel on the south east drainage network
description: the south east drainage network management board, a government agency of south australia, convened a community panel in 2015 to deliberate on funding the ongoing management of a combinations of drains and floodways that underpin agriculture and infrastructure in the region.

title: the guelph neighbourhood support coalition's participatory budgeting
description: the guelph neighbourhood support coalition initiated participatory budgeting in 1999 in order to promote civic participation, deliberation, and democratic decision-making. the initiative has allowed neighbourhoods to allocate funding toward projects such as community centres.

title: tamale deliberative poll (ghana)
description: the resilientafrica network carried out the first west african deliberative poll in the ghanaian city of tamale to provide community driven responses to challenges of sanitation, hygiene and food security in the region, educating the 208 random participants who met with experts.

title: participatory urban planning in kitale, kenya
description: using methodology based on the acknowledgement that various settlements have diverse needs, members of three kenyan settlements were given the opportunity to envision the desired future of their community through neighbourhood urban planning.

title: 1996 united states national issues convention deliberative poll
description: the 1996 national issues convention, was james fishkin’s second attempt at a national us deliberative poll, and perhaps the most publicized one in us history; the $4 million project saw almost 500 randomly selected texans discuss politics, family values, and the economy.

title: public hearings on the construction of the belo monte dam
the june journeys: 2013 free fare protests ('brazilian spring', v for vinegar movement')
description: known variously as the june journeys, the confederation cup riots, the v for vinegar movement, and the brazilian spring, the 2013 protests against public transportation fare increases devolved into a disjointed protest against a variety of social, economic, and political issues.

title: penrith community panel in new south wales, australia
description: penrith city council is facing the challenge of balancing increasing infrastructure and service needs with shrinking resources and budget cuts in the australian centre. in 2015, the council convened its first community panel to ask 34 local citizens how to approach the issue.

title: victoria's citizens' jury on obesity
defective by design
carcross/tagish first nation self-governance and policy making
description: after gaining the right to self-governance in 2005, the ctfn has continued to innovate a system of internal management and decision-making rooted in their history and people.

title: black lives matter (blm)
description: black lives matter (blm) is a movement for racial equality and the end of police brutality towards african americans and the institutionalized oppression and marginalization of black people in the united states and around the world.

title: haida gwaii collaborative land use planning
from stream management to watershed governance: the collaborative restoration of vancouver’s still creek
description: a study of the complex developments and interactions between government, private, and civil society actors behind the shift toward collaborative, community-driven planning in the case of still creek.

title: nhs citizen
fremantle bridge community engagement process
description: a government-led engagement process involving community surveys, stakeholder workshops, and a 1-day deliberative event. officials offered six options for bridge construction and participants were asked for their feedback. the engagement had no apparent effect on policy makers.

title: dogs on inverloch beach community engagement
description: when a local council in victoria, australia introduced a ban on dogs on a local beach, dog owners were outraged. this issue quickly became a contentious one, with the council having to drop its original plan and start over with a community engagement process for a more participatory consultation.

title: protecting the snowies - wild horse management in kosciuszko national park
description: wild horses in australia cause damage to the fragile ecosystem around kosciuszko national park. however, managing the population is a contentious issue involving animal welfare concerns. in order to consider all relevant views on the issue, a community engagement was undertaken.

title: zoom - "how might we design our future city?"
description: zoom was an interactive consultation and exhibition at the national gallery of victoria in australia, as part of the melbourne now exhibition. the project asked its over 500,000 visitors to think about the question "how might we design our future city?"

title: bayside child care future options community panel
description: following the planned transition of two child care centres out of public operation, bayside city council convened a community panel to consider this issue and the future of local child care more broadly.

title: let's talk waste - mornington peninsula community engagement program
description: a series of community engagements on waste management using an open web forum, a telephone survey, and two deliberative forums. close to 1,500 people participated and the results of the consultation helped inform the council's draft waste management strategy.

title: citizens' group for electoral process in pakistan
aawaz voice and accountability
pakistan participatory poverty assessment
description: a participatory poverty assessment (ppa) was implemented in 2001 in pakistan to engage the most marginalized members of society in deliberation on effective anti-poverty action and policies.

title: performance monitoring of pakistan's national assembly from the citizens’ perspective
"what's the big idea?" hepburn shire council's plan
campaspe: our future
telepsychiatry, online clinics and mental health training in chitral, pakistan
description: in 2015, floods and a 7.5-magnitude earthquake resulted in severe property damage as well as psychological and physical trauma for villagers in charum oveer, a remote pakistani village, prompting their participation in online counselling sessions and mental health training.

title: strengthening the future provisions of public secondary education in the inner sydney area
balochistan agriculture project: kitchen gardening
description: the kitchen gardening initiative of the balochistan agricultural project empowers local women to harvest crops to feed their families. the knowledge and skills gained through the initiative has allowed women to improve family nutrition and supplement their income.

title: road trains summit
description: the use of road trains was a contentious issue in western australia. four consensus forums were held in an attempt to draw together some recommendations from stakeholders and the public that the government could base regulations on.

title: western australia's freight network review
description: the freight network review aimed to enable participation in the road transport planning process from all parts of western australia's community, government and industry. it involved several phases including surveys and two consensus forums

title: girls at dhabas
description: girls at dhabas is a grassroots initiative of pakistani women and non-binary individuals committed to challenging restrictive social norms and threats of gendered violence through individual and collective acts of protest.

title: the gascoyne muster - pastoral forums (carnarvon, western australia)
description: pastoral leases in western australia can be a contentious issue. aboriginal peoples, tourism activities and the wider public expect to be able to access lands and denial of access provoked an increase in public attention. the aim of the gascoyne muster was to provide an opportunity for all those with an interest to have a say on the future of pastoral land use.

title: tehreek-e-insaaf's azadi march
taxi industry forum (perth, western australia)
description: following the recommendation of deregulating the taxi industry in western australia, a consensus forum was held with a range of industry and consumer representatives to collect views on the regulation of the taxi industry and to find points of consensus that could be used by the government going forward.

title: okara military farms-women's protest camp (amp)
women's democratic front forum on honour killings (sindh, pakistan)
description: a forum-style dialogue organized in response to the 'honour killing' of celebrity and activist qandeel baloch. the forum sought to increase public awareness of the rise in honour killings and to prompt direct or state action to stop femicide motivated by outdated moral codes.

title: leighton rail marshalling yards - community consensus forum
description: a consensus forum was held to try and gather consensus for the redevelopment of leighton rail yards, an area in fremantle that had been out of use for several years and where previous planning processes had failed to garner local support.

title: scarborough senior high school redevelopment (perth, western australia)
description: when a local high school was closed without consultation, the future development of the land became a contentious issue within the scarborough community. in an attempt to move forward, the state government pursued a community consultation with a consensus forum.

title: reid highway extension citizens' jury
description: this citizens' jury in western australia was convened in order to help the state government decide whether and how to extend a local highway. given that local residents did not wish to have a highway exit near their homes, the topic had become a contentious one.

title: albany administration centre site citizens' jury
description: albany local council wanted to move their administration centre out of the city centre, whilst the wa state government disagreed. a citizens' jury was held to understand the community's views on the topic.

title: corporate concurrent citizens' juries
description: in 2003 the new department of planning and infrastructure undertook three concurrent citizens' juries. the juries were primarily used to give dpi staff an insight into deliberative democratic processes, but also to gain feedback on the future work of the new department.

title: scarborough beach deliberative survey
description: following considerable local opposition to the proposed redevelopment of the scarborough beach precinct in perth, a deliberative survey was conducted to understand if the community's views would be more united following deliberation.

title: "inspiration participation" knowledge sharing & translation event (brussels, belgium)
description: a knowledge sharing and translation event for participatory democracy practitioners, experts and elected public officials. the meeting was convened by the government as part of it's initiative to increase/improve government-citizen communications.

title: islamabad katchi abadi community database
north-east corridor extension - choosing an industrial site in western australia
review of western australia's agricultural lime routes
description: agricultural lime is extracted on the coast of western australia and requires hauling inland for farming. the haulage routes for this impact on surrounding communities and thus their input into reviewing these routes was of interest to the planning process.

title: dialogue with the pilbara: newman tomorrow
description: newman is an isolated town in the pilbara region of western australia that relies heavily on iron ore mining. dialogue with the pilbara: newman tomorrow was set up with the aim of bringing newman citizens together to deliberate on the future of a sustainable town.

title: bassendean train station enquiry-by-design
description: this design workshop was held to help decide on a structure for the renewal and redevelopment of a train station in perth, wa. local community members and stakeholders worked towards some consensus options for the design.

title: the citizen's archive of pakistan (oral history project)
national multi-level stakeholder consultation  (trans action khyber pakhtunkhwa)
port hedland enquiry-by-design
description: port hedland is a town in western australia that relies heavily on resource extraction and mining. due to an expansion in this industry, the town needed to consider its future infrastructure and housing needs. a community engagement process was undertaken to consider how to move forward, combining three different participatory methods.

title: glenunga community hub
description: in the adelaide suburb of glenunga, a new community hub was proposed and a community consultation conducted in order to better understand the community's needs.

title: eurobodalla citizens' jury
description: faced with reductions in funding alongside an increased demand for services, eurobodalla shire council convened a citizens' jury to help address this challenge. this process was mirrored by another local council in greater bendigo.

title: city of greater bendigo citizens' jury
description: faced with a reduction in funding alongside increased demand for services, the city of greater bendigo in victoria held a citizens' jury to address this challenge with the considered view of the community. the jury were asked to consider how the council should spend its money in the coming years.

title: get to know nuclear: nuclear fuel cycle engagement in south australia
description: a multi-component engagement initiative on the nuclear fuel cycle including two citizens' juries and a larger, state-wide initiative including open forums, town halls, and online surveys. the process was controversial, attracting protests both inside and outside the jury.

title: infrastructure victoria engagement process
description: infrastructure victoria is a statutory authority set up by the state government to address victoria's infrastructure needs. it convened two citizens' juries to consider how to meet the state's changing infrastructure needs.

title: future melbourne 2026
geelong citizens' jury
description: a citizens' jury of 100 were convened to consider the future representative structure of geelong city council, after the existing council was dismissed by the state government.

title: the queensland plan
watershed governance in coquitlam river: fostering participation through integrated and inclusive watershed planning
description: the coquitlam river watershed roundtable is a holistic and integrated approach for governing and conserving the coquitlam river watershed, involving a democratically formed ‘core committee' and participatory workshops to engage the public and stakeholders.

title: participatory budgeting in the town of mutoko
toronto planning review panel 2015-2017
description: a 32-member advisory body of residents randomly selected through a civic lottery. the panel represents the diversity of toronto’s population and broadens engagement by bringing new voices into the planning process.

title: gender fender - the 13th association for women in development international forum (september 2016)
description: the 13th association for women in development (awid) international forum was held in bahia, brazil in mid september 2016. the 2016 forum brought together 1700 activists from over 140 countries.

title: imperial metals protest
citizens' reference panel on the mental health action plan for canada
description: mass was commissioned by the mental health commission of canada (mhcc) to gather 36 randomly-selected canadians to hear from mental health leaders and deliberate on policy recommendations to shape mhcc's strategic plan for the first ever national citizens' reference panel.

title: metrolinx residents’ reference panel on the davenport community rail overpass
description: metrolinx commissioned mass to assemble a 36-resident reference panel who deliberated over a series of meetings on recommendations to help inform the design and delivery of the davenport community rail overpass project.

title: calgary citizens' commission on municipal infrastructure
description: the city of calgary commissioned a 36-member citizens' commission to review the city's infrastructure investment model and to propose revisions to the strategy.

title: meet me at the bell tower (mm@bt)
toronto residents’ reference panel on supervised injection services
description: the city of toronto established a 36-member citizens' reference panel to produce a set of recommendations to address public concerns over the location and operation of proposed supervised injection service sites.

title: lebanese garbage crisis
bc services card user panel on digital services
description: the provincial government of bc commissioned a 36-member user panel to provide recommendations on the new chip-enabled services card and digital services plan. the panel's recommendations were accepted and integrated into a set of long-term principles and short-term actions.

title: metrolinx regional residents’ reference panel on transportation investment
description: 36 residents from across the greater toronto hamilton area (gtha) convened to understand the transportation needs and priorities in the region. they made recommendations to inform metrolinx's strategy for raising funds to make long-term, sustainable investments in gtha's transit.

title: ontario ministry of consumer services reference panel on the condominium act
description: a 36-member reference panel commissioned by the ontario ministry of consumer services to create recommendations on an update to the 2001 condominium act. the panel was asked to meet for a second time in 2013 to review the first draft and provide further input.

title: halton region citizens’ reference panel on strategic priorities 2015
description: after the successful 2011 citizens' reference panel, halton region commissioned mass lbp to develop another 36-resident panel to inform its 2015-2018 strategic action plan on citizen's concerns and priorities.

title: halton region citizens’ reference panel on strategic priorities 2011
description: the halton region citizens' reference panel involved 36 randomly-selected participants deliberating on the community's priorities  and challenges in order to make informed policy recommendations for the regional council.

title: ottawa hospital patients' reference panel on clinical services transformation
description: the ottawa hospital convened a reference panel to guide changes to its cancer treatment program. 36 randomly selected patients and family members met over three saturdays to deliberate on and provide recommendations on making the cancer program more patient- and family-centred.

title: democracy and election monitoring (good governance) project of the justice, development and peace commission (ijebu-ode chapter), ogun state, nigeria
description: the democracy and election monitoring (good governance) project provided a forum for the citizens of ogun state in nigeria to express their political opinions, ensure free and fair elections, and hold elected leaders accountable for their campaign promises.

title: deliberative participatory budgeting in puxing subdistrict, shanghai
description: in puxing subdistrict, shanghai, in 2015, deliberative polling® was embedded into a participatory budgeting initiative. one of the first in urban china, it successfully integrated public participation and deliberation in allocating money from a neighborhood self-governance fund.

title: the cppcc biweekly consultation forum in china
the voto mobile polling platform in ghana - "surveylink" and “mobile for social inclusive governance”
description: the ghana-based tech company voto mobile developed surveylink which enables democratic engagement via polls to gather data from mobile users, and launched the pilot project “mobile for social inclusive governance” to consult citizens, resulting in improved policy formulation.

title: public participation in drafting a strategy for facing demographic changes on the municipal level (tuningen, germany)
children's council (madrid)
project green bloc pilot: the riley park neighbourhood (vancouver, bc)
description: a three year test of the green bloc neighbourhood strategy brought city-level calls to action into realization through individual and community-level consultations, education sessions, and direct action. the pilot project was successful and has since been expanded.

title: reddit requests for comments on differential pricing in canada
la tabacalera
neighborhood theater
demoenergy - the transformation of the energy system as the engine for democratic innovations
the citizen participation and open government application project
digidem guide
collaborative writing for citizen participation
citizen participation tool for standards consensus
democracy earth web app for public participation
description: democracy earth aims to develop a web application that enables a secure voting solution, based on block-chain technology and the philosophy of liquid democracy.

title: turnómetro
description: a web tool which enables remote deliberation and aims to facilitate balanced and efficient discussions in order to improve public participation.

title: empujando juntos
description: empujando juntos is a collaborative-design project which aims to develop a free, open source web application which can facilitate deliberation.

title: collegno participatory report 2016 [italian]
st. michael's residents’ health services panel
description: a 28-member citizens' reference panel commissioned by st. michael's to provide recommended improvements to the health services they provide to toronto's inner city. the panel met 8 times over the course of the year before issuing a final set of principles and priorities.

title: airport: let's talk about it ("aeroporto parliamone"), tuscany, italy
description: a regional participatory process coordinated by three municipalities to inform citizens and gather feedback on proposed renovations to the florence airport. five face-to-face meetings were held but the process ended in political disagreements and stakeholder discontent.

title: the seventy-fourth gadaa general assembly on environmental protection
open new york
e-qual
open data initiative (alameda county, usa)
town meetings in massachusetts
description: town meetings in massachusetts generally follow the new england (open) format which gives all voters residing within the relevant jurisdiction a say on everything from budgets to zoning laws. citizens place items on a 'warrant' which are then discussed and voted on by all.

title: participatory budgeting madagascar
description: to increase government transparency and reduce corruption while implementing the world bank's decentralization policy recommendation, madagascar implemented participatory budgeting initiatives in nine municipalities.

title: vila nova community garden - goiânia - goiás
participatory budgeting in milan: 2015-2016 cycle
description: beginning in 2015, milan's participatory budget contains four phases and covers two years. a multi-channel approach using online, deliberative, and informal activities, was adopted to increase levels of participation. oversight of the chosen projects is also open to the public.

title: flood risk management plan of the po basin [italian]
afghanistan national solidarity program
description: a joint effort between the government of afghanistan and the world bank to to extend the reach of government services, spur development, and foster participation in civil society through the creation of gender-equal neighborhood-level community development corporations.

title: montréal fossil fuel public consultation
veneto by bicycle. opportunities for tour operators [italian]
el-kfoor village community committees (el-minia, upper egypt)
description: the community committee of el-kfoor village improved government transparency and accountability by facilitating communication between the el-kfoor community development association and community members who collaborated on environmental sanitation and waste management.

title: participatory budget 2016 municipality of mira [italian]
nola for life
participatory budgeting in vicenza, italy
description: the vicenza city council introduced its first process of participatory budgeting from april to december 2016. the main purpose of this initiative was to empower citizens making them able to make proposals and then to vote about proposals related to improvement of public spaces.

title: the 1% support scheme: participatory budgeting in ichikawa city (japan)
description: beginning in fy 2005 ichikawa's participatory budgeting scheme involves citizens in the distribution of tax dollars to ngos and citizen activities. the project empowered citizens by raising awareness on the use of taxes in the community development process.

title: councils for the rights of the child and adolescent (brazil)
description: formed in 1990, the councils for the rights of the child and adolescent formulate and monitor the implementation of youth-specific public policy. the councils are present at the municipal, state, and national level and their existence is required for funding acquisition.

title: occupy flagstaff house (#occupyflagstaffhouse)
description: organized by the concerned ghanaians for responsible government, about 500 participants occupied flag staff house, the office and residence of president john dramani mahama, to protest government corruption and petition for government action to address numerous social ills.

title: regional landscape plan of friuli venezia giulia
description: a participatory process aimed to protect, enhance, and manage certain landscapes within the autonomous regional territory in italy, in part by defining strategic guidelines for its sustainable development.

title: agreement for the autonomy of south tyrol - reform of the trentino statute [italian]
newcastle udecide participatory budgeting pilot ‘cleaner, greener, safer’ 2006
description: a participatory budgeting pilot held in 2006 in the three wards of newcastle, concerning environmental, security and other community-building issues. the pilot was successful and the udecide programme continues to run across the city.

title: participatory budgeting in yaounde, cameroon
description: participatory budgeting in yaoundé was initiated in 2006 to tackle corruption, to boost citizen participation in the decision making process, and engage government representatives directly with the citizenry. sms reminders were successfully used to boost participation in 2012.

title: referendum on bolzano airport 2016 [italian]
uk referendum on eu membership (2016)
description: a non-binding referendum on whether the uk should remain a member of the european union. voter turnout was 72% and the decision to leave the union won with 51.89% voting 'yes'. the outcome has been termed 'brexit' for 'british exit' and remains controversial.

title: public confrontation on the bologna bypass project
description: "confronto pubblico — passante di bologna" (public confrontation — bypass of bologna") was a consultation process concerning the strengthening of the motorway and ring road system of the bologna metropolitan area.

title: ataldegmé i participate for soliera [italian]
villa tunari–san ignacio de moxos highway consultation (tipnis, bolivia)
description: public consultations were called after protests were held against a highway that would cross a national park and indigenous territory. opponents criticized the process as insincere and alleged intimidation and bribery. the highway remains under construction.

title: participatory budgeting in ilo, peru (1999- )
description: facing rapid urban expansion, ngos, neighbourhood committees and civil society actors joined forces with the municipal government to develop a sustainable development plan into which the participatory budget was integrated in 1999.

title: referendum on mining in tambogrande (piura, peru)
description: a public referendum on mining exploitation by the ministry of energy and mines and a canadian mining company. the first of its kind in peru and one of the first in latin america, the referendum became a model for future citizen engagement on social conflicts.

title: water service co-management in cochabamba, bolivia
description: in 1999, a broad coalition of civil society actors protested against price increases and community water system expropriation following the privatization of water services in the city of cochabamba. a system of co-management was developed in 2004.

title: 2016 special session of the united nations general assembly on the world drug problem (ungass)
description: a one year multi-disciplinary, multi-stakeholder gathering on national drug policy and substance use hosted by mexico's ministry of foreign affairs and the inter-american drug abuse control commission which stalled.

title: the participatory path for the sustainable planning of the municipalities of calice ligure and rialto [italian]
public debate on the new port of livorno
description: in the months from april to june 2016, the public debate (dibattito pubblico, dp) on the development and redevelopment project of the port of livorno took place, culminating in the presentation of the final document on 21 july.

title: referendum for the carousel of the bear, pistoia [italian]
description: since 1947, every 25 july, the day of san jacopo, patron saint of the city, the giostra dell'orso has been held in pistoia. the gory aspects for the horses involved in the exhibition have raised protests and controversies that the municipality has decided to tackle with a discussion path and a referendum.

title: use of montreal's right to initiate public consultations on the state of urban agriculture
description: montreal's right of initiative to public consultation was invoked by when a petition demanding audience with municipal officials on the state of urban agriculture received 29,000 signatures. there were no immediate outcomes.

title: strategicancona 2025: shaping the future
description: strategicancona 2025 giving shape to the future was a project by the municipality of ancona to engage citizens and stakeholders in the urban development process, by contributing their knowledge or proposals to the local administration's strategic plan.

title: black forest national park public consultation process (baden-württemberg, germany)
description: public consultations were held during the planning of a large national park so that final decisions were informed by local knowledge and were in keeping with citizen demand. the process was helpful to policy makers as it returned a diversity of opinions and suggestions.

title: public consultation on refugee placement (constance, germany)
description: public consultations were held on two new refugee placements. efforts to engage citizens involved minimal participation but what opinions citizens could articulate were taken into account by the deciding authorities.

title: landscape contract for the mountain areas of foligno, trevi and sellano [italian]
mining and land conflict disputes: a grassroots approach (tanchara, ghana)
description: consensus building assemblies grounded in local structures and knowledge of the upper-west region successfully created an inclusive coalition of support, empowered women, established biological community protocols, and lobbied against a government approved mining scheme.

title: haining petition deliberation and review team, china
description: in september 2014, haining, china, established a petition review panel with a hundred people, introduced the mass "jury" model, established a multi-level "bank of 100 reviewers", and selected petition review panels based on the guiding principles of neutrality, diversification, and socialization. public comment on difficult letters and visits will help resolve conflicts and disputes.

title: deliberative poll on the role of married women (guangming village, china)
the longbiao group’s deliberative conversations (zeguo township, china)
description: the longbiao group’s deliberative conversations were part of a broader series of democratic meetings in zeguo township. the conversations provided an opportunity for education and training, a first step in developing an improved relationship between management and workers.

title: linhai’s grassroots deliberative democracy
description: the linhai municipal party committee is actively exploring the establishment of a grassroots consultation mechanism led by the party organization, and introducing consultation democracy into grassroots social governance.

title: the youngstars foundation’s 2015 post-election youth participation and engagement initiative
description: the failures of nigeria's civilian government gave rise to the youngstars foundation who committed to a campaign aimed at educating and mobilizing youths to improve participatory democracy and good governance through active post-election engagement of elected representatives.

title: milli hakimiyet park redevelopment process (kadiköy, istanbul, turkey)
description: when locals expressed concern over a park's redevelopment, the municipality pursued a participatory approach to its design and development. through a community meeting and focus-groups, a mutually-acceptable outcome was reached between locals and officials.

title: regulations.gov
description: regulations.gov is designed to facilitate public access to federal regulatory content. it provides a platform for members of the public to access and comment on the regulatory documents of participating agencies, which are normally published on the federal register.

title: information intermediary initiative: western pennsylvania regional data center
description: the w pennsylvania data center is a community information intermediary, providing the technological and legal infrastructure necessary for open data sharing and use between public institutions, citizens, academics, and civil society groups.

title: smart chicago
description: chicago's 'array of things' is a collaborative effort among leading scientists, universities, local government, and communities to collect real-time data on the city’s environment, infrastructure, and activity for research and public use.

title: ilion teen municipal council: living together in a multicultural world (2015)
description: part of europe's annual local democracy week, the 1st teenagers' municipal council brought students from five local high schools to debate multiculturalism and its impact on the city. debate followed the format of a municipal council meeting using robert's rules of order.

title: city hall to go
rio braga project: participatory environmental action for the protection and enhancement of rio este
description: the rios project started in spain in 1997 and the municipality of braga joined in 2015. the city council of braga challenged citizens to assume the role of kingfisher to help clean up the east river, which runs through the city.

title: brazil's prison system: the first national meeting of community councils (2012)
description: the first national meeting of community councils sought to advance the perspectives of the councils, promote national articulation on common guidelines for control and social participation in criminal execution and expand the counselors' view on public policies.

title: west pokot county participatory budget hearings (kenya)
description: west pokot is amongst the top ten marginalized counties in kenya with a poverty rate of 68.7%. participatory budgeting is empowering residents to take control of budgetary decisions and to realize their development needs and priorities.

title: cascais participatory budget in portugal (2010-2016)
description: cascais started in 2016 the sixth year of the op, having been highly successful since the first edition. the good results have been interpreted as a product of the design, the participants' ability to mobilize, and the credibility of the process with public opinion.

title: informal participation in lango sub-region, northern uganda
description: ordinary people in northern uganda participate in informal settings on a daily basis, away from the gaze of those in power. informal settings allow people to speak their minds with their friends and family, exploring the legitimacy, potential, and power of their concerns.

title: the first fórum dos cidadãos citizens' assembly (lisbon, portugal)
description: the first citizens' assembly organized by the non-profit citizens' forum (fórum dos cidadãos) in lisbon deliberated a proposal to 'improve communication between citizens and politicians.' the outcomes were communicated to politicians and members of the public.

title: women's radio listening groups in kenya
description: kenya's radio listening groups and radio programmes promote gender equality and women's empowerment by disseminating the information necessary for women to claim their rights as citizens and to claim access to government services.

title: "interaction of the three cooperatives" and the innovation of social governance
community based health insurance in ethiopia
description: community based health insurance schemes partially fulfill the ethiopian government's long term goal of improving healthcare by mobilizing domestic resources, improving access to healthcare services, and increasing the quality of services provided.

title: participatory forest management in ethiopia: bonga case study
description: now formally recognized by the state, the practice of participatory forest management in bonga has decentralized specific property rights from the state to the community, devolved the administration of forest resource sustainability, and minimized deforestation.

title: the ghanaian women’s manifesto movement
facebook, mamfakinch, and the february 20 movement in morocco
description: using facebook and the citizen-led online open access site 'mamfakinch', activists organized a broad based movement in morocco on february 20, 2011. the online spaces acted as a safe public sphere, allowing activists to deliberate and coordinate their actions.

title: implementation of the makueni county participatory budgeting framework (fy 2015-2016)
description: suffering from elite capture and low representation, makueni county developed and implemented a new framework for participatory budgeting focusing on the village and sub-ward levels. the new framework has increased participation and representation of lower-class individuals.

title: participatory budgeting in lisbon, portugal
description: the lisbon city council adopted participatory budgeting on july 9th, 2008. from 2008 to 2016 – 5,570 proposals were submitted, 1829 of them were selected and a total of 31, 205,688.00 euros have been allocated to 105 projects. the program is ongoing.

title: chuangyehuayuan's residents’ participation in neighborhood governance (shenzhen, china)
description: chuangyehuayuan residents independently set up a democratic and deliberative “lou zhang (building manager) association” to make collective decisions about the neighbourhood.

title: we are molenbeek "wam1080" (brussels)
description: we are molenbeek (wam1080) was a citizens' panel on radicalization and community reconciliation. discussions encompassed the causes of radicalization, preventative measures, and current and future approaches to integration.

title: the mazdoor kisan party & the hashtnagar peasant movement (1970-77)
description: led by the mazdoor kisan party, peasants campaigned for landlords to implement tenancy law and rent control. the movement was successful, empowering those involved and forcing the state apparatus and government to become more accountable to the demands of the peasantry.

title: developing a framework for the ruhr region's energy transition
description: part of the joint "energy transition ruhr" project, this initiative focused on creating a framework to guide energy transition at the municipal level taking into account local social and cultural circumstances.

title: framework program for the implementation of the energy transition in the municipalities of the ruhr area
“a peoples democracy”: the citizens energy manifesto, ghana 2016
description: in july of 2016 the african center for energy policy ghana launched a campaign and series of regional forums to demand democratic, accountable governance of the energy sector. the resulting manifesto was published before the national election to influence candidate platforms.

title: the republics of coimbra (repúblicas em coimbra)
description: the repúblicas are community houses for coimbra university students whose history dates back to the 14th century. the houses have played an important role in the civic life of the university and its students, acting as political collectives and spaces of community organization.

title: the decentralization of malawi's political system
description: beginning in 1995, malawi's process of decentralization faced a lack of state legitimacy and serious financial constraints. in 2005 the government began to incorporate traditional leadership to achieve the participatory outcomes that decentralization had intended to produce.

title: public debate termoli 2020: let's change the face of the city, together [english]
the tap gas pipeline project in puglia, italy
description: a participatory process on the trans adriatic pipeline (tap) project in puglia. the participants in the open public debate had a generally negative perception of tap, but it is ultimately still under construction.

title: the makoko sustainable regeneration plan
description: a multi-sector program to regenerate makoko’s public services. based on uk models of neighbourhood management, the process improves community infrastructure and local urban governance and participation.

title: participatory budgeting in paris, france
description: the participatory budget in paris is the largest ever implemented in the world. this case is notable for its scale and scope, for its reliance on digital technology, and the sociopolitical context: a city which has historically given little room for citizen participation.

title: marinaleda: a self-managed village
description: when the mayor was elected in 1979, he established a participatory democracy based on direct citizen action within marinaleda. all decisions are taken during general assemblies, there is a participatory budget, and the housing is self-built.

title: les amies du parc des gorilles: collectively reappropriating the marconi-alexandra sector (montreal, canada)
description: les amies du parc des gorilles brings together residents of the petite-patrie district of montreal who wish to collectively re-appropriate land in the marconi-alexandra sector to restore an urban natural space and develop a landscaped public park.

title: un jardin pour tous: a self-shared space (montreal, canada)
description: the garden for all aims to obtain local and experimental food production, while respecting natural cycles and saving energy, and thus create a self-shared space.

title: the place shamrock public consultation
description: a public consultation conducted with different users to identify their needs and expectations vis-à-vis shamrock square. the permanent project which was inaugurated in 2018 reflects the expressed wishes.

title: the national system of development councils in guatemala (sistema nacional de consejos de desarrollo - siscode)
description: the sistema nacional de consejos de desarrollo (siscode) is the main means of participation of the mayan, xinca and garífuna and non-indigenous populations in public management to carry out the democratic development planning process.

title: new orleans citizen participation program
description: one of just a few citizen participation programs in the united states, the new orleans cpp model was, itself, created through a participatory process. the cpp offers a 'top layer' of communication between existing governing structures and neighbourhood associations.

title: the kahnawake community decision making process
description: the mohawk council of kahnawake implemented a system of governance based on consensus decision-making called the community decision making process (cdmp), as both a declaration of sovereignty and as a refusal of colonial forms of governance.

title: edmonton citizens' jury on internet voting
description: a citizens' jury process was used by the city of edmonton and the university of alberta in order for local officials to evaluate the possibility of using internet voting in future municipal elections, starting with a 2013 pilot project.

title: jato spazio idee [italian]
arma your redemption: participatory staging project for the station of piscinola - scampia (naples) [italian]
einhorn-tunnel citizen dialogue, schwäbisch gmünd, germany
description: a citizen dialogue on the biological and environmental effects of engine exhaust from the einhorn tunnel. the results of the consultation helped inform the decision not to install air filters.

title: strategies for citizen participation in kressbronn
citizen dialogue group for suspension bridge planning in rottweil 2016
description: a cross-section of citizens were gathered in order to deliberate the city of rottweiler's plans for a suspension bridge. the dialogue group formulated recommendations for the municipal council, and a referendum on the bridge passed with about 72 percent of valid votes cast.

title: user survey on kikuz / kita raiteberg 2016
description: with the renovation and expansion of the children's cultural center (kikuz) in konstanz, educational, cultural and leisure activities could be expanded. after the renovation, a new day care center (kita rebberg) was established, and a survey was conducted on these developments.

title: participatory development of the mission statement for tengen 2030
description: in 2017, the city of tengen 2030 was adopted as a model after a year of development. it features development goals as well as concrete projects and measures. participation does not end with the adoption of the mission statement; an annual event will be held to report on the implementation status and make changes.

title: participatory renovation of the eichendorff school in gottmadingen, germany
strategy and planning workshop with the youth council engen
allensbach citizens' dialogue on the future
description: a citizens' dialogue held in allensbach, germany, the initiative "wie lebst du morgen" (how will you live tomorrow?) involved citizens discussing the future of their city.

title: egg 2030 - shaping together
description: facing an influx of new immigrants and refugees, the "egg 2030 - shaping together" event aimed to engage citizens in deliberation on how to successfully integrate this new population into the village community of egg, germany.

title: deliberations with ontario citizens on mammography screening
description: four public deliberations were organized by mcmaster university to study public knowledge, awareness, and perceptions of mammography screening.

title: consultation on canada's national security and bill c-51
description: a country-wide engagement with citizens, stakeholders, and experts on issues related to national security and the protection of rights and freedoms. feedback from the consultations helped inform changes to national security policy and the 2015 anti-terrorism act (bill c-51).

title: online consultations on canada's cyber security
description: a 2-month consultation to review existing measures to protect canadian citizens and critical infrastructure from cyber threats. three twitter chats were held and an online portal was opened for citizens to discuss the security and economic dimensions of canada's digital future.

title: public review of canada's environmental assessment process
description: an extensive review of canada's environmental assessment process including hearings with an expert panel, an open public commenting period, and a government-led engagement with stakeholders and indigenous groups.

title: public review of canada's international assistance policy
description: beginning may 18, 2016, global affairs canada undertook an international public consultation on its international assistance policy and funding framework. over 15,000 people were consulted in over 65 countries.

title: wing civil parish neighbourhood plan (buckinghamshire, uk)
description: passed by parliament in 2011, the uk localism act devolved power over planning and development to community and local governments. the civil parish of wing used the localism act's provisions to undertake a series of public consultations on the neighbourhood's development plans.

title: the digital democracy project
description: digital democracy was an initiative aiming to improve government transparency for residents of california as well as media by providing access to state legislative hearings and debates online.

title: southampton youth forum (2016-present)
description: the southampton youth forum provides a platform for young people (aged 13-25) to influence the city’s legislative agenda through campaigns that seek to shape both the direction of policy and its implementation to ensure that it works as efficiently as possible for youth.

title: participatory budgeting as prisoner reintegration
description: a canadian non-profit organization dedicated to prisoner reintegration used participatory budgeting to introduce current and former prisoners and community members to small-group deliberation, decision-making, and voting on the allocation of 5% of the organization's budget.

title: interactive community consultations on austin's public engagement strategy
description: a month-long consultation including a 'virtual' town hall on the future of austin city council's public engagement strategy. in-person and remote/virtual channels of participation were used to allow maximal public interaction, deliberation, and real-time feedback.

title: uk referendum on the parliamentary voting system (2011)
description: the replacement of 'first-past-the-post' with the 'alternative-vote' system of parliamentary election was put to referendum in may 2011. 42% of uk citizens took part, 67.9% of whom voted 'no'. the alternative-voting process was thus rejected by parliament two months later.

title: the trussel trust ‘more than food’ programme (england)
description: the mtf programme recognizes poverty as a complex social problem. beginning in 2014, the initiative supports people in a variety of ways including money management, basic cooking and nutrition skills, and holiday clubs for children.

title: the proposed citizens' assembly on australian climate change policy
description: plans for a citizens’ assembly were drawn up in 2010 to consult with citizens on australia's climate change policy. designed as a participatory method of policy formulation, the assembly was abandoned and replaced with a panel of experts.

title: morris area rural climate dialogues
description: the first local event in a state-wide public dialogue initiative, the morris area climate dialogue used the citizens' jury method to educate residents about the local effects of climate change and to encourage collaboration and reflection on  collective action.

title: scottish independence referendum 2014
description: on the 18th september 2014 scottish residents voted in a legally binding referendum on their country's independence from the uk. unlike many referenda, a citizens were engaged in dialogue and education in the months leading up to the vote. the 'no' vote won 55.3% to 44.7%.

title: debating uk education reform: model westminster event 2014
description: a one-day deliberative event convened by uk non-profit model westminster to allow youth ages 19-21 to debate proposed reforms to the education system. the views and opinions voiced throughout the event were collated into a report presented to the british cabinet.

title: world wide views' global consultation on biodiversity
description: in 2012, the wwv consultation on biodiversity involved over 3000 participants over 34 citizen consultations in 25 countries on the same day. the consultation was part of wider citizen participation project to identify and ensure public opinion is considered by policy makers.

title: uk regional police independent advisory groups
description: independent advisory groups provide the hampshire constabulary with feedback on how best to serve their communities. the groups are made up of independent citizen volunteers who meet regularly to discuss issues of policing and law enforcement.

title: conversation corps austin, tx
description: the conversation corps initiative trains community members to facilitate open dialogues on topics and issues identified by three public agencies as worthy of public input. the feedback generated during dialogues is transmitted to decision-makers who use it to inform policy.

title: uk election watch 2017: collaborative fact-checking to combat 'fake news'
description: a collaboration between ngos first draft news and full fact to 1) monitor and identify news items and sources, and 2) verify those news items and provide the public and news media with up-to-the-minute analysis and reports of their veracity.

title: ontario "budget talks" participatory budgeting (2015- )
description: begun in 2015, ontario's budget talks is a participatory budgeting program that allows citizens to propose and vote on various public projects. the process was changed in 2017 to include deliberative workshops.

title: somaliland constitutional referendum
description: a national referendum on a constitution which affirmed somaliland's independence as a democratic state with a multiparty political system. the referendum passed with 97% of the vote and the new constitution was adopted but not recognized by somalia or international bodies.

title: microfinance in uganda
description: microfinancing has been used for development purposes in uganda since 2000s. the alternative system of funding was pursued as a way to avoid flawed top-down development strategies and to empower people in a country not yet able to compete in international markets.

title: 2017 budget talks ontario
description: the third year of ontario's participatory budgeting programme allowed citizens to propose and vote on five projects to be granted a share of $5 million. the process saw

title: plaine commune transportation health impact assessment (paris, france)
description: individuals living near or with the potential to be affected by the large transportation extensions were invited to a series of focus groups by the plaine commune in paris. the initiative was successful in identifying the wishes and health concerns of the commune's population.

title: participatory budgeting in merced county, california
description: a county-wide participatory budgeting initiative that failed to take off and ended up only being implemented in one district. despite the lack of confidence expressed by other city officials, the supervisors of district 2 went ahead with the public budget which was successful.

title: tennessee's long-range transportation plan
description: facing a coming budget deficit, the tennessee department of transportation pursued multi-method communication and strategy development between the public, stakeholders, and officials. the resulting plan covers 8 policy areas and takes local- and regional-level needs into account.

title: coffee cup revolution (vancouver, canada)
description: the annual coffee cup revolution is community-led and run by low-income residents. the event includes a pop-up recycling depot, roundtable discussions, and awareness raising around issues of sustainable living, green waste disposal, and economic inclusion.

title: tides of change: cormorant island economic development plan
description: an inclusive, comprehensive economic development plan written for residents, by residents through a year-long series of public consultations and community engagements. the resulting plan effectively synthesized community visions into short- and long-term policies and strategies.

title: águeda participatory budget (portugal)
description: a participatory budgeting initiative implemented following other citizen engagement projects both in the city of agueda and in other cities across the country. the scheme was introduced in 2015 and has been running ever since. participation is both in-person and online.

title: public participation in the anthemountas river basin management plan
description: a project of public participation in water governance in greece, on managing the anthemountas river basin, under the wfd provisions and the funding of eu life programme.

title: public hearings on the termination of anencephalic fetuses
description: before legislating on the issue, public hearings were held to allow citizens and stakeholders to testify and present information on the termination of anencephalic fetuses. it is unclear if the hearings had any effect on policy making.

title: 2013 federal supreme court public hearings on campaign financing (brazil)
description: public hearings convened by the supreme court to determine the constitutionality of electoral donations per legal person, the limit imposed on said donations, and use of donations during campaigning. the results had little obvious influence on the final vote in the legislature.

title: first national conference on public security (brazil)
description: 2009 saw the first of an ongoing series of national conferences on public security policy and management. the participatory forum allowed for citizens, civil society organizations, and private professionals to interact and collectively inform public security policy.

title: regional forums of the elderly, northwest belo horizonte (brazil)
description: regional forums are held for members of municipal councils for the elderly to discuss and debate issues of aging and social assistance with civil society representatives, elected officials, and service providers. the forums allow information and opinion sharing but little else.

title: dahlia campus for health & well-being (denver, colorado)
description: a citizen engagement initiative, ‘the dahlia project’ included in-depth public consultations on the development of a new mental health centre after local residents protested against the construction. the center continues to pursue local partnerships and capacity building.

title: energy transition north rhine-westphalia (2015-2017)
description: a research initiative to plan and implement various participatory processes to direct north rhine-westphalia's transition to clean energy.

title: the democracy project: youth participation and democratic education (burnaby, british columbia)
description: a youth-led project which allowed a group of high school students to become more democratically involved in the regional school board. the project changed the way high-level school decision are made by including student representatives in the process.

title: enertransruhr: cultural mapping of the ruhr region energy transition
description: the enertransruhr project analyses and develops strategies for germany's transition to clean energy with a focus on increasing energy efficient buildings in ruhr region cities like bottrop, dortmund, and oberhausen.

title: zapatista school
description: the escuelita zapatista is a path of education from below in which thousands of people from all over the world have been able to share, together with the indigenous zapatistas, forms of participation aimed at the collective exercise of the principles of autonomy and democracy.

title: ict facilitation of citizen participation, open government, and public service delivery in madrid
description: an initiative to make madrid a 'smart city': one where citizens are digitally connected with each other, with elected officials, and with public services through various ict platforms and devices. goals include increased democratic participation and government responsiveness.

title: citizens' assembly on brexit
description: in 2017, a two-weekend citizens' assembly on post-brexit eu relations was attended by a representative sample of uk citizens. the deliberations provided invaluable insight into public opinion on the issue for use by researchers and policy makers.

title: british columbia electoral reform process (2002-2005)
description: attempts to reform the canadian province of british columbia's electoral system involved educational outreach, a citizen's assembly to determine the best alternative to the current first-past-the-post system, and public hearings, culminating in a popular referendum.

title: british columbia referendum on electoral reform (2005)
description: on may 17, 2005, a referendum was held in british columbia on whether the recommendation of the citizens' assembly on electoral reform to replace the first-past-the-post electoral system with single transferable vote should be adopted. it failed to achieve the supermajority required.

title: climate initiative essen: building an active climate culture
description: winner of the german ministry for education and research "energy-efficient city" competition, the initiative promotes environmental conservation in essen through bottom-up, participatory action by private companies and civil society groups.

title: valle d'aosta water protection plan [italian]
engaging youth in municipal youth policy development (santa, northwest cameroon)
description: between 2010 and 2015, youth leaders were engaged in a process to develop a municipal youth policy in santa, northwest cameroon, as a means to promote greater youth voice and participation in municipal governance and decision making.

title: africa i-parliaments action plan
description: africa i-parliaments is a set of united nations initiatives and projects designed to enable african parliaments to facilitate democracy and good governance through technology applications.

title: participatory budget 2016 - municipality of rivalta di torino [italian]
description: fourth 2016-2017 edition of the participatory budget of rivalta di torino (20,000 inhabitants). the initiative was initiated by the rivalta sostenibile civic list in 2013 but in the elections of june 2017 the list was replaced by the coalition of the democratic party.

title: seeking the meaningful inclusion of people with disabilities: hearts & hands’ path process in l’arche antigonish (nova scotia)
description: people with and without intellectual disabilities used the “planning alternative tomorrows with hope” technique to rethink the hearts & hands community arts program and to increase the engagement of people living with disabilities in community decisions.

title: palmaria nel cuore [italian]
kenya youth manifesto
