description: kenyan youth have been largely excluded from meaningful political participation in the past so, leading up to the 2017 general elections, a manifesto was collaboratively written to outline the views of the nation's youth and demand the establishment of a national youth policy.

title: switch. reuse of abandoned spaces. new ideas to change perspective [switch. reusing abandoned places. new ideas to change perspectives]
something new on the western front - social cohesion in west pavia]
the women’s advisory platform: promoting gender-inclusive governance in juaboso district (ghana)
description: in 2013, netright facilitated the creation of the women’s advocacy platform by training and supporting women in the juaboso district to lead advocacy for greater representation and gender responsiveness in local and district-level governance and development planning.

title: house of commons and citizenship workshops]
participatory planning germany's nuclear waste disposal strategy
description: facing the need for a suitable location for its nuclear waste disposal, germany undertook a process of open public discourse, critique, and participation. by using a participatory democratic approach, stakeholders hoped to legitimize the final decision and preempt disagreement.

title: people's initiative on direct democracy, participation and political education in bolzano [citizens' initiative for a law on direct democracy, participation and political education in bolzano]
forum of common goods and solidarity economy of friuli venezia giulia [fvg commons and inclusive economy forum]
circularicity: civic crowdfunding for the circular economy
description: circularicity is a participatory process initiated by the municipality of capannori to involve citizen and stakeholder collaboration in respect of the circular economy and sustainability. five selected projects were partially financed through crowdfunding.

title: european awareness scenario workshop initiative
description: the european awareness scenario workshop was a european commission initiative used to examine innovative projects in the european context.

title: european local democracy week
description: the european local democracy week is an annual event held in eu member countries to foster civic and political engagement by promoting the knowledge of local democracy and the idea of democratic participation at a local level.

title: security and development for fontivegge and bellocchio areas in perugia [security and development for fontivegge and bellocchio areas in perugia]
habitat conservation planning in the u.s.
description: section 10 of the endangered species act allows for the creation of partnerships between public and private sectors and among government agencies to balance the need for environmental conservation with the need for construction, development, and other land use.

title: ethiopian qero management of the gaussa-menz grasslands
description: a collaborative, participatory form of environmental sustainability and conservation based on an indigenous system of governance. the system's use allows for a decolonization of the regulation and management of the traditional lands of local, indigenous residents.

title: sustainable urban mobility plan of perugia [sustainable urban mobility plan of perugia city council]
participatory budgeting of ceprano council]
pacc abruzzo - climate change adaptation plan of abruzzo region [climate change adaptation plan of abruzzo region]
public participation on migration policy in the puglia (apulia) region
description: the participatory process "migrazione condivisa e sostenibile (mics)" (translated: shared and sustainable migration) engaged input from citizens, associations, trade unions, and stakeholders in the immigration sector, for drafting the region's 2016-2019 migration policy plan.

title: people's policy on childrens' wellbeing
description: a collaborative approach to policy making around the issue of child welfare and the foster system. this was the first use of the people's policy method which attends to build legislation from the bottom-up: from citizen to government.

title: ventaglieri social park. participation changes naples [ventaglieri social park. public participation changes naples]
women's mediation training great lakes & horn of africa region
particip @ ctivi. the confrontation that multiplies ideas. palermo [active-participation. debate multiplies ideas]
municipal urban plan of olbia [olbia local plan]
description: a participation process to support the stages of elaboration of the municipal urban plan, aware of the need for an important communication investment and mobilization of the local community, in order to adequately share and legitimize the plan.

title: community justice boards in pima county, arizona
description: cjb volunteers work with the pima county attorney's office. the program uses restorative justice techniques as an alternative to prosecution for 1st and 2nd-time, non-violent, juvenile offenders, bridging the gap between victims and offenders, and focusing on rehabilitation.

title: re-designing el nudillo intersection - san diego
description: the concept of el nudillo was created during two workshops held in 2017 in east village san diego last year. el nudillo—spanish for "joint" or "knuckle"—is where 14th street ends at the trolley tracks on commercial street, just at the intersection of national avenue.

title: pb squared: organizational participatory budgeting
description: each year, the participatory budgeting project allows all of their donors to allocate a portion of their donations using participatory budgeting.

title: community-university rain gardens on vancouver’s north shore
description: citizens and university students are collaborating to design and build demonstration rain gardens to engage the public in learning the ecological and aesthetic value of this kind of green infrastructure.

title: gender-responsive participatory budgeting in wenling, china
description: efforts were made by the wenling municipal government for transparency and women's participation in the budgeting process.

title: los angeles metro purple line extension
description: a  comprehensive public engagement strategy starting in 2008, consisting of townhalls, online discussion boards, and a media campaign in order to make the purple line expansion process more inclusive and transparent.

title: informed citizen akron: ohio citizens' jury on issue-based media coverage in the 2016 presidential election
description: this initiative in ohio uses citizens juries and poll data to better adapt the media coverage of presidential elections to cover the issues most important to citizens.

title: san casciano val di pesa community mobility network, italy
description: in san casciano val di pesa, italy, local residents and community organizations co-designed a more inclusive public transportation network.

title: landlord guarantee pilot program boston
description: a mayoral initiative which aims to provide permanent housing to homeless individuals and families by providing them with financial support and incentivizing landlords through offering a guaranteed fund of up to $10,000 in the event that any losses are incurred.

title: gender responsive and participatory budgeting in penang, malaysia
description: through local councils and nonprofits, organizers developed an inclusive, gender-responsive participatory budgeting project that led to concrete changes in two local housing projects.

title: foodborne chicago
description: chicago uses social media, twitter in particular, to track and share information on food-borne illnesses.

title: lower main regional water forum in bavaria, germany
description: the lower main regional water forum is a process of stakeholder participation concerning policies for managing the lower main river sub-basin in bavaria, germany. begun in 2005 and organized by the bavarian environment agency, the forum consists of one, 3-hour meeting each year.

title: the vancouver bubble
description: the vancouver bubble is an inflatable pop-up installation produced by the vancouver design nerds to transform public spaces into "citizen spaces" by acting as a platform for community engaged programming and dialogue.

title: 2016 collective intelligence for democracy workshop (medialab-prado's participalab, madrid)
description: an annual event that invites multidisciplinary teams to create digital prototypes for the facilitation of collective intelligence and public participation. the 2016 workshop drew participants from 30 countries who collaborated on 8 new technologies.

title: early court jury cases
description: in modern democracies, serving on a jury is the most common form of institutionalized public participation outside of voting. due process and trial by a jury of one's peers are both central democratic principles.

title: calgary community engagement on school transportation budget
description: the calgary board of education, facing limited funding, reduced student transportation services. after community opposition, the cbe and a consultant led a community engagement process to educate the public on the issue and receive input on the community’s budgeting priorities.

title: occupy vancouver's use of the spokes council
description: occupy vancouver's spokes council was developed through a democratic process of five work groups.

title: early cabildos abiertos cases
description: cabildo abiertos are central and south american "open town councils". this case entry includes examples of its use since the beginning in the 16th century.

title: the irish citizens' assembly
description: established in 2016, the citizens' assembly is a permanent, deliberative body of 100 randomly selected citizens who collect public opinion, debate, and provide recommendations on the topics outlined in its founding documents and, later, by members of parliament and the public.

title: the 1st sitting of the irish citizens’ assembly: the eighth amendment
description: the assembly met across five weekends to deliberate the country’s 8th constitutional amendment which defends the right to life. the assembly’s recommendations by majority vote were essentially to repeal or replace the amendment.

title: the 2nd sitting of the irish citizens' assembly: responding to an ageing population
description: the irish citizens assembly of 2016 examined several key issues facing ireland. held over two weekends, the assembly examined and deliberated how ireland would best deal with the challenges and opportunities presented by ireland’s ageing population.

title: better reykjavik: iceland's online participation platform
description: better reykjavik is an online participatory social network built using the 'your priorities' web application. it allows registered users to post ideas in topic-specific message 'communities' created by the city on topics such as open consultations and participatory budgeting.

title: roundtable on the research & practice of women’s participation & leadership in climate solutions
description: a one-day event bringing together a diverse audience of panellists and participants in a roundtable discussion on the state of women's participation in climate change dialogue, governance, and decision-making.

title: hase area co-operation
description: the hase area co-operation was a process of stakeholder participation to develop proposals for managing the hase river sub-basin in lower saxony, germany. the process, begun in 2005, was designed by the lower saxony ministry of environment, energy, and climate protection.

title: elbe-lübeck working group
description: the elbe-lübeck working group was a process of stakeholder participation to develop proposals for managing the elbe-lübeck river sub-basin in schleswig-holstein, germany. the working group process, begun in 2002, was designed by the schleswig-holstein environment agency.

title: guadalete and barbate participatory planning process
description: the guadalete and barbate participatory planning process was designed to obtain stakeholder feedback on measures for managing the guadalete and barbate river basins in andalusia, spain. the process, held in 2010 and 2014, was organized by the andalusian water agency.

title: miera and campiazo basins participatory planning process
description: the miera and campiazo basins participatory planning process engaged the public and stakeholders in developing measures for managing the miera and campiazo river basins in cantabria, spain. the process, held from 2008-2011, was organized by the cantabrian environmental agency.

title: baix ter basin participatory planning process
description: the baix ter basin participatory planning process was designed to engage the public and stakeholders in developing measures for managing the baix ter river basin in catalonia, spain. the process, begun in 2007, was organized by the catalan water agency.

title: water management planning in belfast lough and river lagan catchment area (northern ireland)
description: the belfast lough and lagan catchment stakeholder group was designed to engage stakeholders in developing a plan for managing the belfast lough and the river lagan catchment area in the metropolitan areas of belfast and lisburn in northern ireland.

title: forth area advisory group
description: the forth area advisory group aimed to engage stakeholders in developing a plan for managing the catchment area of the rivers forth and almond in scotland. the process, begun in 2006, was organized by the scottish environmental protection agency’s river basin planning unit.

title: 2017 congress on iceland's democracy
description: a berkeley constitutional center event bringing scholars together to discuss the ten-year process of constitutional reform. organizing as a mock legislative body, participants developed, debated, and decided on concrete action proposals for moving forward.

title: ethiopia's growth and transformation plan ii (2015-2020)
description: supported by various international agencies, ethiopia's second five-year plan aims to 1) achieve the unsdgs, and 2) double the nation's annual gdp. strategies are wide-ranging but focus on individual and institutional capacity building and good governance.

title: street law's "democracy for all"
university of the western cape: student learning through community participation
european local democracy week 2010
digital deliberation (vertically integrated projects)
description: the vertically integrated projects' digital deliberation involved designing, testing, and implementing of the online large-scale deliberative platform reflect! the project intended to facilitate discussion between people with dissenting opinions and to gamify public deliberation.

title: newton, massachusetts civic engagement study
sdgs kenya forum for sustainable development: 'leave no one' behind national dialogues
pera natin 'to!: an initiative by the philippines public transparency reporting project
vorarlberg citizen council on asylum and refugee policies
description: using the unique, homegrown citizens' council method, vorarlberg looked to its citizens in addressing the issue of refugee and asylum integration. the three-phase process gave officials valuable feedback regarding local participation in the resettlement process.

title: bioenergy distributed dialogue
description: a public dialogue meant to inform and guide the biotechnology & biological sciences research council's strategy and policy development. the process trialled a 'distributed' approach to dialogue to allow for continued communication between participants.

title: public dialogue on the babraham institute's future strategy
description: a public dialogue convened by the babraham institute to prioritise future research and projects, to inform bi's science strategy and commitment to reporting for the openness in animal research, and to guide the development of bi's 2017-2022 science & public engagement strategy.

title: youniversity - student online participation to help design seminar content [german]
omaar: civic education to mobilize youth in community engagement in zakazik (sharquia, egypt)
description: the social contract center (scc) attempted to engage egyptian youth to face societal challenges in the city of zakazik, by creating omaar, a group of youth leaders who were given opportunities for civic education training and community dialogue.

title: enhancing people's participation in local radio in nepal
description: to strengthen local radio given its relevance as an informational source in nepal, starting in 2015, sharecast initiative nepal sought to improve data transparency, and engage radio operators in participatory processes which would respond to listeners' stated priorities.

title: persons with cerebral palsy self-mobilising for meaningful participation in uganda
citizen observers: social accountability in nigeria’s judicial sector
boston green links
new hampshire public conversations on school redesign and student-centered learning
president clinton's initiative on race
description: in 1997, president clinton implemented an initiative to work towards the goal of racial reconciliation through inclusive dialogue.

title: rose institute initiative database
national citizen's initiative for democracy (ni4d)
description: the national citizen's initiative for democracy (ni4d) was a project suggesting a constitutional amendment that would allow local residents to enact or amend laws in the us.

title: towards the lake contract for massaciuccoli
the deliberative budget of turin
description: covering two, two-year budgeting cycles, each in a different district, the city of turin’s participatory budget successfully combined formal, deliberative modes of participation with less formal or involved methods to include as many people as possible.

title: ecomuseum of the faenza apennine landscape [ecomuseum of faenza apennines]
description: the object of the process is the sharing of a collaboration agreement for the implementation and development of the faenza apennine landscape ecomuseum. the project does not seem at all controlled by the guarantee technician in charge of this task by regional law 3/10.

title: agrado. governance for an agricultural landscape that likes [agrado. governance for a pleasant rural landscape]
description: the introduction to the project reads: "farmers can become a guide in rethinking current agriculture, promoting the development of sustainability, community, tradition, and innovation". the question was: "can the campaign become a tourism product?"

title: public debate on quarry restoration in the municipality of gavorrano
description: the public debate concerned the use of red gypsum, production residues from the huntsman chemical industry in scarlino, for the restoration of quarries in the nearby territory of the municipality of gavorrano.

title: world wide views citizen participation project on global warming
description: the world wide views citizen participation project on global warming was the first of three international public consultation and opinion gathering initiatives lead by the world wide views alliance. it involved the first use of the world wide views methodology.

title: "i want my neighborhood" program in santa adriana, chile
winnipeg "let’s talk" budget consultation 2016
description: the 2016 budget consultations were the first to be conducted by the newly established winnipeg office of public engagement. the consultations consisted of a survey tool, a wikisurvey tool, a telephone survey, and a picture-gathering campaign.

title: west end participatory budgeting pilot project
description: a participatory budgeting pilot took place in vancouver's west end in 2017, where community residents decided on the allocation of funds from permit parking fees.

title: montemurlo designs its future
description: a participation path designed to involve citizens in the urban transformations of the municipality. the results were used to elaborate guidelines for the drafting of the “montemurlo + montale” urban innovation project.

title: internet defense league
description: following the internet blackout of 2012 against sopa and pipa, fight for the future organized individuals and internet websites into a permanent free-speech and anti-censorship effort, the internet defense league.

title: the social accountability for education reform initiative (ba-ziyd, beni suef, egypt)
description: an initiative to bring citizens, service providers, and government officials together to engage around issues in the education sector and to improve the quality of educational infrastructure and service delivery in ba-ziyd, egypt.

title: full-stop on the expressway? collective organization against the spadina expressway
description: the spadina expressway was one of a series of planned highway routes designed in 1960 by the city of toronto to make the downtown core more accessible. however, its construction was met with a high degree of backlash from the local torontonians.

title: free all park. an inclusive itinerary in certaldo
do you know what about ... riserva ... la bufalina?
bringing racial justice to local democracy panel discussion
description: in the lead-up to the 2018 vancouver city council elections, a panel of racialized candidates was convened to discuss the place of race in politics, ways to support those impacted by racism, and how best to respond to systemic racism a community.

title: including youth with disabilities in uganda's development: nudipu-youth
description: through advocacy and volunteer trainings, media engagement and deliberation with multiple stakeholders, nudipu-youth organized and mobilized up to 1,000 youth with disabilities to advocate for their inclusion and participation in economic and political life in their communities

title: city of ottawa public engagement strategy
description: a 2013 public consultation associated with the systematization of the city of ottawa public engagement strategy. the city tried to solicit as much participation as possible.

title: winnipeg budget consultations
description: since 2014, winnipeg has had annual public consultations on the composition of the city's budget, thereby engaging residents in democratic processes and allowing them to have a say.

title: winnipeg "let’s talk" budget consultation 2017
description: the 2017 budget consultations were the second to be conducted by the winnipeg office of public engagement. the consultations consisted of an online survey tool, a wikisurvey tool, and a telephone survey.

title: winnipeg budget consultation 2018
description: the 2018 budget consultations were the third to be conducted by the winnipeg office of public engagement. the consultations consisted of a survey tool, pop-up events, a budget allocator tool, and an idea forum.

title: winnipeg budget consultation 2019
description: the 2019 budget consultations were the fourth to be conducted by the winnipeg office of public engagement. the consultations consisted of a telephone survey, a pop-up event, a priorities survey, a prioritization and allocation survey, and a workshop.

title: winnipeg budget consultations 2014
description: the city of winnipeg was facing a $70 million dollar deficit in 2014 and needed to make a series of difficult infrastructure choices. they engaged a consulting firm to better understand what the citizens of winnipeg want and expect from their civic government.

title: public consultation on walk-bike bridge and connections in winnipeg
description: this preliminary design study will investigate options for a pedestrian and cycling bridge that would fill gaps in the network for non-vehicular transport in winnipeg.

title: toronto’s participatory budgeting pilot 2015-2017
description: toronto experimented with a participatory budgeting process from 2015-2017. over the three-year pilot project, nearly1,700 residents cast votes and selected 37 projects worth $1,870,000 in total.

title: battle for the net
description: battle for the net is fight for the future's primary initiative to preserve net neutrality in the united states and prevent internet service providers from manipulating broadband delivery and service in a way that benefits their content over other creators'.[1]

title: zero hour weekend of action
description: youth organized march on washington dc july 19, 2018 to demand action on climate change as a social justice issue.

title: linknyc: building the future of new york's public internet kiosks
description: in july 2012, the new york city government released a public request for information, asking for comments about the future uses of its payphones. a competition to submit ideas was then organized in 2013. public feedback was then used to create the linknyc proposal.

title: chaos communication congress
description: annual conference organized by the chaos communication club, the event takes place regularly at the end of the year since 1984.

title: broadband for the rural north (b4rn)
description: community-built full-fibre network by local residents who pooled their resources in 2011 to dig their own trenches to lay fibre cables to connect farms and isolated homes.

title: the tin can studio public policy collage pop-up (vancouver, bc)
description: a pop-up democracy event that invited people on the street to make a collage representing social and political issues.

title: people first citizen’s grand jury, edinburgh
description: people first held a citizen’s jury in edinburgh in 2011. the jury was made up of people first members and witnesses with learning difficulties and professionals to gave evidence. recommendations were made to city chambers on human and civil rights.

title: citizens' assembly for renewal of engagement in europe
description: the citizens’ assembly to renew engagement (care) for the future of europe was a decentralised citizens’ assembly that took place in late 2018. across 25-30 person mini-publics in 4 different member states, as well as an online deliberation, care for the future of europe’s participants deliberated about the future of eu democracy and eu citizen participation.

title: public participation on open-air swimming pool renovation in gottmadingen, germany
description: public participation is increasingly demanded by the population, but deliberative processes are rarely used for decision-making. the first public participation initiative by gottmadingen was on an open-air swimming pool renovation and it became a great success.

title: cabfair: cooperative ownership in the gig economy
description: cabfair is a proposed, cooperative alternative to privately managed ride-hailing services. cabfair is part of the broader movement towards shared ownership and cooperative management in response to changing labour dynamics in the ‘gig economy’.

title: the empowering smallholder farmers in markets (esfim) program in bolivia
description: the esfim program works with farmers organizations to strengthen their capacity to advocate on behalf of their members. the cioec representing bolivia's economic peasant organizations enlisted esfim's help to lobby for a new policy on indigenous farmers' rights.

title: the empowerment of belo horizonte's solid waste workers
description: through community mobilization, belo horizonte’s ‘catadores’ self-organized, earning a formal role in government policy-making in the waste and citizen forum and gaining ownership of recycling facilities.

title: advancing women’s rights in nicaragua’s farming cooperatives
description: a gender audit of the national federation of cooperatives found women in nicaragua lacked access to land. reforms of the association and the development of a women’s land fund increased women’s representation and participation.

title: workplace democracy at w.l. gore & associates inc.
description: w.l. gore & associates inc. consistently ranks as one of the best companies to work for. it is unique in it's use of the lattice method of employee self management.

title: ibeka: community owned electrical mini-grids in indonesia
description: ibeka give rural villagers and marginalized urban dweller ownership of hydro or wind grids through community-managed enterprises. revenues generated are shared through a community fund used for improving village infrastructure, healthcare, and education opportunities.

title: jubilee debt campaign
description: a global campaign for debt relief led by an international network of civil society actors. the campaign negotiated approx. us$100 billion in debt relief and raised greater awareness about debt and democratic accountability.

title: kuapa kokoo: cooperative ownership and management in the cocoa industry (ghana)
description: kuapa kokoo is a large cooperative of cocoa farmers in ghana. it is democratically owned and managed and farmers have a direct say in the management of the divine chocolate company, and offers its members a variety of capacity-building programs.

title: the puma local exchange trading scheme alternative currency (pumarejo, spain)
description: in pumarejo, a neighborhood of sevilla, spain, locals have come together to create a local exchange scheme and the puma, a local currency, to reduce vulnerability and economic exclusion.

title: markets for change: increasing women’s participation in market governance (pacific islands)
description: the markets for change project is a un-led initiative to increase the participation of women market vendors in the planning and decision-making of the pacific islands’ market economy.

title: nasvi lobbying for a national urban street vendor policy in india
description: the national street vendor association (nasvi), a federation of street traders, advocated for and then co-authored the first national policy on street vendors in india, which enabled more equitable economic participation.

title: participatory budgeting in porto alegre 1989-present
description: porto alegre’s participatory budget is the oldest in the world, beginning in 1989 and continuing into the present. the budgeting process follows a yearly cycle and is open to all citizens of voting age.

title: participatory guarantee systems in tanzania
description: participatory guarantee systems were adopted by farmers in towelo village in 2010, providing an alternative form of certification that emphasize the participation of producers, especially in emerging markets.

title: the rekompak programme: community-driven development after the 2004 tsunami (aceh, indonesia)
description: following the destruction of aceh’s economy by the 2004 tsunami, the world bank launched the rekompak program to give community members the power to direct relief funds and re-development efforts.

title: root capital’s participatory impact assessment of coffee cooperative investment in guatemala
description: a participatory impact assessment was undertaken by root capital to evaluate the socioeconomic effect of their investment in guatemalan coffee cooperatives on farmers and the enterprises themselves.

title: the rsa citizens’ economic council programme: capacity building for participation in macro-economic policy (united kingdom)
description: the rsa’s citizen economic council was a two-year programme in which 54 citizens inquired into economic policy in the united kingdom and worked and deliberated with policy-makers to co-create economic policy.

title: linking local producers to local consumers: india’s rural urban distribution initiative (rudi)
description: the rural urban distribution initiative was started in 2004 by the self employed women’s association and has since created a local exchange network owned by small-scale farmers and workers.

title: the worker-recovered enterprise movement (argentina)
description: the worker-recovered enterprise movement was a grassroots reaction to argentina’s economic depression and collapse from 1999-2001. the movement saw the occupation and reclamation of approximately 190 bankrupt or failing businesses by over 10 thousand workers.

title: cyprus friendship programme
description: the cyprus friendship programme was established in the mediterranean state of cyprus in 2009 with the aim of bringing teenagers from both sides of the country together. it is based around the children's friendship project for northern ireland.

title: participatory budgeting in north wales (your community, your choice)
description: this case details the 2013 "your community, your choice" participatory budgeting initiative in north wales, enabling citizens to engage in the process of re-allocating funds seized from local criminals.

title: #fightpinktax
description: #fightpinktax is an innovation designed to democratically address the gender price gap, whereby women pay more for goods and services, using an internationally accessible online petition that conveys the issue.

title: participatory budgeting in dundee, scotland
description: participatory budgeting was introduced into dundee, scotland in 2018, as part of an initiative called 'dundee decides', giving the citizens control over the allocation of the £1.2million community infrastructure fund.

title: guns: an american conversation, washington dc
description: a workshop bringing together people on all sides of the gun debate in america for a two-day workshop, followed by a facebook group lasting a month, in order to facilitate a dialogue on the issue

title: michigan ballot initiative: proposal 2, voters not politicians
description: proposal 2 is an anti-gerrymandering initiative which will amend michigan's constitution after it was approved by voters on november 6th 2018. the initiative was created and campaigned for by voters not politicians, a civil society group.

title: the participedia project
description: participedia is an open-sourced internet database of case studies on participatory democracy for the use of researchers and those with an interest in the field.

title: canadian task force on marijuana legalization and regulation
description: in 2016, on a mandate from the canadian government, the task force assessed public opinion, which would later influence the cannabis act 2018.

title: play england - street play project
description: play england was an initiative intended to increase children's physical activity and make the streets a safer place to play.

title: participatory budgeting in braga, portugal
description: the city of braga (portugal), annually uses participatory budgeting allowing the citizens to create, and vote upon which projects they would like to see completed across the city. the budget is completed using traditional face-to-face, and e-democratic methods.

title: the robin hood project: participatory budgeting in melville, australia
description: the robin hood project is a participatory budgeting project in melville, australia to allocate a fund of $100,000 between different community projects.

title: sheffield citizens' assembly on devolution
description: assembly north brought 32 people together to discuss south yorkshire’s devolution and resulting influence on the democratic system. participants voted for two devolved regional bodies and a directly elected regional assembly, but no government action was taken.

title: the united kingdom's first deliberative polling®: public attitudes to crime
description: the united kingdom’s first deliberative polling was implemented in 1994 in order to better gauge and then impact public opinion on crime reduction. the results indicated that policy stances did change as a result, particularly among highly-educated participants.

title: australian deliberative poll on reconciliation
description: the 2001 deliberative poll on reconciliation in australia is an interesting exploration on participatory processes and the role that representation plays.

title: 'equally well' participatory budgeting in govanhill, glasgow 2008-2012
description: the scottish government ran a pilot participatory budgeting (pb) scheme labelled “equally well”, in govanhill, an area of glasgow, known for social, economic and health inequalities.[1]

title: 2018 north antrim by-election recall petition
description: the north antrim by-election recall petition of summer 2018 was the first time the process established under the recall of mps act 2015 for uk citizens to have the power to recall their mps to face a by-election following disreputable behaviour was implemented in practice.

title: voting systems assessment project (vsap) in los angeles county
description: this case details a decade-long innovation beginning in 2009 to replace the outdated inkavote plus voting system in los angeles county.

title: keeping seniors well forum richmond 2016
description: a set of forums were held by vancouver coastal health to improve care for seniors with complex conditions.

title: grassroots activism for clean water in macedonia
description: a look at grassroots activism for clean water in the republic of macedonia by citizens initiative 'arsena' against government opposition.

title: 2005 brazilian firearms and munitions referendum
description: the brazilian firearms and munitions referendum was a one-off binding vote for all brazilian citizens on article 35 of the disarmament statute. the referendum aimed to settle the debate on gun control in brazil.

title: mvoting: online participation at the municipal level in seoul
description: an application called "mvoting" was used in seoul, south korea, to give citizens the opportunity to vote on local policy, thus engaging them in the democratic process and sparking open dialogue with their representatives.

title: 2015 hamburg/kiel referendum for 2024 summer olympics candidacy
description: in 2015, there were two referendums held in hamburg and kiel, germany, to determine whether the cities would apply for co-hosting the 2024 summer olympics. in the end, kiel voted in favour of co-hosting while hamburg voted against, so it was decided that germany would not apply.

title: youth participatory budgeting in cluj-napoca, romania
description: youth participatory budgeting in cluj-napoca, romania was implemented in 2015 and this democratic exercise was the first one to be conducted online in the country's history.

title: alvarado street bakery cooperative
description: alvarado street bakery is the largest cooperative bakery in the us with 116 members, at present, who both run and own the for-profit business. the bakery specialises in organic, sprouted bread producing about 50,000 loaves daily with annual sales in the region of $33 million.

title: participatory budgeting via fund my community in south australia (state)
description: fund my community is a grant programme that uses participatory budgeting to allocate one-off funding to charitable and welfare organisations in south australia on an annual basis.

title: hungarian referendum 2008
description: the purpose of the referendum was to decide whether hungary should abolish the fees for certain medical services, namely a daily fee for hospital care and fee for doctors’ consultations and tuition fees for higher education.

title: make america dinner again
description: make america dinner again is a deliberative innovation created by tria chang and justine lee shortly after the 2016 presidential election. guests with differing political views are invited to dinner to discuss current issues in an attempt to heal the divides in american society.

title: dene ā’ nezen (dignity and respect): youth for safety
description: the people of watson lake, yukon (canada), and nearby kaska first nations populations in two mile area, upper liard, and lower bc, identified a need to reach out to their youth to empower and include them in bringing awareness to the issues of violence against indigenous women.

title: all lives matter
description: 'all lives matter' rose as a hashtag and slogan to undermine the black lives matter movement in 2014. it does not exist as a formal group or network.

title: participatory budgeting in ampasy nahampoana, madagascar
description: ampasy nahampoana is a small municipality with a population of less than 10,000 located near the port of tolanaro.[2] participatory budgeting was introduced in 2008 in order to re-establish decentralization and combat government corruption.

title: participatory budgeting in lousa, portugal
description: the following case follows the implementation and process of participatory budgeting in lousa, portugal. it also identifies why it was needed and whether it was successful or not.

title: deliberative poll® at the 2015 internet governance forum
description: at the internet governance forum (igf) in brazil, a 2015 deliberative poll was initiated in order for experts from corporations, governments, civil society, and academic institutions from around the world to debate how internet access should be facilitated.

title: referendum on the thirty-sixth amendment of the constitution of ireland
description: the thirty-sixth amendment of the constitution of ireland, previously called bill no. 29 of 2018, was proposed to grant the irish legislature, the oireachtas, the ability to liberalize abortion law. a referendum was held in 2018 and the amendment was approved by voters.

title: wedialogue
description: wedialogue is a global experiment to test new solutions for commenting on news online. the objective of wedialogue is to promote humility in public discourse and prevent digital harassment and trolling.

title: camden children in care council's deliberative forums (uk)
description: children in care councils, ciccs, were introduced by local authorities in 2007. ciccs, introduced by the department for education and skills, allow ‘looked after’ children to contribute to service planning while in care. camden’s cicc is one of 22 served by london councils.

title: wintercity strategy
description: the wintercity strategy is designed to reinvent winter in edmonton, alberta (canada)  by addressing the practical barriers that prevent people from enjoying winter and making an overall cultural shift in the story residents tell about winter.

title: division transit and development project
description: the division transit project will bring faster and more reliable public transportation to the portland metro. the goal for the powell-division project was to make travel safer, easier and more reliable in southeast portland, east portland and gresham (oregon, usa).

title: lambeth's cooperative council agenda
description: lambeth was the first uk city to adopt the cooperative council method: a new approach to delivering public services in a more effective and responsive manner by sharing power between providers and users.

title: peru 2030 agenda ambassadors program
description: the 2030 agenda ambassadors program engaged 56 peruvian civil society organizations and citizen groups in raising awareness and implementing and monitoring the 2030 agenda for sustainable development in their communities.

title: western power participatory disaster response
description: after the devastating effects of the waroona, australia bushfire, western power was faced with restoring power to 3000 homes. waroona is located in the peel district of western australia south of perth.

title: leap-frog: frog census mobile app
description: melbourne water (victoria, australia) created an app for submitting frog sightings as part of their water resource management. the app allows volunteer citizen scientists to better understand how to make and keep the cities’ water resources clean.

title: getting moroccan youth involved in government
description: to get young moroccans more interested in government, the national democratic institute created parliamentary fellowships so that young people work closely with members of parliament and learn more about deliberation, citizen engagement, and government as a whole.

title: i paid a bribe: participatory website to combat corruption in india
description: ‘ipaidabribe.com’ is a website that was founded in bangalore, india during the year 2008. created by the janaagraha centre for citizenship and democracy, the goal of this initiative was to tackle bribery and corruption by harnessing the collective energy of citizens.

title: participatory budgeting in peru (2004-present)
description: participatory budgeting in peru is is mandated from a national level. it follows a 4-phase yearly cycle and has been used since 2004.

title: the edwards aquifer: a collaborative and consensus-based stakeholder process
description: the edwards aquifer is a source of groundwater that serves over 2 million people. there are endangered species that depend on the water from the aquifer. because of these competing interests, a consensus-based stakeholder process was undertaken.[1]

title: youth participatory action on gender inclusivity at the san francisco school
description: in 2016, students at a san francisco middle school took part in a participatory process after recognizing bias in the school’s dress code. the students conducted surveys to determine current perceptions and were successful in rewriting the dress code to be more inclusive.

title: participatory budgeting in maribor, slovenia
description: the slovenian municipality of maribor adopted various forms of direct democracy, notably participatory budgeting, following political and economic struggles.

title: community engagement and participatory planning at heyford reserve, salisbury, au
description: the city of salisbury in adelaide, australia enabled community members to participate in redeveloping the park area of heyford reserve to better suit their needs.

title: the i-30-crossing project in little rock, arkansas and citizens’ engagement
description: citizen and stakeholder participation in the planning of the expansion and widening of i-30 highway in little rock, arkansas, united states resulted in substantial revisions to the initial plan.

title: phoenix union high school district participatory budgeting
description: in 2016, the phoenix (arizona) union high school district implemented a participatory budgeting process, becoming the first u.s. school district in the united states to use participatory budgeting to allocate district wide funds.

title: senator john boozman’s congressional youth cabinet
description: the congressional youth cabinet created by united states senator john boozman of arkansas was designed to teach high-school age students about advocacy and civic engagement by allowing participants to gain experience in policy through action.

title: give us the ballot room by underground escape
description: in little rock, a unique escape room set in the 1950s deep south of the united states, where jim crow laws run rampant, invites ordinary people to cast their ballot despite facing obstacles. it is intended to provide immersive civic education for participants.

title: results international conference: a young-adult gathering in d.c. to fight against poverty
description: results hosts an annual conference in washington, d.c. to educate and train citizens to fight poverty nationally and globally by influencing public policy.

title: grand débat national (france)
description: an ongoing initiative by the french government to inspire dialogue and debate among citizens on four key issues: taxation & public spending, state organization of public services, the environment, and democracy & citizenship.

title: queering the map
description: queering the map is a community-generated mapping project that geo-locates queer moments, memories and histories in both cyber and physical space.

title: el encuentro nacional de educación para la paz/national summit of education for peace (colombia)
description: a coalition of 41 organizations met on october 1st and 2nd in 2015 in bogota, colombia to discuss the current peace education curriculum in colombia through 13 round table and small group discussions, civic and education leaders.

title: the unconvention
description: this “10-week social media campaign” was a collaboration of public radio international (pri), mic, and 92y (“92nd street y, mic,” 2016). the unconvention was composed of “a select group of young people from the us and abroad, ages 18-34, who...put the ideas, issues and opinions

title: chinese engage citizens on healthcare reform
description: public opinion was engaged on a healthcare reform draft that was written by the chinese government, a process that occurred over a month in 2008.

title: arkansas forum on the opioid crisis
description: celebrate recovery at park hill, a sector of a nationwide religious recovery program, hosted a community forum to discuss the opioid epidemic on october 15, 2018 in north little rock, arkansas inside park hill baptist church. the event was titled opioid crisis: the ripple effect.

title: americans discuss social security
description: the americans discuss social security (adss) was a national initiative to engage american citizens in deliberations on the reformation of the united states social security system. this was the first national use of the 21st c town meeting method.

title: participatory research on the decommissioning of south african social services
description: a participatory research initiative on the decommissioning of the south african social services social grant pay points. the research will involve community engagement with the south african non-profit organisation, black sash.

title: seedbeds of land and territory: participatory land reform in colombia
description: the seedbeds of land and territory is a participatory strategy developed by the national land agency in colombia. its purpose is to support the sustainability and maintenance of land policies and to contribute to the deepening of democracy at the territorial level.

title: neighborhood security council of las croabas, puerto rico
description: the neighborhood security council of las croabas allows for community policing in the neighborhood of las croabas, fajardo, puerto rico after hurricane maria through volunteer council members who directly inform police officials and the mayor of community problems.

title: university of missouri college classroom deliberation
description: the case study describes a deliberative event conducted in a missouri college classroom in 2012. the deliberative event was organized around a series of assignments, inspired by the citizens initiative review process in oregon, healthy democracy, and the living voters guide.

title: feminist schools: young women’s leadership and participation in egypt
description: from eight governorates across egypt, the feminist school brought together young women and men to learn feminist leadership, participate in school governance, and engage in communities to raise awareness and counter violence against women and girls.

title: district assemblies (argentina)
description: the district assemblies were initiated in 2001 in response to the social, political, economic and representative crisis that strongly affected argentinian society.

title: participatory budgeting with a mini-public in northern marr (scotland)
description: in 2017, the marr community planning group decided to test a new approach to participatory budgeting: a mini-public. over two days, a representative group of citizens deliberated on the allocation of £28,000.

title: organized rural women’s voices: building a national agenda
description: organized rural women’s voices: building a national agenda was a meeting organized by the national institute of women of uruguay in conjunction with several other national institutions, ministries and social organizations. it took place on october 15th, 2015.

title: peasant guard of catatumbo
description: the peasant guard of catatumbo emerged during the 2013 agrarian strike in response to the need for a group that would defend the territory and human rights in the region. the group faced threats from armed actors through dialogue and peaceful conflict resolution methods.

title: voices that build: proposals and deliberations on children’s issues (colombia)
description: voices that build was a deliberative process that took proposals from children and adolescents and provided web-based and face-to-face deliberation to produce 80 initiatives geared toward better uses of time for adolescents and children.

title: gana pienso: an online bridge between citizens & government
description: gana pienso is an online deliberation platform created by the government of nariño to provide its citizens access and ability to voice their views, opinions, and/or concerns about government related issues, policies, and proposals.

title: wajir women association for peace and safe markets
description: in 1993, dekha ibrahim founded the wajir women association for peace (wwap) in order to create a safer market for all the women from tribes in wajir county, kenya following the outbreak of violence due to the elections of 1992.

title: candidate forum: hot springs, ar, 2018 midterm election debate
description: a forum held at national park community college on oct. 16, 2018, intended to provide the opportunity for candidates running for office for the 2018 midterm elections engage with voters and answer questions related to their platforms/issues relevant to voters.

title: public spaces in urban lima neighborhoods
description: ocupa tu calle is a social movement in lima, peru that joins individual citizens together in order to identify empty spaces in their neighborhood and utilize them to serve a public need in the form of small public spaces (termed ‘parklets’ or ‘pocket parks’).

title: forestry communities in petén, guatemala
description: the forestry communities governance program began in 1997 in petén, guatemala, and continues today. this was made possible by indigenous and peasant organizations. there had been a complete takeover of the forests by industry and smugglers, and the villagers were at their mercy.

title: the national land rights forum: peasant-led advocacy for land rights in nepal
description: since 2003, a community-led, non-violent peasant's movement has engaged thousands of land-deprived peasants to dialogue, negotiate, and advocate for policy change in favour of land rights and livelihoods.

title: the pwani children’s voices conference in mombasa, kenya
description: children’s civic engagement was promoted in the mombasa county in kenya through collaborative planning and public hearings, emphasizing the imperative role of children’s voices in the country’s development.

title: the cimarrona guard of northern cauca
description: the cimarrona guard of northern cauca is a community self-protection initiative that seeks to protect the territory autonomously from threats posed by foreign interests. the idea was born from the first national congress of the black people in 2013.

title: colombian participatory development programs with territorial focus
description: the development programs with territorial focus are a national participative strategy aiming to structurally transform the countryside of colombia, focusing on the locales where conflict has had the most impact.

title: the santa fe tree law
description: the tree law of the argentinian province of santa fe had a digital platform for citizen participation promoted by the ministry of environment. during 2018, citizens participated with proposals and opinions about the 8 thematic areas of the law.

title: participatory budgeting in milan - cycle 2017/18
description: the milan empatia project pilot is a learning story. from the “monitoring cycle” of milan's previous unsuccessful pb, it implemented a new deliberative cycle of pb aimed at transparency and meaningful application of the citizens proposals and decisions.

title: public engagement on animals containing human material
description: a public dialogue and nationally representative survey on attitudes to research involving animals containing human material (achm) was conducted in may-august 2010 by a consortium led by ipsos mori.

title: sciencewise
description: sciencewise is the uk government's internationally recognised public engagement programme which enables policy makers to develop socially informed policy with a particular emphasis on science and technology. it is led and funded by uk research and innovation.

title: deliberative workshops on cambrian mountains natural wealth, landscape, and ecosystems
description: a series of deliberative workshops involving farmers and communities around the cambrian mountains addressed ecosystems goods and services proposals.

title: citizen dialogue on bovine tb
description: a public dialogue consisting of stakeholder and public workshops and an online engagement process, addressing the uk governments’ strategy for addressing bovine tb and becoming officially tb free whilst maintaining the livestock industry.

title: community x-change: deliberative workshops in the uk
description: community x-change is the name given to a series of workshops where members of the public, scientists and policy makers meet to discuss issues involving science and discuss their thoughts, feelings and ideas for possible actions. [1]

title: democs for schools
description: the new economics foundation trialled a version of democs, a card game and policy making tool, in schools. based on feedback from teachers and students, the democs process was successful in offering a tool to get students to learn and discuss technical scientific issues.

title: public dialogue on the development of stratified medicine
description: a public dialogue on the human issues raised by the development and implementation of stratified medicine. it involved a mix of facilitated and self-facilitated, public, targeted and stakeholder deliberative workshops.

title: public dialogue on emerging policy involving science & technology
description: sciencewise commissioned four public dialogue workshops looking into the public’s views of emerging areas of policy involving science and technology.

title: drugsfutures
description: the drugsfutures project engaged the public on societal, health, safety and environmental issues raised by the drugs futures 2025 report.

title: embedding wellbeing science in decision making
description: a public dialogue to address the gap between the measurement of wellbeing and the use of these data to make better policies.

title: uk public engagement on genomics, genetics and redesign of the human genetics commission
description: a review seeking to inform the design of a new framework for advice on the social, ethical and legal implications around advances in genetics.

title: health research authority policy framework dialogue
description: the health research authority (hra) in conjunction with sciencewise commissioned opm group to run a public dialogue on identifying and recruiting participants for health research, involving 8 public dialogue workshops. [1]

title: patient and public views on the health research and clinical trials approval process
description: the health research authority sought to gain a better understanding of public attitudes towards the research approval process of health research and clinical trials. their wide-ranging programme of work included dialogue workshops with patients and members of the general public.

title: public consultation on human-animal embryos for research
description: human fertilisation and embryology authority (hfea) launched a major public consultation on the creation and use of human-animal embryos for research, involving 104 participants in two part deliberative workshops.

title: g1000 citizens’ summit in uden, netherlands
description: a summit on october 4, 2014 was performed by citizens within uden, netherlands. it involved direct communication and collaboration between the constituents and lawmakers in the community in order to bridge the gap between citizens and the city council.

title: the voice of my community: citizen inquiry for sustainable reconstruction in peru
description: following destructive flooding in 2017, the committees for concerted agreement in the fight against poverty throughout the affected regions of peru involved citizens in the creation of a plan for sustainable reconstruction and development (lafosse & sáez, 2017).

title: leap seconds public dialogue on time changes in the uk
description: a public dialogue was undertaken to democratically engage stakeholders in the uk on the question of maintaining leap seconds to synchronise clock and solar time.

title: public input on the 2014 longitude prize
description: a public dialogue sought input on framing issues for the longitude prize 2014, which rewards innovations in science and technology that solve publicly relevant challenges. the process contributed to the prize's content and development; it was positively perceived by participants.

title: mitochondria replacement multi-method research and public engagement initiative
description: the human fertilisation and embryology authority commissioned a five-strand, multi-method research and engagement project looking at the possible social and ethical issues and arguments relating to the techniques.

title: nanodialogues public engagement on nanotechnology (uk)
description: nanodialogues engaged the public on how to take forward the new and challenging area of nanotechnology research [1]. it incorporated four different experiments in public dialogue; public inquiry, focus groups, stakeholder workshops and deliberative dialogues.

title: 2015 mongolian referendum via text message
description: in the 2015 referendum, mongolian citizens cast votes on how they would like to move forward with increasing the value of mongolian currency. their options were to either expand mining projects in the oyu tolgio mines, or discipline the economy through controlled spending.

title: nanotechnology engagement group
description: the nanotechnology engagement group consisted of experts set up to investigate “upstream engagement” in the context of 6 different public engagement projects on nanotechnology.

title: nature improvement areas dialogues and public engagements
description: a series of public dialogues took place across three areas in the uk. the projects sought to engage the public with the planning processes of nature improvement areas. the nature of the projects varied widely in each case.

title: a public dialogue on the generic design assessment of new nuclear power stations
description: a public dialogue was held on reactor design (general design assessments) for new nuclear power stations. the dialogue involved an online survey and two rounds of workshops.

title: open science information demonstrator (science, trust, and public engagement strand 2)
description: the open science information demonstrator (osid): a project to build a demonstrator website that enables the general public to explore uk science funding and outcomes. it forms part of the larger project science, trust, and public engagement.

title: planet under pressure “youth voice”
description: a youth voice project was established to enable young people to develop a speech and questions to present at the planet under pressure 2012 conference.

title: public communication and engagement on flood risk
description: a public dialogue to explore the messages about flood risk as well as develop innovative methods and techniques to help individuals and communities understand the risk of flooding in their area.

title: naturally speaking... public dialogue for the uk national ecosystem assessment
description: the naturally speaking... public dialogue sought to better understand the public’s views on the uk national ecosystem assessment. 9 public dialogues took part across 3 areas of the uk with a final national dialogue in london.

title: public dialogue on data openness, data re-use, and data management
description: a public dialogue explored views on open data, data reuse and data management policies within research, on behalf of research councils uk and the royal society [1]. the findings from the public dialogue have been used by research councils uk to inform its data policies.

title: public engagement on landscape and ecosystem futures in england, scotland, and wales
description: a dialogue addressing landscape and ecosystem futures  in the context of climate change was implemented in the uk. the project consists of interrelated projects across wales, scotland and the east of england.

title: public engagement on landscape and ecosystem futures: east of england
description: two public dialogue projects in the east of england sought to pilot the ecosystem services framework, as a way of supporting public engagement with planning ecosystem futures.

title: public engagement on landscape and ecosystem futures: scotland
description: this project constitutes the scottish strand of a public engagement programme addressing climate related landscape change and impacts on ecosystems and quality of life across the uk. public workshops were held in the areas of nairn and machars.

title: review of research councils uk public dialogues
description: a review of public dialogues, consultations, and other public engagement exercises commissioned by the research councils from 2003 to 2012.

title: 'risky business' youth engagement on climate change
description: risky business combines science and citizenship education with politics. it employs live theatre performances to inform young people aged 14-19 about climate change and to enable them to participate in meaningful dialogue about the policy options for addressing it.

title: a public dialogue on rothamsted research's guiding principles
description: a public dialogue was used on developing guiding principles for rothamsted research’s work with industry on modern agricultural practice.

title: marsabit county's participatory budgeting process
description: marsabit county public budget participatory is a budget decision-making process that promotes good governance by strengthening the citizen’s capacity through bottom-up participatory mechanism. it takes place annually in the 20 civic wards of marsabit county, kenya (cgm, 2018).

title: the west akim municipal assembly medium term development plan (mtdp)
description: the west akim municipal assembly engaged the public and other stakeholders on development issues and the processes of preparing the municipal medium term development plan (mtdp). the ghanaian planning process which started in november of 2017, ended in april 2018.

title: science communication working lunches
description: the science communication working lunches (scwl) was a series of lunchtime events for the science communication community.

title: reviewing public engagement on science policy (science, trust, and public engagement strand 1)
description: strand 1 of the science, trust and public engagement project reviews key lessons of public dialogues through a review and analysis of the literature, supplemented by interviews and a workshop with experts and participants in these processes.

title: sciencehorizons
description: in may 2006, the sciencewise programme commissioned the sciencehorizons project to explore the public’s views on the science and technology themes that had emerged from strategic work by the uk government’s horizon scanning centre.

title: public engagement on shale gas and oil developments
description: this public dialogue project engaged the public on issues relating to shale gas exploration and related developments. 71 members of the public engaged in workshops aimed at better understanding how to explain the process and what regulatory processes would inspire confidence.

title: public dialogue on significant water management issues in the uk
description: a public dialogue engaged the public through seven workshops addressing significant water management issues for the environment agency’s river basin management plans.

title: space weather dialogue
description: a public dialogue to inform government and other public, private and infrastructure organisations’ policy on space weather, and its potential consequences for people and infrastructure.

title: uk stem cell dialogue
description: a multi strand public engagement process addressing ethical implications of stem cell research in the uk. the project included deliberative workshops, q methodology and stakeholder interviews.

title: uk public dialogue on reducing carbon emissions
description: a three-part citizen jury style public dialogue addressing carbon emissions reductions. the results informed the committee on climate changes' advice to the uk government on the 4th carbon budget.

title: trustguide public dialogue on information and communications technologies
description: a dialogue exploring public attitudes towards trust in information communication technologies (ict). trustguide's dialogue influenced organizers' (hp, bt) internal practices to address public cyber trust needs and influenced parliament's personal internet security inquiry.

title: food systems challenges & solutions public dialogue
description: a public dialogue on food supply challenges and potential solutions in the uk. workshops involving 49 participants sought to inform the public on the food system challenges and better understand public attitudes towards solutions, notably utilising agricultural technologies.

title: water quality and sustainability community engagement pilots
description: 25 community pilots addressed policy for delivering the water framework directive. a range of public engagement activities were supported in 13 of these pilot catchments.

title: uk public dialogue on ways to wellbeing
description: a public dialogue on understanding the barriers to raising population wellbeing.

title: living with environmental change: a citizen’s advisory forum
description: the living with environmental change partnership launched a citizens' advisory forum to bring public attitudes and values into its strategic decision making processes. the forum addressed flooding, climate change adaptation and governance in relation to climate change. [1].

title: energy 2050 pathways: a public dialogue
description: the decc engaged in a public dialogue project concerning the 80% reduction of greenhouse gas emissions by 2050. the engagement programme comprised a 2050 pathways calculator, a youth panel, local deliberative dialogues, and the evaluation of a “serious game” my2050 simulation.

title: citizens' inquiry into the forensic use of dna and the national dna database
description: the human genetics commission established a citizen’s inquiry into forensic use of dna and the uk’s national dna database. in 2008, two panels of 30 citizens took part in the inquiry, resulting in a draft report outlining their views [1].

title: uk public dialogue on geoengineering
description: the nerc carried out a public dialogue to explore the views of the public in relation to geoengineering [1].

title: low carbon communities challenge
description: the lccc was a two-year programme in which 22 community projects across the uk implemented various low carbon technologies, community engagement and behaviour change strategies to deliver a low carbon economy.

title: public perceptions of industrial biotechnology
description: the uk government commissioned a public dialogue on industrial biotechnology (ib). a two-part citizen jury involving 48 participants sought to assess and understand public perceptions of it, finding that ib is relatively unknown and conjured negative or intimidating connotations.

title: review of the managing radioactive waste safely (mrws) siting process
description: the decc commissioned a series of public and stakeholder workshops addressing the issue of radioactive waste management, with the purpose of gaining feedback to improve the selection process for the siting of geological disposal facility.

title: uk public dialogue on synthetic biology
description: uk research councils, bbsrc and epsrc, commissioned a public dialogue into synthetic biology. 160 members of the public and 41 experts took part in workshops aiming to engage the public on the issue and allow future policy to reflect public views, concerns and aspirations.

title: citizen forums on the uk's big energy shift
description: the uk government’s “big energy shift” sought to better understand public views on carbon and energy savings at a domestic level. nine citizen forums were held across the uk, assessing appeals and barriers of technology uptake, funding options and future policy.

title: mh:2k youth mental health engagement
description: mh:2k is a project that seeks to engage young people in conversations about mental health. it follows a process of supporting young people to co-design and co-deliver workshops with other young people on mental health topics, producing recommendations for policy makers.

title: community participation in ghanaian forest investment
description: the forest investment project, coordinated by the environmental protection agency of ghana and ghana’s forestry commission, educates the public on forest conservation and includes them in the process of environmental planning and preservation.

title: decide madrid: online participatory planning
description: the madrid decide website welcomes citizens to comment on proposed ordinances and make suggestions for changes to those ordinances, including a legislation processes or procesos section of the site.

title: kibera kenya good governance festival
description: the good governance festival is held in kibera kenya each year by actionaid kenya. it is an event that brings community members together over music, guest speakers, and informational booths to promote change and activism.

title: guardians of the riachuelo: argentinian citizen forums on environmental protection
description: the “guardians del riachuelo” participatory governance program occurred between 2006 & 2007 near buenos aires, argentina. the program helped identify environmental, sanitary and landscape conditions of the riachuelo riverbank as well as support and train local community leaders.

title: colombian community action boards (jacs)
description: juntas de acción comunal (jacs) are aimed to help community members in colombia meet, plan, and discuss ways to develop their community. these boards can take place in neighborhoods, cities, residential complexes, or any local level.

title: citizens' initiative on the rights of persons with disabilities
description: the citizens initiative on the rights of persons with disabilities in nicaragua was proposed by the federation of associations of persons with disabilities (“feconori”).

title: the editatona for nicaraguan women
description: the editatona for nicaraguan women provides an e-participation platform through “editathon” events to increase the number of women editing, translating, and writing about nicaraguan feminism.

title: fibershed: climate beneficial wool
description: fibershed’s climate beneficial wool project is an effort to engage textile and fabric producers and consumers in using (and advocating for) farming techniques that produce products with a negative carbon and/or co2 footprint.

title: openness in animal research dialogue
description: the medical research council and british pharmacological society commissioned a public dialogue to understand the expectations of the public with regard to transparency and openness in animal research.

title: the world wide views on climate and energy
description: the world wide views on climate and energy were effective global citizens’ consultations to collect and deliver opinions of about 10,000 global citizens for 97 debates from 76 countries to the 21st conference of parties (cop21) on critical climate change and energy transition

title: operation modulus: gorbals
description: operation modulus sought to address problems including gang violence, crime and anti-social behaviour in grobals, glasgow.

title: operation modulus: castlefern and govan
description: two crime reduction programmes and social integration processes undertaken in two areas of scotland which sought to emulate the success of the pioneering operation in gorbals. the initiatives were part of a study to determine best practices in public sector reform.

title: what works scotland collaborative learning event
description: this event brought together participants from across various community planning partnerships (cpps) in order to engage in knowledge exchange learning as well as enhance participants' skills in community engagement and collaborative action.

title: argentinian peasant university (unicam)
description: peasant university unicam is a participatory initiative of popular education, created in 2008 in the argentinian province of santiago del estero.

title: collaborative development of glasgow’s participatory budgeting evaluation toolkit
description: what works scotland and glasgow community planning partners collaboratively developed an evaluation approach to assess the impact of participatory budgeting (pb) activities.

title: thriving places: collaborative development of an evaluability assessment in glasgow
description: the collaborative development of a method of evaluating thriving places, a ten-year programme designed to improve outcomes in deprived areas of glasgow. participants included programme staff and relevant officials.

title: taking a ‘thriving places’ approach to consultation in glasgow
description: a series of outreach events and door-to-door engagements that took place in priesthill and househillwood in 2015-16. what works scotland compared the two approaches to determine the best method of community consultation for the community development officer.

title: improving participatory budgeting in scotland: a collaborative research project
description: practitioners from scotland conducted an international visit to paris in order to learn about their participatory budgeting procedure. the initiative ended in the development of a pb evaluation kit for glasgow.

title: bases for the reform: a constitution for santa fe
description: a proposal from the government of the province of santa fe, argentina, to reform the constitution through a participatory process.

title: a place to call home: community plan to prevent and end homelessness
description: from january through may 2018, the community shelter board brought together representatives of various service organizations to meet and discuss the implementation of a new, three-year community plan with the goal of effectively ending homelessness in franklin county and columbus

title: participatory research on the barriers to access rural sanitation in india
description: the public affairs center (pac), located in bangalore, india, used community score card and other techniques to investigate the communications of a program which provides toilets to rural homes the report was published in june, 2017 and the research project lasted 3 years.

title: massachusetts yes on 3 deep canvassing engagement
description: the yes on 3 campaign in massachusetts engaged potential voters through a communication method called deep canvassing in-person engagements to move hearts and minds on transgender people (kling, 2018). the process took place from may 2018 to november 2018 (kling, 2018).

title: community-led health impact assessment: addressing cross-border pollution in nan province, thailand.
