description: the lua ethnic people in nan ree patana and nan chang patana, thailand used a community-led health impact assessment process to address concerns over cross-border air pollution from a lao power plant and to advocate for a community-led monitoring system.

title: chocó solidarity interethnic forum
description: the chocó solidarity interethnic forum is a space for dialogue and coordination between ethnic-territorial organizations of black, indigenous, mestizo, youth, rural and urban women, and victims of the armed conflict in chocó, colombia.

title: constitutional referendum and popular consultation of ecuador in 2018
description: ecuador's 2018 constitutional referendum and popular consultation was an electoral process in which citizens were asked about the possibility of reforming the constitution and other issues of national interest.

title: "activate the congress" online platform
description: created in 2018, "activate the congress" is an online platform that enables direct communication between citizens and their representatives, aiming to amplify their voices and concerns.

title: popular consultation on mining and oil exploitation in fusagasugá
description: an initiative held on october 21, 2018 in fusagasugá, colombia focused on consulting the municipality's citizens on mining and oil exploration.

title: energy route 2018-2022: leading the modernization with citizen seal
description: in april 2018, a self-selected group of chilean citizens, representing the public sector, private stakeholders, civil society members, and others, responded to the invitation of chile’s ministry of energy to participate in day-long workshops in 15 regions of the country. the purpose of these workshops was to discuss the government’s future energy policies and propose recommendations.

title: nigerian urban reproductive health initiative
observatory of mining conflicts in latin america
description: the observatory of mining conflicts in latin america is an initiative that brings together civil society organizations with the purpose of establishing resistance strategies and alternatives to mining in latin america.

title: watchdog clubs: students monitoring school health in el recreo, ecuador
description: summary: over 150 students formed watchdog clubs and used surveys and participatory monitoring to promote access to healthy food, clean water, sanitation, and physical activity in nine schools in el recreo, duran district, ecuador.

title: permanent sortition in eupen, belgium
description: on february 25, 2019 the deutschsprachige gemeinschaft belgien (dg) parliament of the small german-speaking region of eupen, belgium passed the use of a permanent sortition program for the upcoming election.

title: humanitarian shelter for the lives of social leaders in colombia
description: the humanitarian shelter for the lives of social leaders was a democratic initiative from civil society, coordinated among different human rights organizations at the national level, who were present in a transitional camp located in bogotá.

title: wayuu women's force observatory: indigenous peoples' rights
description: the wayuu women's force observatory: indigenous peoples' rights is an initiative that emerged in 2015 from the wayuu women's force movement to research and promote indigenous peoples' rights.

title: participatory budgeting in wuppertal, germany
description: the 2017 multichannel participatory budgeting process conducted by the german city of wuppertal  has been a new and innovative approach for german municipalities to increase transparency and citizen engagement since the consultative model of participation is dominant in germany.

title: participatory budgeting in říčany, czech republic
description: the czech pilot took place in říčany, a small municipality of 15.000 inhabitants, located close to prague. the říčany pilot was the first to employ the empatia platform in an active pb cycle.

title: hampshire and the isle of wight (uk) citizens' assembly on devolution
description: assembly south was a citizens' assembly project organised by democracy matters. it consisted of a group of 23 citizens randomly selected and 6 councillors from solent and isle of wight area who met in southampton over two weekends in 2015 to discuss the future of local governance

title: germany's citizens' assembly on democracy (bürgerrat demokratie)
description: the "bürgerrat demokratie" is a mini-public on the national level, initiated by the german ngo "mehr demokratie " and the "schöpflin foundation". the organizations ifok and nexus were responsible for the planning and implementation of germany’s first federal citizens’ assembly.

title: equality world cup
description: an initiative that aimed to promote gender equality in the context of the 2018 world cup in russia.

title: mainstreaming democracy, participatory governance, and public accountability (dgpa): social accountability committees in gibe woreda, ethiopia
description: in gibe woreda, social accountability committees (sacs) have served as a participatory tool for local governance and social accountability, and led to substantial improvements in social outcomes.

title: engaging girls through dialogue, community scorecards and advocacy to combat early pregnancy in benin
description: through dialogue, community scorecards, and advocacy, the impact-elle project engaged girls and their communities, jointly with local and departmental authorities, in a series of actions aimed at combatting early pregnancies and promoted school attendance in benin.

title: participatory budgeting in lisbon - cycle 2017/18
description: lisbon was selected as a pilot site, it was envisioned as a good case to innovate their pb process with an online platform and a multichannel approach. it was expected that the experimentation in a capital like lisbon would make the empatia platform very visible to other cities in portugal and so on.

title: zebras for life
description: “zebras for life” is a participatory mechanism that designs and carries out artistic interventions in the streets as a way to signpost crosswalks, while seeking to claim the right to the city.

title: flats arterial community panel
description: the flats arterial community panel, convened by the jefferson center, was charged with exploring trade-offs across nine proposed arterial route options and working towards identifying the option that best met the needs of the neighborhood, the city of vancouver, and the region.

title: citizens juries on artificial intelligence
description: citizen jurors were charged with exploring and deliberating about how important it is to be able to understand how an artificial intelligence system reaches a decision (“explainability”), even if the ability to do so could make its decisions less accurate.

title: athens democracy forum 2018
description: attendees at the 2018 athens democracy forum had the opportunity to collaborate and craft concrete, creative, and actionable solutions to strengthen democracy through a shortened citizens jury-style process led by the jefferson center.

title: twin cities election forum
description: a forum convened by the jefferson center bringing together 52 twin-cities area residents, who represented the metropolitan area demographically and politically, for 5 hours of discussion about the 2016 presidential election.

title: minnesota community assemblies on local democratic engagement
description: outdated administrative, electoral, and participation structures often limit individuals from fully engaging in local democracy. this project asked residents of red wing and willmar, minnesota, to recommend local government changes that would reflect their values and aspirations.

title: your voice ohio
description: the your voice ohio media collaborative, supported by the jefferson center, supports newsrooms and journalists interested in using civic engagement to listen to their communities and identify information needs.

title: oregon citizens' initiative review on measure 15-119: banning genetically modified organisms (gmos)
description: measure 15-119 was a genetically modified organism ban placed on the ballot for may 20, 2014. a citizen's initiative review panel was organized and after 4 days the panelists voted 14-6 for the measure and wrote a cir statement with key facts on the measure to inform the voters.

title: colidérate: technology to protect colombian social leaders
description: colead (span. colidérate) is a civil society initiative which aims to protect social leaders, activists, journalists, and environmental and human rights defenders who are being systematically murdered in the face of denial by the colombian state.

title: decree 9.759 ending national councils & social participation policy in brazil (2019)
description: decree 9.759 extinguished brazil's national councils, ended the national social participation policy and generally disarticulated public participation in brazil.

title: decommissioning south african social services: participatory field research in delft
description: a study of the delft township as part of a participatory research initiative on the decommissioning of the south african social services social grant paypoints finds that elderly delft recipients experienced greater costs and indignities, although less so than in rural areas.

title: decommissioning south african social services: participatory field research in robertson
description: a case study of the robertson rural community  as part of a  participatory research initiative on the decommissioning of the south african social services (sassa) social grant pay points.

title: decommissioning south african social services: participatory field research in genadendal
description: a case study of the genadendal rural community as part of a participatory research initiative on the decommissioning of the south african social services (sassa) social grant pay points, finding that rural, elderly recipients faced greater costs and indignities as result.

title: decommissioning south african social services: participatory field research in khayelitsha
description: a case study of the khayelithsa urban township community  as part of a  participatory research initiative on the decommissioning of the south african social services (sassa) social grant pay points.

title: oregon citizens' initiative review on measure 90: oregon open primary initiative
description: a citizen's initiative review convened in oregon to deliberate on m90 a ballot measure that would change the primary elections law to a top-two system of general voting. a majority of 14 members of the cir opposed the measure compared to a minority of 4 members for the measure.

title: challenges of democracy: a proposal for costa rica
description: an initiative in costa rica that resulted in the suggestion to convene a broad group of costa rican citizens in their personal condition, to develop a process of broad and pluralistic discussion.

title: nicaraguan women editatona
description: in 2016, the nicaraguan women editatona (span. editatona de mujeres nicas) initiative involved the collective editing of wikipedia articles in order to enable woman to contribute to knowledge on nicaraguan feminism.

title: "let's talk about municipal reform” forums in the dominican republic
description: in early 2016, a series of public consultations were held under the name 'let's talk about municipal reform' which aimed to engage diverse actors in the deliberation process in order to identify preferences and interests in the subsequent municipal reforms.

title: reaf/mercosur: specialized meeting on family farming
description: specialized meeting on family farming (reaf) which was created in mercosur, in 2004, in order to deal with issues related to family farming. in this regional institution, civil society pressure over government representatives led to the developed norms, that allows the participation of small farmers in regional debates over agriculture in a two-level structure.

title: idea sourcing to solve housing crisis in vancouver
description: the city of vancouver crowdsourced ideas through a citizen participation platform in order to find innovative responses to the housing crisis.

title: june 2013 demonstrations in belo horizonte, mg, brazil
description: this text presents some specifics of the protests of june 2013 in the city of belo horizonte, mg, such as the initial carnival character and the forms of organization such as the horizontal popular assemblies (aph).

title: rural energy dialogues in greater minnesota
description: the rural energy dialogues seek to give rural communities the time, resources, and knowledge the need to understand the local energy system and identify recommendations for the future. the dialogues took place in stevens, winona, and itasca counties (minnesota) from 2017-2018.

title: participatory planning in rural areas in india
saying and doing: a colombian citizen participation initiative for change
description: saying and doing, is a 2017 initiative to strengthen citizen participation at the local level, aiming to link technology and social innovation to the interests of youth in order to create lasting peace in colombia.

title: stories that make a difference: climate narratives for a new world
description: a collaborative forum designed to engage and inspire ideas on how best to communicate climate change. "stories that make a difference: climate narratives for a new world" took place on may 24, 2019 at simon fraser university’s morris j. wosk centre for dialogue in vancouver, bc.

title: the hornet's nest. citizen mobilization
description: the hornet’s nest is a platform that promotes initiatives and campaigns that foster citizen leadership and effective civil society coordination. since 2016 they have supported causes that seek to generate concrete transformations for the construction of peace in colombia.

title: mapping mining conflicts in latin america
description: mining conflicts in latin america are represented using a digital platform in the form of an interactive map in order to enable users to visualize conflicts, cases of criminalization of protests, and consultations on mining.

title: rural climate dialogues in greater minnesota
description: the rural climate dialogues use a citizens jury approach to give rural residents the resources and information they need to think critically and create sustainable community solutions to climate change and extreme weather events.

title: forest of dean district citizens jury on new hospital locations
description: the nhs commissioned a citizens jury that would give forest of dean district residents the chance to evaluate prospective new hospital locations, and recommend a preferred location that would be best suited to meet the needs of the forest of dean now and for years to come.

title: citizens' jury on patient control of health record privacy in the uk
description: few approaches have gathered a clear understanding of the public’s contrasting priorities when considering privacy and better health outcomes. the health e-research center (herc) and the farr institute decided to use a citizens jury approach to identify what the public thinks.

title: yarra valley water citizens' jury
description: yarra valley water is the water provider for nearly 2 million people in melbourne. in 2017, they enlisted the help of  a citizens' jury to help develop its five year price plan.

title: byron shire community solutions panel
description: byron shire council in new south wales undertook a community engagement process, including a deliberative aspect, in order to help meet an increasing demand for better infrastructure with finite financial resources.

title: enabling national initiatives to take democracy beyond elections
description: this is a joint ongoing project between the new democracy foundation and the united nations democracy fund to promote deliberation and citizen involvement in democratic decision-making. the project will develop a range of resources and  projects in different national contexts.

title: act government housing choices
description: the act (australian capital territory) government undertook a consultation process to engage canberrans in decisions about future housing. the process included wider community consultation as well as a 'collaboration hub' deliberative process.

title: kangaroo island citizens' juries
description: kangaroo island, off the coast of south australia, faces unique challenges to provide public service to its small population. the local authority undertook two citizens' juries to firstly identify an ideal governance structure for the island, and secondly to consider how this could be achieved.

title: natural resources management deliberative panel in the murray darling
description: when faced with the dilemma of how to manage the region's natural resources, the murray darling nrm board chose to undertake a deliberative panel to understand local citizens' views on the key issues including possible rate increases, farming, tourism and protecting the environment.

title: innovating in social housing for older people in south australia
description: in this 90 day project, older tenants living in south australia's social housing were asked how their needs could be met in order to inform future housing developments. the project included a series of workshops culminating in a forum where tenants and industry stakeholders co-designed future housing for older people.

title: south australia power networks culturally and linguistically diverse focus groups
description: in 2016, south australian power network undertook a deliberative engagement with a group of citizens and a group of industry stakeholders to develop principles that would consider how their decision making impacts on customers.

title: act compulsory third party insurance citizens' jury
description: the australian capital territory (act) government convened a citizens' jury to address the issue of compulsory third party insurance for drivers. the jury worked alongside a stakeholder panel to identify a new model of insurance for the act.

title: better suburbs program for canberra
description: canberra has a growing population and the act government undertook a community consultation process as a pilot project for participatory budgeting in the city. participants were asked to consider budgeting priorities for canberra's suburbs.

title: the right not to obey
description: the right not to obey (spanish: el derecho a no obedecer) is a platform of citizen initiatives which enable active democratic processes and operate outside electoral politics in colombia.

title: ba chooses. ideas that transform the city
description: "ba chooses. ideas that transform the city" is an initiative that was created in 2017 as a program of the government of the autonomous city of buenos aires, aimed at seeking greater participation of the neighbors who live in the 15 communes of the argentine capital.

title: community engagement charter, south australia
description: in 2017, a panel of 50 south australian citizens worked with planning professionals to produce a draft charter for involving the community in planning and planning reform.

title: vision 2030 - living darwin
description: the city of darwin council convened a deliberative process with 80 darwin residents to help draft a strategic plan for darwin's future in 2030.

title: oregon citizens' initiative review on measure 92: mandatory labeling of gmos initiative
description: a citizen's initiative review was held in august 2014 to deliberate on proposed ballot measure 92 on gmo labeling. 11 of the 20 panelists in the cir opposed the measure where the remaining 9 favored it. measure 92 itself would be defeated at vote, by only a very small margin.

title: colorado citizens' initiative review (cir) on proposition 105: mandatory labeling of gmos initiative
description: the first cir to take place in colorado was held to deliberate on prop. 105. 11 members of the cir voted in favor of prop with 9 members voting against. the proposition was defeated at vote with a 65% majority voting against the mandatory labeling initiative.

title: uppsala speaks
description: a three day citizens' jury style process was used in uppsala, sweden concerning policies regarding street begging by internal eu migrants.

title: citizens' jury on climate change adaptation in australian capital region
description: part of the climate change and the public sphere (australian research council funded project). a three day panel based on the citizens' jury model concerned with climate change adaptation policy. associated research investigated deliberation and climate governance.

title: citizens jury of shared decision making in health, scotland
description: in the autumn of 2018 a representative group of 24 scottish citizens gathered over three days to make recommendations on shared decision-making in health and social care.

title: santa fe soil observatory
description: the santa fe soil observatory is an inter-institutional and interdisciplinary space created by the ministry of production in 2018, with the participation of public organizations, civil society and private actors related to the agricultural sector to address challenges facing it.

title: carers voice panel canberra
description: a deliberative panel of 49 citizens made up of carers and non-carers was convened in canberra to discuss ways in which to make canberra a more carer-friendly city and develop a carers strategy

title: energy futures citizens' panel (wa)
description: one of three citizens' jury style minipublics conducted by csiro on the question of what mix of energy technologies best fit australia's needs into the future. three processes were run in perth, newcastle and melbourne.

title: palmerston community plan
description: as a fast-growing city in australia's northern territory, palmerston faces a number of planning and financial challenges. to this end, the council engaged in a process to involve palmerston residents in developing a strategic plan. the process included community surveys and forums with young people and local aboriginal communities.

title: city of kingston customer service charter
description: the local government of kingston in the australian state of victoria undertook an engagement process to help refresh their customer service charter. the process involved two deliberative panels: one of community members and one made up of council staff. the aim was to co-design a new customer service charter.

title: nillumbik shire community panel
description: nillumbik shire council in victoria established a community panel of randomly selected citizens to deliberate on how to preserve its 'green wedge', an area of non-urban land on the outskirts of melbourne.

title: staying on track youth jury
description: in victoria, australia, a jury of randomly selected young people aged 18-25 were mandated with the task of considering how the state can support young adults in the transition from study to full time work.

title: gender equality citizens' jury
description: to assist in the preparation of a gender equality bill, the victorian state government commissioned a citizens' jury to consider the issues surrounding using quotas in the public sector to enhance women's representation and participation in public sector leadership.

title: transport network pricing community panel
description: infrastructure victoria,  a statutory agency in the australian, convened a community panel of randomly selected victorians to consider the conditions under which they would accept changes in the way they pay for public transport and road maintenance.

title: hervey bay esplanade community engagement
description: hervey bay is a bay area and city on the coast of queensland. as the area expands and diversifies, the local government sought community input in planning for the future of the hervey bay esplanade. the engagement process involved surveys, group forums and a community panel.

title: canberra brickworks precinct community panel
description: the canberra brickworks is a former industrial area in the australian capital. redevelopment of the site had become a divisive issue locally, and a community panel was convened to try and reach agreement on moving forward.

title: valsamoggia citizens' initiative review on local council amalgamation (iniziativa di revisione civica – irc)
description: the 2012 event was designed as a cir to inform a referendum on municipal amalgamation in the valsamoggia region near bologna. the event took place, but the results were not provided to citizens following an administrative ruling.

title: barwon water pricing commission
description: barwon water is a water provider in victoria, australia. as part of their community engagement process, the company convened a deliberative panel as well as engagement with the broader community in order to inform how barwon water provide services in the future.

title: arizona citizens' initiative review (cir) on proposition 487: pension reform
description: 20 members of the city of phoenix gathered to deliberate on prop. 487 regarding pension reform, specifically changing to a defined contribution plan and setting up ways to stop pension spiking. the measure failed with 58% of the vote against it.

title: arizona citizens' initiative review (cir) on proposition 205: marijuana legalization
description: 22 citizens of arizona deliberated on prop 205 which legalizes the recreational use of marijuana in the entire state. after 4 days of deliberation a majority of the panel voted for the proposition. however the measure was defeated by 51% of the vote going against the measure.

title: oregon citizens' initiative review (cir) on measure 97: business tax increase
description: 20 citizens of oregon deliberated on measure 97 which would have removed the cap on the corporate gross sales tax and establish a 2.5 percent tax on gross sales that exceed $25 million. 11 panelists supported the measure but it failed to pass with 59% of the votes being no.

title: massachusetts citizens' initiative review (cir) on question 4: marijuana legalization initiative
description: 20 citizens of massachusetts deliberated on question 4 which was the marijuana legalization initiative aimed to legalize marijuana but to regulate it just as they do with alcoholic beverages. 12 panelists voted for the measure. question 4 passed the vote with 53% in favor.

title: massachusetts citizens' initiative review (cir) on question 1: nurse-patient assignment limits initiative
description: 20 citizens of massachusetts deliberated on question 1 which would establish patient assignment limits for registered nurses working in hospitals. a majority of 10 panelists voted against the measure and subsequently the measure would fail to pass with 70% voting against it.

title: oregon citizens' initiative review (cir) on measure 26-199: portland metro region affordable housing bond
description: 20 citizens of portland oregon deliberated on measure 26-199 which would authorize 652.8 million in bonds to fund affordable housing in washington, clackamas, and multnomah counties of oregon. 12 panelists voted against the measure however the measure passed the referendum.

title: california citizens' initiative review (cir) on proposition 10: local rent control initiative
description: 20 citizens of california deliberated on proposition 10 which would allow local governments to adopt rent control on any type of rental housing, which would also repeal the costa-hawkins rental housing act. 12 panelists voted for the prop however it failed with 59% voting against

title: civic engagement and urban co-creation in bologna (2010-present)
description: since 2010 bologna has increased the number and variety of ways citizens can collaborate with the municipality to improve the urban commons. the result is a robust, multi-channel system of citizen engagement.

title: budgeting for outcomes in fort collins, colorado (2005-present)
description: since 2005, fort collins has pursued a budgeting strategy based on the efficacy of funded programs rather than price. final budget allocations are intended to reflect citizen priorities and to return the best results per dollar spent.

title: trustos: promoting trust as a currency
description: trustos is an initiative to convert face-to-face interactions into a new currency "trustos",  and to map trustos holders on a publicly accessible, online platform.

title: participatory path for the modification of municipal regulations in sanzeno, italy
description: an interesting and original participation path that aims to address the age-old conflict between the use of plant protection products in agriculture and health protection. the aim is to improve relations between farmers and citizens.

title: in search of democracy 3.0
description: in search of democracy 3.0 is a pilot project of the european network in situ using live performance, documentary series, lecture and a knowledge platform to investigate the challenges facing modern democracy and the potential solutions.

title: north-central new mexico landscape assessment (forestera)
description: two separate three-day stakeholder and citizens’ panels (cj-type event) considering land management options in northern new mexico, using a gis mediated process.

title: large-scale participatory budgeting in chengdu (china)
description: since 2008, chengdu’s special funds policy has enabled the implementation of wide scale participatory budgeting at the grass root level, reaching over 4,300 villages and neighbourhoods and 15 million residents by 2018, and distributing an annual budget of over 232 million usd.

title: citizen consultations on sydney's 'adapting for climate change’ strategy
description: a citizen engagement process including a citizens' panel on the development of a local government climate change adaptation policy.

title: the government laboratory of chile
description: this was the first government laboratory in latin america, and it’s a space that brings together state officials and representatives of civil society, with the common objective of promoting a modern and innovative state at the service of citizens.

title: city monday
description: city monday is a citizens' initiative that seeks to strengthen democracy by facilitating dialogue among citizens while connecting them with decision-makers.

title: western australia deliberative public forums on biobanking
description: western australia's department of health commissioned two deliberative forums - one with the public, and one with stakeholders - to inform biobanking policy and regulation. the majority of recommendations were included in the final legislation.

title: "idee in fuga" participatory budgeting in the bollate prison, milan
description: "idee in fuga" is the first participatory budgeting (pb) initiative to be carried out in an italian prison. it aims to strengthen detainees' participation in decision-making and create a bridge with the outside community by using crowdfunding for participants’ proposals.

title: "a toda costa": participatory sustainable development plan for garay and san javier
description: "a toda costa" (in english, "at all coast") is a sustainable development plan for the coastal region of the departments of garay and san javier, which are part of the province of santa fe.

title: "active citizens" online platform in colombia
description: the online platform active citizens was born in the city of cali in 2013 at the head of a group of independent citizens, with the purpose of connecting citizens with the public sector in order to improve the efficiency of public management.

title: open your municipality: web platform for citizen participation in peñalolén
description: open your municipality (spanish: abre tu municipio) was born in 2017 as an initiative of the organization “ciudadano inteligente” that, together with the municipality of peñalolén, implemented the first pilot of this project to open local governments.

title: legitimate popular consultation in mercaderes - cauca
description: the legitimate popular consultation for the defense of water, life and territory took place on august 3, 2019 in the municipality of mercaderes, cauca. the organization of the consultation and the logistics campaign for the “no” was organized by the coordinadora integral social mercadereña.

title: participatory slum upgrading process in the city of buenos aires: the "villa 20" case
description: the housing institute of buenos aires city government has designed and implemented a large-scale participatory slum upgrading process that is integrated, sustainable and inclusive through broad stakeholder participation in all phases of the intervention.

title: open knowledge advocacy in tanzania
description: the tanzanian creative commons community has established a strong legal and advocacy framework to educate their community about the necessity of open access to knowledge.

title: lethbridge citizens’ assembly on councillor employment and compensation
description: a three-day deliberative event on the work hours and pay rate of city councillors.

title: citizens’ reference panel on pharmacare in canada
description: a four day deliberative event on drug funding in canada.

title: stuttgart reloaded online public participation
description: stuttgart reloaded is a grassroots experimentation in online civic participation. the goal of the initiative is to develop an evidence base to back the adoption of an online platform for citizens to propose changes and improvements to the city and its governing institutions.

title: interactive workshops on the future of employment in canada
description: six interactive workshops held across canada by the brookfield institute as part of their employment in 2030 research project. over 120 participants with expertise in labour market trends analyze and forecast changes in demand for occupations and skills over the next decade.

title: city of sequim online citizen engagement service
description: developed with online polling service polco, the city of sequim launched its online citizen engagement system in august 2019. initial questions focused on general quality of life and community ratings. later polls asked residents about waste and recycling services.

title: carlow public participation network, ireland
description: the public participation network brings together local community organizations in an independent structure. ppn members are given the opportunity to network, communicate, and share information which leads to participation in local decision making and collective action.

title: citizens’ assembly of scotland
description: the citizens’ assembly was created to engage citizens on issues regarding the country's future on an inclusive, informed and respectful basis. assembly meetings will be held over six weekends from 25/26 october 2019 to 24/26 april 2020 in edinburgh and glasgow.

title: online citizen engagement on florida's multi-use corridors of regional economic significance program (m-cores)
description: florida transportation officials have set up a website for “citizen engagement” on three planned toll roads as part of a state-wide initiative to help revitalize communities, prepare for future population growth, and aid in disaster evacuations.

title: st. michael's hospital academic family health team patient design panel, toronto
description: a 1-day deliberative event attended by 36 randomly selected members of the public to provide input on improving the patient experience at st. michael's hospital.

title: national initiative for building community trust and justice
description: a six-city effort to promote more equitable, just, and respectful policing practices and improve relationships and trust between law enforcement and community members. analysis by the urban institute found that it was moderately successful in achieving its intended goals.

title: chicago neighborhood opportunity fund
description: created in 2016, chicago's nof creates and grows entrepreneurs in underserved commercial corridors by providing the equity that disadvantaged entrepreneurs need but often can't access.

title: detroit's project for public spaces
description: the project for public spaces brought the concept of placemaking to downtown detroit and engaged the public in the process. the resulting 'opportunity detroit' report outlined a detailed plan to transform the downtown for commercial and residential revitalization.

title: west vernor corridor neighborhood framework
description: over the course of a year, the city of detroit invited community residents, business, organizations, and other stakeholders to participate in various feedback gatherings to develop a redesign the west vernor corridor neighborhood in a way that strengthened the community.

title: lights for liberty protests against migrant detentions
description: nation-wide protests attended by upwards of 120,000 people calling for an end to migrant detention in inhumane conditions.

title: ghana stakeholder engagement on district assemblies' tax collection
description: a series of stakeholder engagements organized by the ghana developing communities association to help the district assemblies effectively collect local taxes and to use the influence of chiefs and opinion leaders to positively influence tax compliance at the community level.

title: go sedona! biking & walking community planning process
description: the city of sedona launched a public engagement campaign to inform its get outside (go) sedona walking and biking master plan. wikimapping allows residents to submit input online while face-to-face workshops allow for in-person participation and feedback.

title: the air we breathe: a community conversation (fort collins, co)
description: together with officials from the city of fort collins air quality program, the center for public deliberation gathered fifty-nine fort collins residents to discuss strategies residents could take to improve air quality.

title: public participation in the improvement of the salamanca-quelén  bajo route (chile)
description: public meetings were held in every locality where the road passed in order to inform attendants about the proposed route changes and allow them to raise concerns and issue feedback.

title: "voices from my neighborhood" mapping tool in montería, colombia
description: voices from my neighborhood emerged in mid-2017, in the slums of the city of montería, córdoba, as a mapping tool to identify local issues, potential solutions, and youth leaders that are creating change.

title: public participation in the improvement of the soruco-manquehua route (chile)
description: public meetings were held in every locality where the road passed in order to inform attendants about the proposed route changes and allow them to raise concerns and issue feedback.

title: implementation of the federal urban environment program in tomsk, russia
description: since 2017, the city of tomsk has carried out the russian federal 'formation of a modern urban environment' program through consultations with citizens, public meetings, and drawing contests. through the program, citizens are given a say over the development of the city.

title: citizens' initiatives on urban improvement in krasnoyarsk, russia
description: since 2015, the krasnoyarsk territory has provided local governments with up to 2.5 million rubles for the implementation of citizens' initiatives to improve the urban environments. projects are reviewed and selected by experts and the local government development council.

title: skip the small talk dialogue series, boston ma
description: skip the small talk's twice-monthly public events help strangers get to know each other through deliberative activities grounded in psychology research. interactive cards and structured facilitation allows people to interact in a low-stress, fun, and genuine way.

title: engage cobourg public consultation on repairs to the east pier
description: online and in-person consultations on repairs to the historic east pier. online participation will be held through the engagecobourg.ca website.  the campground consultation is a component of the larger public participation initiative on the 24-year waterfront plan.

title: deep cove parking & access community dialogue
description: designed and facilitated by the simon fraser university morris j. wosk centre for dialogue, the goal was to create a plan to address the local parking crisis, and explore issues of identity for a community struggling to reconcile being a small village and a tourist destination.

title: your voice. your home. meeting the housing needs of burnaby residents
description: your voice. your home. provided a set of unique in-person and online engagement opportunities for community members to gather and share ideas, present recommendations and engage with one another to find workable solutions to the city's housing crisis.

title: delbrook lands community dialogue
description: in fall 2015, the district of north vancouver partnered with the sfu centre for dialogue's civic engage program to develop an innovative, open and transparent engagement process on the future of the delbrook lands, a 4.3-acre site located at 600 west queens road.

title: citizen dialogues on canada’s energy future
description: convened by the sfu morris j. wosk centre for dialogue, citizens were engaged over a series of six cross-country dialogues in fall 2017. representing canada’s diversity, they overcame attitudinal and geographic differences to deliberate recommendations for canada’s energy policy

title: time travellers' culture jam: imagining art of the future
description: the vancouver design nerds teamed up with vancouver mural festival and sfu public square for an event where time travelling storytellers inspired participants to craft speculative time capsules from the future, envisioning what a thriving future arts and culture could be.

title: engage cobourg public consultations on the waterfront plan
description: the 2018 waterfront plan provides the community with a roadmap for creating a beautiful, accessible and sustainable waterfront through 83 initiatives in 24 projects over a 24-year period. public consultations will be held on each of the projects beginning in august 2019.

title: engage cobourg public consultation on victoria park campground
description: online and in-person consultations on plans to phase out the campground. online participation will be held through the engagecobourg.ca website.  the campground consultation is a component of the larger public participation initiative on the 24-year waterfront plan.

title: climate creatives workshop + party
description: coming up aug 22, 2019 join creative influencers for a workshop on making climate-related message salient to broad audiences ahead of the federal election in october 2019 and a party that celebrates the vibrant creative community that is stepping up to address the climate crisis.

title: citizens’ assembly for northern ireland: social care for the elderly
description: a civil society initiative designed to demonstrate the potential of deliberative democracy to break policy stalemates and put citizens at the heart of decision-making. the first assembly looked at the public’s aspirations for a social care system fit for the future.

title: greater cambridge citizens' assembly on infrastructure development
description: a citizens’ assembly established by the greater cambridge partnership to make recommendations on its infrastructure development plans, including the reduction of congestion, the improvement of air quality, and the provision of better public transport.

title: bottom-up budgeting (philippines)
description: bottom-up budgeting was implemented nationwide under benigno aquino from 2012 to 2016. while the program provided space for members of civil society to identify priority projects for government spending, design flaws limited its ability to transform governance.

title: collaborative observation & evaluation of tunisia's municipal elections
description: 6 ngos collaborated to observe tunisia’s first-ever municipal elections under its new constitution. in january, the group held meetings with target stakeholders to explain their 22 joint recommendations for improving the quality and integrity of the 2019 elections.

title: 'not on my bus' campaign, sri lanka
description: 'not on my bus' is the sri lankan arm of oxfam's worldwide 'enough' campaign that seeks to shift harmful social norms that justify gender-based violence through context-specific and relevant national campaigns.

title: udecide participatory budgeting in aberdeen, scotland
description: since 2018, aberdeen city council has invited community groups in three priority areas across the city to bid for a share of funding for projects that benefit local people. priority areas change from year to year as does the amount of funding.

title: abu dhabi community engagement programme
description: launched by the authority of social contribution, ma’an, the programme will provide individuals, government entities, companies and not-for-profit associations, with strategic direction on how people can contribute to social causes.

title: flash drives for freedom, north korea
description: usbs are a significant form of sharing information in north korea and have been smuggled into the country by defectors for decades. fdff is helping the effort by inspiring people all over the world to donate their own drives and resources.

title: hiv/aids service capacity project ukraine
description: a capacity building project involving trainings, workshops, and individualized technical assistant to selected local ngos and recruiting people living with hiv and representatives of the most at-risk population groups in regional and local coordination councils on hiv issues.

title: sarajevo’s true stories market
description: launched in 2016 as part of the sarajevo film festival's dealing with the past programme, the true stories market connects filmmakers with organizations that are researching and documenting the yugoslav wars and their impact and aftermath  on the region and its inhabitants.

title: illinois state university alternative breaks program
description: ab gives students the opportunity to volunteer their time to enact social change by helping meet tangible needs in other communities over spring, winter or summer break as well as weekends. nearly 1,000 students have participated since asb became a student organization in 2000.

title: extinction rebellion
description: extinction rebellion is an international, grassroots movement using protest tactics and non-violent civil disobedience to force political action on climate change and environmental degradation.

title: heart to heart summer camp for jewish and palestinian israeli youth
description: a yearly summer camp that brings together 10 jewish and 10 palestinian israeli youth for three and a half weeks to engage in recreational activities and to talk about identity, history, and power.

title: the laundry truck la
description: a mobile laundry service offering free clothes washing to unhoused individuals and families in downtown and greater los angeles.

title: the citizens' convention on climate
description: the citizens' convention on climate convened 150 randomly selected participants for seven weekends between october 2019 and june 2020. they defined measures to achieve a reduction of at least 40% in greenhouse gas emissions by 2030 and submitted them to the french government.

title: groundswell community mural project
description: a project that unites artists, at-risk youth, and community organization to create murals for social change. the murals serve as tools to enable community-building, focusing on topics like diversity, healthy living, conflict resolution, and history.

title: rali cares educational trailer: combating the opioid epidemic through interactive community education
description: developed by the rx abuse leadership initiative community awareness readiness engagement service (rali cares) and the code 3 association, the interactive educational trailer travels to communities around the country to teach families about the signs of drug use.

title: shape your budget, halifax
description: residents will help shape the next municipal budget and business plan by participating in a series of public engagement pop-ups in september 2019. the online and in-person shape your budget survey will inform decisions regarding municipal service levels in the next budget.

title: labhacker social innovation lab, brazil
description: labhacker is a citizen innovation laboratory of the brazilian house of representatives that works to improve transparency, participation, and citizenship through collaborative and experimental projects, and to facilitate citizen engagement through the e-democracia online portal.

title: online participation  at the national level in france
description: using the online parlement & citoyens platform, french citizens can participate in consultations on draft legislation, submit and endorse petitions, access information on the legislative process and politically relevant news, and even interact directly with members of parliament.

title: woodlawn 2025: community-led change on chicago's south side
description: chosen as the site of the new obama library, woodlawn 2025 brought together local groups, residents, and urban designers to ensure that longtime residents would not only see the benefits of the presidential center’s impact, but would also define the future of their neighbourhood.

title: citizens fact check the uk parliament
description: the uk parliament select committees’ evidence checks invite citizens to scrutinise the evidence which underpins government policy in specific areas, to determine how robust that evidence is, and to highlight where the gaps are.

title: rahvaalgatus.ee: online participation at the national level in estonia
description: using the online rahvaalgatus.ee platform, estonian citizens are able to draft, debate, and vote on legislative proposals. proposals with 1,000 signatures are sent to the relevant parliamentary committees for discussion with the chance of being signed into official law.

title: the uk parliament’s public reading stage pilot
description: between 2010 and 2013, three bills passed through a pilot ‘public readings’ process to allow citizens to provide feedback for 2-3 weeks. following the pilot, a new website was developed to improve user experience and facilitate public participation.

title: consensus-based participatory consultation using vtaiwan
description: using the online vtaiwan platform as a hub, taiwan residents can participate in a mixed online-offline consultation process with a wide range of stakeholders on a variety of issues with the aim to achieve a ‘rough consensus’.

title: the icelandic pirate party's use of democratic innovation
description: running on a platform of transparency and direct-democracy, the pirate party in iceland created several ways for members and non-members to participate in the political process: livestreamed meetings, policy crowdsourcing using the x.piratar.is platform, and online ‘pirate chat’.

title: podemos: party-led experiments with direct democracy in spain and madrid
description: coming to power in 2014, podemos has experimented with in-person meetings (‘circles’), online participation in the form of ‘citizen initiatives’ on the participa podemos platform, social media, nvotes candidate selection, and titanpad collaborative document writing and editing.

title: collaborative mixtapes
description: for bumbershoot 2019, the seattle design nerds produced giant audiotapes to capture a moment in musical and cultural history. participants wrote their favourite songs directly on the installation, populating a spotify playlist, or "collaborative mixtape" so anyone can listen in.

title: devon county citizens’ assembly on carbon reduction
description: a deliberative body established to collectively discuss and review policy recommendations on a plan to decarbonise devon. the assembly’s members will be drawn from a representative sample of citizens and will engage with the latest expert knowledge and research.

title: kingston borough citizens’ assembly on air quality
description: a deliberative body that met over two weekends in 2019 to learn about and discuss what steps the community should take to improve air quality. a representative sample of 40 members was to be drawn from approx. 7000 residents selected at random.

title: lambeth county citizens’ assembly on the climate emergency
description: as part of its plan to reduce carbon emissions and cut climate impacts, lambeth has established a citizens’ assembly, bringing together a representative sample of residents to deliberate and find common ground on a set of recommendations that can command public support.

title: sheffield citizens’ assembly on carbon reduction
description: after declaring a climate emergency and releasing plans to reach carbon neutral by 2030, sheffield city announced a series of citizens’ assemblies to consider the next steps. one assembly will be demographically representative while the other will be made up of ‘young people’.

title: climate assembly uk
description: the climate assembly uk was a deliberative body commissioned by six select committees of the house of commons to discuss how the uk should reach its net-zero greenhouse gas emissions target and propose a set of recommendations. it was composed of 108 randomly selected citizens.

title: sabi: community-led accountability to improve public services in sierra leone
description: sabi is a citizen-led accountability program increasing awareness of, and demand for, the delivery of basic services while supporting the building of relationships between citizens and state.

title: participatory budgeting in castlemilk, scotland
description: one parent families scotland and ardenglen housing association brought together two communities of interest, john paul ii and miller primaries to hear from pupils and parents on how each school should spend £10,000 to help lower the cost of the school day.

title: uk citizens’ assembly on the national food strategy
description: a deliberative body convened as part of a wider public engagement on the future of food and farming the uk. drawn from a demographically-representative random sample of citizens, the ca will hear from experts, deliberate on the issues, and provide policy advice.

title: the uk citizens’ biometric council
description: following a national survey that found majority support for the regulation of facial recognition technology, the ada lovelace institute established the citizens' biometrics council to bring public voice and deliberation to the use of biometrics technology in the uk.

title: citizens’ assembly on the future of democratic participation in wales
description: a deliberative body established to explore and suggest new and improved ways citizens can shape their future and have a greater say in democracy through the national assembly of wales. the national assembly commission w as to use the ca’s conclusions to inform its final decisions.

title: uk citizens’ assembly on funding for adult social care
description: the first such deliberative body to be commissioned and run by parliament, the randomly selected 47-member citizens' assembly met over three weekends to learn about, deliberate, and advise on funding strategies and priorities. the ca’s conclusions helped inform the parliamentary report.

title: deliberative polling on federalism in myanmar
description: a research experiment to demonstrate the viability of deliberation among diverse participants on the country’s federal arrangements. five events based on the deliberative polling methodology, two with local elites and stakeholder organizations, and three with mostly laypersons.

title: purple: project for democracy
description: a nation-wide campaign to help americans recommit to democratic values, stimulate civic engagement, and increase participation in public life. during november, organizers will hold local conversations to stimulate the national effort ahead of the campaign’s launch in november.

title: horseshoe bay local area plan multi-stakeholder engagement
description: the horseshoe bay lap will be prepared through a multi-stakeholder engagement process beginning with public ‘visioning’ workshops to integrate residents’ perspectives and priorities into planning and design options.

title: horseshoe bay terminal engagement
description: a 25-year development plan for the aging terminal. stakeholders, community organizations, and individual members of the public will be engaged from project definition through design.  participation is both face-to-face and online using ethelo software.

title: using government access television to enhance public engagement in austin, tx
description: looking to compliment their in-depth public engagement efforts, officials used the city’s television station to scale up participation. programs include portraits of communities taking action and interactive community conversations that allow audience participation.

title: global climate strike
description: over 150 countries host protests, rallies and strikes to support the youth-led "friday's for future school strikes for climate." the strikes demand an end to fossil fuel use, and radical steps to address climate change.

title: the piedmont mental health action plan
description: inspired by the values of the who, the piedmont region's mental health action plan aims to reorganize and improve the quality of service and the results of care and support for people with mental suffering.

title: croydon citizens' assembly on climate change
description: following its open sustainability summit in june, croydon council announced the creation of a new citizens’ assembly to provide recommendations on the borough’s plan to become carbon neutral by 2030.

title: à nous le plateau! montreal citizen’s assembly
description: inspired by vermont’s participatory democratic town meetings, the ‘a nous le plateau!’ citizens assembly provided an open forum for plateau residents to discuss issues, explore solutions, and engage with municipal and federal candidates and officials ahead of elections.

title: community democracy project: tennessee state university college of public service
description: through surveys, focus groups, and action workshops, the cdp empowered students to identify issues that impact their lives on-campus and within their wider community and introduced them to best practices on engagement with policy-making, governing institutions.

title: austin aquatic assessment interactive town hall
description: an interactive town hall meeting facilitated by the manager of the public engagement division, including a rotating panel of stakeholders in austin aquatics, questions and feedback from a live audience, and remote participation by over 6,000 residents via telephone and twitter.

title: ramsey county civic project
description: organized by a diverse group of public bodies and local organizations, the rccp responds to growing disaffection and declining voter turnout by supporting residents’ own efforts to make their communities and schools sites of civic activity and democratic education.

title: go out and vote: increasing political participation in washington d.c.’s underserved communities
description: for nine months leading up to the 2018 local elections, the “go out and vote” initiative used social media campaigns and youth citizen-centered programming to improve democratic practices and promote increased political participation among 16-24 year olds living in ward 7.

title: displacement forum
description: in vancouver, bc, on october 25, 2019, the eastside culture crawl society is hosting a public forum in conjunction with the art exhibition “displacement” addressing issues and challenges facing artist spaces, along with solutions.

title: america in one room deliberative poll on the 2020 elections
description: over 4 days, 526 voters from across the country took part in a deliberative polling event, organized in an attempt to break through partisan divides and focus on key issues: the economy and taxes, health care, the environment, immigration, and foreign policy.

title: ‘smart ways to antwerp’ multi-stakeholder engagement on sustainable mobility
description: the city-wide engagement process to develop mobility solutions involved public-private partnerships, the ‘smart use’ of data, and a progressive communications strategy. the city’s efforts were recognized with the 2019 civitas citizen and stakeholder engagement award.

title: participatory budgeting in victoria, bc
description: since 2017, the city of victoria has allowed residents to develop and vote on community projects for funding. 2019 saw five projects receive a portion of $55,000 under the theme "initiatives that make life better for youth in victoria".

title: 'emerge' leadership and community development program for evanston youth
description: emerge brings together evanston community leaders, university students, and teens in a practical, hands-on experience that teaches the importance of civic engagement and gives high school students a direct role in addressing some of the community’s most important issues.

title: social justice advocacy training for evanston youth
description: a program bringing high school and college students together to learn the basics of effective advocacy for systemic change on social justice issues. through highly interactive group work and strategy-mapping, students develop their agency and efficacy for democratic engagement.

title: #stickyquestions: contemplative, creative, and civic enquiry in san francisco
description: commissioned by the asian art museum, #stickyquestions was a public art installation that invited its audience to respond to questions of public ownership, challenge their opinions on accessibility, and co-create a future for urban civic renewal.

title: the sanfa project: finding grassroots solutions to sanitation problems in ghana
description: a pilot initiative in apam township, sanfa sought to engage community members in the development and implementation of sustainable sanitation solutions. using open space technology and theatre for development, the project fostered community ownership and collaborative action.

title: mysmartlife eu project
description: mysmartlife is an eu-funded sustainable innovation project currently being implemented in six cities. the project prioritises citizen involvement and seeks to develop an integrated urban transformation strategy that is transferable to other cities.

title: ecossolies: innovating the social and solidary economy in nantes, france
description: initiated in 2002, the ecossolies network brings together 600 members - including 300 companies, representing nearly 5,000 jobs - to cooperatively identify unmet social needs and to develop appropriate and innovative solutions in the social and solidarity economy.

title: great debate on the energy transition in nantes, france
description: over 200 days, nantes held a series of open debates and citizen-feedback sessions on its transition to clean energy. over 5,000 participants helped the region develop 33 commitments, the implementation of which will be overseen by a commission of citizens and stakeholders.

title: european research and innovation days 2019
description: the first in an annual series of events organized by the eu commission, innovation days brought diverse stakeholders together to co-create priorities for the first 4 years of the horizon europe programme. the event's free research exhibition also engaged and informed citizens.

title: 15 places to reinvent with the people of nantes
description: the city of nantes invited residents to submit and vote on projects that reinvent 15 public spaces. results included the creation of a zero-waste info hub in a former school, the transformation of an old restaurant into a 'participatory kitchen' serving those in need, and more.

title: nantes creative factory
description: an innovation program supporting the cultural and creative industries in nantes. its 'quartier de la création' is a laboratory, a workshop, and a showcase of the city's creativity, supporting collaboration between education, research, the arts, and the business world.

title: nantes citylab
description: a social innovation lab in nantes, the citylab provides physical and digital infrastructure to help innovators test new solutions in real life, such as a 3d printed social house constructed in three days or an autonomous shuttle powered exclusively by a solar road.

title: legal graffiti in prague
description: an innovative solution to the problem of unauthorized painting and 'tagging' of buildings. the city of prague expanded its support for legal graffiti to raise the profile of local street artists and to encourage the production of art that belongs to and reflects the community.

title: new voices campaign for student press freedom, rhode island
description: over the course of a year, high school junior, yanine castedo of the youth-led providence student union organized her community and built support for the student journalists’ freedom of expression act which was eventually signed into law in july, 2017.

title: new bedford whaling museum’s apprenticeship program
description: answering a citywide call to action on low graduation rates and increasing youth unemployment, the program allows disadvantaged students to enhance their academic and professional skills and knowledge, and to gain exposure to higher education and different career paths.

title: expanding community engagement at the queens museum of new york
description: beginning in 2006, the museum committed to a new strategy of outreach and engagement based on community organizing. the goal is to work with residents to bring about positive change in the community and to integrate community goals into various forms of cultural activity.

title: “rediscovering an american community of color: the photographs of william bullard” at worcester art museum
description: as part of its social responsibility, the museum partnered with clark university students and the collection’s owner to uncovered the lost stories of individuals in bullard’s photographs, to contact and reconnect with their descendants, and to preserve the town’s shared history.

title: collaboratively documenting apartheid at district six museum
description: in order to mediate the strained relationships within the surrounding community while documenting the country’s heritage, public and local leaders supported the communal-development of a museum dedicated to the forced relocation of south africans from cape town’s district six.

title: healing divisions through deliberation and dialogue at middlebury college
description: deep divisions were sown after a campus visit by an author who holds controversial views on race and iq. in response, the college hosted a number of community conversations, a faculty panel on white supremacy, small group discussions, and a series of ‘deliberation cafes’.

title: the metropolitan strategic plan of genoa [italian]
description: the metropolitan strategic plan of genoa has activated a participatory process, formally recognizing it as an indispensable methodology necessary for the effective functioning of the new body, the metropolitan city.

title: bioplatformalab - sesto san giovanni [italian]
description: to address the senescence of the incinerator in via manin (sesto s. giovanni, milan) and redefine waste management according to circular economy principles, the core and cap companies propose an industrial symbiosis plant and submit it to public debate.

title: taiwan presidential hackathon
description: an annual event bringing together government leaders, public officials, and citizens to jointly develop, innovate, and 'hack'  government programs and services. the initiative emphasize the importance of open-source, open data, and related best practices in meeting citizen needs.

title: faith in/and democracy pilot project
description: an initiative in collaborative funding, the faith in/and democracy seeks to address the nexus between faith and democracy by funding projects that use faith-based engagement to cross religious and cultural divides.

title: matchup eu
description: an eu-funded smart city project deployed in 6 countries across europe to implement innovative and replicable solutions in the energy, mobility and ict sectors. the project takes a citizen-centric approach, adopting technology-driven solutions and non-tech actions.

title: matchup valencia participatory workshops
description: part of the matchup eu project, two workshops brought together public and private sector representatives, researchers, and citizens’ to draft issue-specific action plans, create a stakeholder group to drive the project, and rethink the use of ‘smart’ to describe city innovation.

title: the inaugural world poverty forum: ‘davos with the poor’
description: an attempt to get the voice of the poor heard on the world stage and to reverse the often unequal power dynamics of development conferences. the first world poverty forum was held where its founder, kennedy odede, was raised: the kenyan slum of kibera.

title: san marcos strategic housing action plan, austin tx
description: a planning process including 15 meetings and working groups, two open house events, several community conversations with local organizations, and a public call for comments and stories.

title: public square: improving uk democracy at the local level
description: an action-research programme working with councils across the uk to understand how they can improve their democracies and include more citizens in decision-making. the programme will trial digital tools and democratic innovations and will share their findings publicly.

title: the uk government’s innovation in democracy programme
description: a nation-wide programme to trial the use of deliberative mini-publics to increase the involvement of citizens in decision-making at local government level. in the first year, three local authorities will hold face-to-face and online public engagements on key policy decisions.

title: australia community jury on prostate-specific antigen screening
description: an 11-member jury considered psa screening benefits and harms and whether the government should conduct screening campaigns. the jury's unanimous verdict that such campaigns should not be run was notable in the light of their divergent views on their own screening choices.

title: legislative-citizen commission on minnesota resources stakeholder engagement
description: members of the public shared their environmental and natural resource funding priorities for the environment and natural resources trust fund. the events are part of lccmr’s 2019 strategic planning process, which will guide funding for the next six years.

title: go getters youth engagement program, newfoundland & labrador
description: an initiative aimed at people age 19-30 that promotes the benefits of community participation through community service and civic engagement. the program encourages citizen engagement and the integration of social and economic development and leadership in the policy process.

title: live longer: empowering and engaging pittsburgh communities
description: a partnership between a homewood-based community group and a university of pittsburgh research team using community meetings and outreach to study how life expectancy is impacted by social determinants of health.

title: klamath salmon protectors youth and family camp
description: a two-day event for yurok tribal families and other salmon-dependent people from northern california including trainings and discussions on advocating for clean water and tribal rights, community organizing, arts and activism, and traditional skills like processing salmon.

title: anti-eviction mapping project
description: a data-visualization, data analysis, and storytelling project documenting dispossession and resistance against gentrification. the project works with community partners and housing movements and creates tools for collective resistance and movement building.

title: homes for all campaign
description: a national campaign to protect, defend, and expand affordable housing by engaging those most directly impacted through local and national organizing, advancing rental protection policies, and supporting efforts to build community-controlled housing.

title: policy labs on the future of the uk labour party
description: over four days at the world transformed festival in brighton, hundreds of people participated in a series of ‘policy labs’ to discuss policy issues, challenge existing proposals, and devise new solutions. the results are to be presented as a manifesto to the uk labour party.

title: hybrid governance in the democratic republic of the congo
description: despite being declared a ‘failed state’, numerous public service sectors continue to function thanks to localized arrangements. central state rule has become secondary the hybrid form of governance comprising diverse actors - ngos, churches, donors, and ordinary citizens.

title: the san quentin project: understanding the role of art & power
description: a series of visual documents developed through ‘mapping exercises’ with the men incarcerated at san quentin state prison, the art installation allows viewers to connect with each individual, and to consider the role of art and power relationships in codifying prison narratives.

title: cambridge compact for a sustainable future
description: with more than 20 public and private organizations as signatories, the compact’s adherents collaborate to leverage their combined capacities in research, teaching, innovation, entrepreneurship, and program development to improve the city’s health, livability, and sustainability.

title: living democracy summer program at auburn university
description: a summer program that prepares undergraduates for civic life by pairing students and community residents for a living-learning experience to collaborate on issues of concern to alabama communities.

title: 'reimagine gary' citizen engagement on the city's future
description: the new mayor of gary began a community engagement process on the city’s future with a series of public “can we talk” meetings, an online survey, and 75-member volunteer forum. forum attendees will continue to help shape the city as members of issue-specific citizen committees.

title: the helsingborg vision fund: supporting citizen-led innovation
description: three times a year, citizens can submit proposals for a 100 000 kr gtant to fund the prototyping/testing of their projects and ideas to improve the city and city life. over 100 projects have been initiated and completed since the fund was created in 2014.

title: citizens’ convention on uk democracy
description: a two-year process that is informed by ideals of deliberative democracy and designed to forge a new partnership between elected representatives and the people, to animate and inform a public debate about democratic reform, and to result in actual legislative changes.

title: public deliberation on school day regulations in seoul, korea
description: a public engagement and deliberation process on the institution of mandatory days off on sunday for afterschool academies (cram schools). preliminary online and telephone polling will be followed by an open discussion and debate by a 200-member citizen panel.

title: “together at the table” hunger and poverty summit
description: with hundreds of attendees from different sectors, the summit addressed the migration crisis, hunger’s cost on health care and community-based interventions, and breakout sessions were held on public policy, community organizing, health and nutrition, and food-security research.

title: music action women
description: the music action women initiative gives voice to the experiences, specific and shared, of highly creative women who are using art and pushing for social change. their music action lab is a residency for artists around the world to create original music to foster social good.

title: dallas independent school district participatory budgeting
description: in october, 2019, disd trustees unanimously approved a $60,000 grant which students and community members will compete to win for their campus-based projects of choice. the initiative aims to spark interest and engagement around how governmental bodies make choices and fund them.

title: strategic plan of tourism in veneto [italian]
description: the strategic tourism plan was established by the veneto regional law 11/2013 to bring together all the players in the sector on shared actions, reduce fragmentation and accompany growth trends by increasing their value.

title: neighborhoodstat new york
description: a joint problem-solving initiative developed by the mayor’s office of criminal justice, neighborhoodstat empowers residents of high-crime public housing developments to work directly with city leaders to address the social, economic, and environmental conditions linked to crime.

title: co-creating a new official community plan and zoning bylaw, village of canal flats
description: the new ocp and bylaw were created by working with a committee of community volunteers, contracted planners, and council and staff. extensive public outreach was undertaken with several open houses and workshops, online engagement,  and updates in the community newsletter.

title: empowering & protecting the lgbtq community in washington, dc
description: with a $445,000 budget, the office of lgbtq affairs works with city police and the community to develop strategies and programs to prevent violence against lgbtq+ individuals. initiatives include social media campaigns, public information and outreach, and social events.

title: friends of putnam: collaborating to reclaim the neighbourhood
description: in response to rising crime, vagrancy and blight, neighbours and business owners joined together to reclaim their community. after a few initial meetings, the group invited city officials to hear their concerns and find common ground to take action.

title: close to home: finding an end to domestic violence in san luis obispo, ca
description: a four-year program jointly developed by the rise non-profit and the california department of public health, close to home is engages the community to search for the root causes of sexual and intimate partner violence and work together on potential prevention measures.

title: participatory budget for schools in brno, czech republic
description: complimenting its regular pb process for voting-age citizens, brno has trialled a ‘pupil pb’ over the past two years in 27 local schools. funded improvements include drons, ping-pong tables, drinking fountains, 3d printers, seat bags, tablets and many more.

title: participatory budgeting in brno, czech republic
description: in 2017, brno became the first city in the czech republic to introduce pb municipal level. the initiative gives citizens say over czk 35 million (approx. usd $1.4k) to fund at least 11 projects. pb is just one facet of the ‘smart brno’ initiative to support citizen engagement.
