title: participatory budgeting in san lorenzo, argentina (2012 - present)
description: pb has been used in san lorenzo since 2013. the introduction of online voting in 2018 increased participation by 50% from previous years, and the 2019-2020 cycle saw the introduction of blockchain technology to increase voting security and funding transparency.

title: santalab: santa fe’s public innovation laboratory
description: a space for open collaboration using the ‘quadruple helix of innovation’: state, citizenship, organizations, and companies. the project was introduced as part of the state’s policy on innovation and open government, and aims to move from ‘deciding with’ to ‘doing with’ citizens.

title: harvard votes challenge
description: a university-wide effort supported to increase voter registration and participation among eligible students, staff and faculty. the civic engagement program is coordinated by students and works across the entire harvard university community.

title: red glocal: integrating new immigrants in estacion central
description: launched in january 2019, red glocal facilitates the socioeconomic integration of the city’s newest residents by connecting them to new jobs and helping them open new businesses. the project’s small staff amplifies their impact through collaboration with community partners.

title: pop-up retail space for small businesses in jersey city
description: looking for an innovative approach to helping small businesses find retail space, jersey city purchased a number of shipping containers to offer business owners a rent-free launch pad for their enterprises while simultaneously create a new pop-up shopping district for the city.

title: raise-op: creating affordable, inclusive, and democratic homes in lewiston, me
description: led by young, white college graduates, lewiston’s first housing co-op sought greater representation in its leadership to reach communities in need of housing. raise-op was founded to reflect the diversity of the neighbourhood and to support the civic engagement of its members.

title: re-cast participatory budgeting, st. louis
description: each year, participatory budgeting delegates have an opportunity to select what services are provided in their community as part of funding from re-cast: the resiliency in communities after stress and trauma $4.7 grant from the substance abuse and mental health administration.

title: participatory budgeting in dartmouth, nova scotia, canada
description: dartmouth’s pb has been held yearly since 2017, giving district 5 residents the opportunity to cast ballots to award $50,000 in funding to community groups. the initiative was brought to the district by councilor sam austin and was to run again in 2019.

title: #bharatkilaxmi social media dialogue on women’s rights
description: a government-led online dialogue on women's rights and equality, the campaign began with a tweet about shila dawre, india’s first woman auto-rickshaw driver. the hashtag has since been trending with people sharing stories of women who have excelled in their fields.

title: rewarding citizen recycling with cryptocurrency in argentina
description: misiones’ local government rewards citizens who separate their waste with ‘jellycoins’. the program incentivizes citizen action on recycling and the use of blockchain technology ensures transparency. citizens have complete control of their earned funds.

title: designing 'unknown soldier square' with pubic space users in gorzów wielkopolski, poland
description: in 2016 users of the square of the unknown soldier were included in the design stage of changes in public space. the investment organizer was the city hall of gorzów as the first in poland. the company pronobis studio was responsible for the project and cooperation with residents

title: coffee with a cop, evanston
description: since 2014, the northwestern university neighborhood and community relations department has hosted a weekly “coffee with a cop” event to provide a “casual space” for residents to talk with officers, ask questions, share concerns, or simply get to know one another.

title: participatory budgeting in greensboro, nc
description: participatory budgeting was adopted by the city in 2014 at the behest of citizens. each pb cycle lasts two years. citizen ideas are reviewed by volunteers and turned into project proposals which are then held to a public vote. each district is allocated $100,000.

title: agriculture tomorrow [italian]
description: in view of the upcoming programming of european agricultural policies (2021-2027), the council of the province of trento asks how tomorrow's agriculture will be and how do you want it to be, what scenarios you want and what policies to achieve them?

title: city for all program, israel
description: the city for all program promotes gender mainstreaming and gender equality action plans within local governments in israel. implemented in rishon lezion, taybe, akko and haifa, the program works to create a multi-level gender equality action plan through public participation.

title: new york city charter revision process 2018-19
description: as part of its work, the charter commission initiated a robust program of civic engagement. two rounds of public hearings were held in each borough, citizens were engaged over social media, and a multi-lingual tele-town hall included simultaneous translation.

title: desa digital, west java
description: led by the west java ict agency, the project aimed to close the rural-urban digital divide in indonesia by using iot technology, 600 satellites, and a series of digital literacy programmes to help villagers improve their industries.

title: making open data open to all in buffalo, ny
description: the city of buffalo has built a people-first model for open data based on the belief that open data is only useful if the public knows how to use it. starting with a multistakeholder-drafting of the policy, the city’s open data initiative is committed to community engagement.

title: youth participatory budget, bloomington, in
description: designed to increase youth engagement in the community and with government, the ypb ran for the first time in 2019. the process is student-led, from writing the rules and developing a timeline, to brainstorming ideas, developing proposals, and voting on final projects.

title: beautiful canvas canvas - monghidoro (bologna) [italian]
description: the name of the process derives from two traditional practices: the "canto del maggio" with which people return to visit the villages after the winter and "tela bella tela", a traditional local game, with which children learn to remain united despite the difficulties.

title: mobilize - union of romagna faentina [italian]
description: path for the participatory definition of interventions in the field of sustainable mobility for home-work paths for craft and industrial areas in the romagna faentina area.

title: debate in ponte - tuscany [italian]
description: a public debate on a new bridge over the arno, already planned, which had been called, with the relative assignment of the task to the manager, who never started and of which no news is given.

title: the alberta narratives project
description: a community-based initiative to seek a more open and constructive basis for conversation about climate and energy among albertans. 75 organizations hosted 55 narrative workshops around the province making this one of the largest public engagements of its kind.

title: citizens' jury on the use of ai in decision-making
description: a citizens' jury deliberated on the ethical issues raised by the application of ai under different circumstances and how public and private entities should respond. the resulting toolkit provides a guide for deploying ethical processes around the proliferation of ai technologies.

title: citizen budget engagement 2020, city of wetaskiwin
description: the city's online tool and in-person open houses allow community members to give feedback on annual spending priorities.

title: tempelhol-schöneberg citizen councils, berlin
description: the tempelhof-schöneberg district has instated a total of seven citizens' councils based on the vorarlberg model with state funding of 150,000 euros. the first council, assembled by lot, met on 9 and 10 august 2019 and presented its results four days later at a "bürgercafe".

title: gorgona inclusive and sustainable island
description: the gorgona isola inclusiva e sostenibile project concerns the territorial context of the gorgona island (livorno). the prison on the island has characterized its recent history, closing it to the outside world and preserving it. now we look to the future.

title: participatory budgeting at gdańsk university of technology, poland
description: since 2016, gdańsk university of technology has invited its employees and students to submit proposals for a share of 500,000 zlotys (approx. $130,000 usd).  gut is the first university to institute pb in poland, and 21 projects have been funded and completed as of 2019.

title: participatory budgeting in richmond, va
description: in october 2019, richmond city council announced that it would be allocating $15 million of its capital improvement program budget for citizen projects. residents will be allowed to suggest, plan, and vote on community improvement projects for a share of the funds.

title: people-powered publishing conference
description: the pppc uses a hands-on approach to engage journalists, civic-engagement specialists and community storytellers in learning how to create a more collaborative and equitable news landscape by strengthening the connections between news organizations and the people they cover.

title: the "ligue os pontos" program: sustainable, circular and resilient urban agriculture in são paulo
description: a city-led program to promote a sustainable model of local development by fostering the development of a circular economy between the agricultural production of rural peripheries and the vibrant consumption market of são paulo’s city centre.

title: 'development without displacement': the women’s community revitalization project, philadelphia
description: a participatory approach to build affordable housing. the wcrp works with residents and neighborhood groups to determine their needs. the group sets up “listening projects” to identify the priorities, community concerns and capacity for similar developments in the neighborhood.

title: pedal to porch, detroit
description: a neighborhood bike ride with predetermined stops where residents share stories from their front porch. storytelling lowers the barrier of connection between neighbors, strengthens the social fabric of communities, challenges limited narratives of place, and preserve history.

title: chilecracia: building a 'just-in-time' participatory platform for protestors in chile
description: as chileans filled the streets in the largest protest rally in the country’s history, citizens at the grassroots built a digital platform to give participants a way to communicate and vote on policy ideas. in just 24 hours, over 1 million people voted on more than 60,000 ideas.

title: participatory grantmaking in barking and dagenham
description: an innovative process using a deliberative mini-public to ensure the allocation of borough funds benefited the whole community. participants selected through sortition met several times to deliberate, evaluate, and select winning grant proposals.

title: camerino reconstruction workshop
description: a participatory design workshop was used for the drafting of strategic guidelines for the development of the camerino reconstruction plan after the 2016 earthquake.

title: participatory budget pilot in lisburn & castlereagh
description: the 'grand choice' initiative makes £15,000 available for projects across the district electoral of lisburn & castlereagh. individual citizens and community groups can propose projects under three themes. winning projects will be voted upon by the community.

title: #horizon fano 2030 [italian]
description: the strategic plan does the city. the most advanced experiences show how the outcome of a strategic plan is mainly attributable to the quality of relations between the players in the field, together with the ability to guide and coordinate the process. how did it go to fano?

title: stop didymo
description: alto al didymo is an app for cell phones that allows citizens to identify, report and prevent the presence of algae "didymo" in areas of chilean freshwater.

title: manich msamah (manich msema7), tunisia
description: manich msema7 is a tunisian youth-led social movement that resisted anti-reconciliation bills forwarded by the ennahda-nidaa tounes-led government to grant amnesty to former regime officials and bureaucrats accused of corruption under the former ben ali government.

title: feminindex in argentina
description: feminindex is a questionnaire that measures the political commitment and positioning of candidates regarding the gender agenda in argentina

title: participatory path to composting plants in rome [italian]
description: the management company of environmental services in rome, ama, must identify sites available for the location of 2 composting plants (from 60,000 t / a) to tackle the waste problem, which is increasingly serious in the capital, but the distrust of citizens is strong.

title: sump city of l'aquila - urban sustainable mobility plan [italian]
description: the sustainable urban mobility plan (sump) is a strategic planning tool that, over a medium-long time horizon (10 years), develops a system vision of urban mobility. it provides a participatory space.

title: puglia regional waste management plan
description: a participatory process was activated for updating the regional urban waste management plan (gestione dei rifiuti urbani, (prgru)), aiming to draft a document which was consistent with new regulations.

title: melfi, participatory public conference, biomethane plus [italian]
description: the project involved the construction of a biomethane and compost production plant for anaerobic digestion of urban organic waste (forsu). the municipality of melfi called a participatory public conference and then decided.

title: napoli, urbact iii 2nd chance
description: as part of the eu urbact iii program, the municipality of naples has chosen the recovery of the complex of the ss. trinità delle monache, with a view to urban regeneration with reference to the territorial context in which it is inserted (quartieri spagnoli and montesanto). ..

title: hoboken's online survey on e-scooters
description: the city of hoboken's six-month pilot program with lime electric scooters is ending and they must decide whether to keep the scooters. the program has been very contentious, so they used involved to gather feedback from a wide audience of residents.

title: the agora of messina [italian]
description: '' the agora of messina '' is a project of the international organization the democratic society on democratic participation and public spaces in the city of messina. the project aims to create a civic platform capable of connecting citizens.

title: 2018 participatory budgeting in canicattini bagni, syracuse, italy
description: in its second year, the participatory budgeting project of the municipality of canicattini bagni (province of syracuse) involved citizens participating in the allocation of resources to proposed projects in the areas of sport and public education.

title: nyc street homeless solutions' "model of practice" policy co-creation
description: the street homeless solutions division of nyc department of homeless services embarked on a new policy co-creation process inspired by the vtaiwan engagement framework to create a ‘model of practice’ for each of the three core service areas of home-stat street outreach.

title: participatory process for the knowledge and identification of the rural landscapes of sardinia [italian]
description: in 2014 the regional council of sardinia approved the research project aimed at identifying and analyzing rural landscapes according to current needs, also in relation to operational development programs, municipal planning acts and sector plans.

title: destination sardinia 2018-2021 - strategic tourism plan [italian]
description: participatory strategic plan for the development and tourism promotion of sardinia, territorial meetings and online platform are the main participatory tools of the path ...

title: kudumbashree mission in kerala, india
description: kudumbashree (meaning “prosperity of the family” in the local malayalam language) is the kerala government's ongoing participatory “poverty eradication and women empowerment” mission, which started in 1998, and works through a three-tiered community network of women.

title: panchayat (or panchayati) raj
description: the panchayat raj is a system of local self-government for rural areas in india for the purposes of preparation and implementation of plans for economic development and social justice in rural areas.

title: the national dialogue on mental health
description: a 2013 conference brought together mental health experts and members of congress to launch a national conversation on mental health to mobilize the public to help individuals suffering from mental illness and prevent future tragedies resulting from ignoring mental illness.

title: an evaluation of glasgow city participatory budgeting 2018-19
description: a short, independent evaluation was carried out by the glasgow centre for population health.  the evaluation precludes any assessment of the projects funded and their impacts at a neighbourhood and local level.

title: democratic superheroes: argentinian participatory election monitoring app
description: democratic superheroes (span. superhéroes democráticos) is a free application developed by the ngo electoral transparency (span. transparencia electoral) to promote election monitoring in argentina and to inform citizens on election-related topics.

title: 1800-crime
description: 1800-crime is a tool that promotes citizen participation in the enforcement of security and rule of law.

title: dicamba task force
description: in 2017, the winthrop rockefeller institute facilitated a two-day deliberation among members of a statewide task force concerning the use and effects of the herbicide dicamba in the u.s. state of arkansas, and about ways to address those effects.

title: public consultation on accommodation for refugees (konstanz)
description: public consultation processes were carried out with regard to two connecting accommodations for refugees in konstanz. efforts to involve citizens in a participatory manner were low, but articulated opinions were taken into account in the decision-making process.

title: expert panel review of environmental assessment processes
description: between september 1st, 2016 and march 31st, 2017 the canadian environmental assessment agency conducted an expert panel review of the environmental assessment process with the objective of designing a transparent and participatory consultation process.

title: public consultation for a residential building project (fellbach, germany)
description: an example of a citizen participation project from the city of fellbach, germany for a residential building project, two meetings comprised this participatory process.

title: canadian national housing strategy
2016 nutrition north canada consultation
the way forward on aquaculture
description: a case study on the government of newfoundland’s co-development process.

title: 2016 international assistance review
venezuelan national hospital survey
description: the national hospital survey reports on the operability of medical equipment in public hospitals in venezuela. since the health ministry has not published data in 3 years, the hospital survey has become the main source of information about the crisis of the health system.

title: committees for aid and freedom
description: the committees for aid and freedom are an initiative of the frente amplio venezuela libre with the objective of organizing citizens at the bases of the opposition.

title: south korea’s citizen council on national health insurance
description: a one-day citizen council initiative that used deliberation as a main method to explore what social values are considered important by lay citizens in health resource allocation priority setting.

title: final phase of participatory budgeting in vancouver's west end
description: west end (in vancouver, bc)  community members get to vote on how to spend $100,000 of public funds to improve their neighbourhood.

title: redser: dominican network for the sustainable development of renewable energies
description: redser brings together more than 50 community micro hydro-power plants in the country with the purpose of coordinating the exchange of knowledge and resources for sustainable development among communities.

title: first evaluation of the vitoria-gasteiz citizen participation observatory
description: vitoria-gasteiz's citizen participation model is formally reviewed. the model was developed according to its three complementary dimensions: a global or general dimension, a sectoral or thematic dimension based on issues that affect citizens, and a territorial dimension.

title: socio-educational forum in the dominican republic
description: the socio-educational forum is a network of 14 organizations working in the field of education in the dominican republic. it monitors the perfomance of public spending and promotes dialogue among stakeholders to improve the quality of education in the country.

title: better together design jam
description: hosted by vancouver design nerds, this design jam was part of the better together event organized by united way of the lower mainland.

title: caimito sustainable association
description: the caimito sustainable association (span. asociación caimito sustentable) seeks to strengthen the community through collective efforts for the ecologically conscious development of tourism and agriculture in caimito.

title: city of sydney - planning for 2050
description: in 2018 the city of sydney undertook a multi-phase community engagement to generate ideas inform a vision and plan for the city by 2050. this included a citizens' jury who considered content from experts and the wider public before delivering their recommendations for concepts that should be implemented by 2050.

title: parramatta youth jury
description: in 2003, parra youth matters, a youth organisation in parramatta (sydney) collaborated with academic partners to organize australia's first youth citizens' jury with 15 young people to deliberate on issues of concern to their community.

title: city of parramatta citizens' jury
description: in 2017 parramatta council in nsw convened its first citizens' jury to decide on a design and plan for its new civic building and library.

title: quito open government
description: as a member of the open government partnership, the municipal government of the metropolitan district of quito developed a strategy to set up an open government seeking to enact the principles of transparency, collaboration and participation in their administration.

title: "stop the harrassment" hotline in quito, ecuador
description: "stop the harrassment" is a hotline that allows citizens to report harassment cases in public transport in real time. after sending an sms, a response system is activated prompting authorities to intervene promptly. the collaborative platform has prosecuted 43 complaints so far.

title: urban agriculture program in cuenca (pauc)
description: in the city of cuenca, productive and economic activities have been incorporated into land use plans and urban legislation for more than two decades. the goal of this project is to promote citizen participation, environmental awareness, and food security.

title: covid-19 community support groups
description: an emergent and growing series of grassroots, community-initiated support groups are matching local requests with offers of support during the global covid-19 pandemic of 2020.

title: covid-19 global hackathon
description: nth opinion, a health-tech startup, launched an open-source project for medical professionals to connect and share critical information regarding covid-19 in real-time.

title: the social distancing festival
description: the social distancing festival is an online artist’s community made to celebrate and showcase the work of the many artists around the world who have been affected by the need for social distancing that has come about due to the spread of coronavirus (covid-19).

title: mass singing during the covid-19 pandemic
description: during lockdowns in many countries affected by the covid-19 outbreak, people began singing from their windows or harmonizing online together in an effort to maintain morale and social connections.

title: nachbarschaftschallenge (neighborhood challenge) during covid-19
description: the neighborhood challenge encourages people to help out elderly and vulnerable neighbors during the covid-19 by carrying out small services for them if they are unable to the leave their apartments.

title: virtual conversation cafe about covid-19
description: this online participatory event takes an existing dialogue method into the virtual space, offering an opportunity to connect around how we are feeling and thinking, as well as exploring what to do next as individuals and a collective during the covid-19 pandemic. march 25, 2020.

title: folding@home: crowdsourced supercomputing project for covid-19
description: folding@home uses distributed computing power from citizen volunteers in order to contribute to the open science research efforts of scientists studying life-saving covid-19 therapies.

title: opendemic: anonymous covid-19 proximity alerts
description: opendemic is a crowdsourcing app which aims to fill gaps in covid-19 data;  it allows users to anonymously share their locations and health status as well as receive alerts about nearby cases, both potential and confirmed.

title: citizens’ jury on referendum options in korsholm, following citizens’ initiative review
description: a citizens' jury discussed municipal merger options prior to a referendum on the topic. the jury's mission was to provide voters with reliable and balanced information concerning this locally polarized issue. the jury process followed the citizens' initiative review model.

title: foldit: crowdsourced puzzle game for covid-19 protein research
description: foldit uses citizen scientists to crowdsource contributions to protein research is necessary to understand to cure diseases. recently with this project, participants have helped proteins that could block the covid-19 virus from infiltrating human cells.

title: demoscan citizens' initiative review in sion
description: the demoscan citizens’ initiative review in sion, switzerland, gathered 20 citizens to discuss the federal popular initiative on affordable housing. participants produced a report outlining the key facts of the initiative, as well as its pros and cons, for fellow voters.

title: swiss hackathon #codevscovid19
description: hackzurich and the federal department of home affairs organizes a 72h non-profit hackathon for people with expertise in data science or healthcare to search for innovative possible solutions to cope with the covid-19 pandemic.

title: “andrà tutto bene” (everything will be alright) covid-19 support flags in italy
description: italian communities offer visual support during covid-19 isolation: hand drawn rainbow flags hang from balconies bearing the slogan "andrà tutto bene” (everything will be alright), reminding neighbours that we are all in this together.

title: "adopt-an-elder" during covid-19 by becoming a video call volunteer
description: nursing homes in london are using video call technology and recruiting volunteers to connect with isolated and lonely seniors during the covid-19 pandemic. this strategy is easily implemented, and will likely continue with positive impact in post-covid times.

title: clicsalud
description: clicsalud is a mobile app to that responds to challenges in the availability and usefulness of information regarding public health services by integrating crowdsourced details about prices of medicines and information about the healthcare system in a single platform.

title: smart patrol app
description: smart patrol is an app developed within the framework of "ven911", the recent citizen security strategy of the venezuelan government. the tool for citizen participation has aims to strengthen the crime monitoring activities of police units in the country.

title: balcony protests during covid-19
description: during the covid-19 pandemic, people have been unable to congregate in large groups to protest against government actions (or inaction). confined to their residences, people began to protest from their windows and balconies.

title: people not polluters digital rally (against covid-19 bailout for canada's big oil)
description: a virtual rally hosted by sustainabiliteens, our earth our future, leadnow, dogwood and stand.earth, calling on canadians to oppose a bailout for big oil billionaires. protesters say canada must support workers and communities impacted by covid-19, not prop up a sunset industry.

title: citizen contribution platform of the judiciary in costa rica
description: the judicial power in costa rica opened a direct communication channel for citizens to share their visions and useful contributions, from a constructive and collaborative perspective.

title: rising majority teach-in with naomi klein & angela y. davis
description: rising majority is hosting a discussion on movement building in the time of the coronavirus (covid-19) crisis.

title: mit covid19 'beat the pandemic' challenge
description: a 48-hour virtual hackathon with the goal to develop solutions that address the most pressing technical, social, and financial issues caused by the covid-19 outbreak.

title: bringing communities together through film: community cinema responses to covid-19
description: community cinemas across the uk play a valuable role in bringing communities together to engage with film, build relationships, combat loneliness, to educate. in times of physical distancing they, and their representative body cinema for all have found new ways to continue this.

title: protests on the increased cost of living in mozambique
description: facing rampant inflation, citizens of mozambique took to the streets to protest rising food and fuel prices as well as the perceived failings of their government to enact measures to address these issues.

title: anti-government social distancing protests in israel
description: during the covid-19 lockdowns, israeli protesters still took to the streets to demonstrate against benjamin netanyahu who is accused of attempting to hang onto power at any cost, and using the pandemic to further cement authority and surveillance measures.

title: covid-19 survey tracker working group
description: launched in march 2020, this is a national project tracking the social dimensions of covid-19 in canada. this project involves national surveys and interviews and will run until march 2022 to monitor long-term impacts.

title: developing community participation for clean water in rural south africa
description: participatory action research was used to elicit local knowledge on drinking water in rural south africa. it involved engaging people to identify the problem and systemize local perspectives into shared forms of knowledge to develop collective action to address issues identified.

title: gpace youth participation and democratic education in community development committees
description: a youth-led project which allowed youth to become more democratically involved in the community development committees. the project changed the way community development committee decisions are made by including youth representatives in the process.

title: global partnership against child exploitation (gpace) "girls' voices" debate
description: recognizing the importance of lawmakers interacting with girls to understand the unique difficulties and challenges that they face, gpace engaged girls in an informative debate, enabling them to use their voices.

title: voters without borders - european citizens' initiative on full political rights for eu citizens
description: european citizens' initiative that aims at strengthening the existing rights of voting in european and local elections as well as giving every european citizen the choice on whether to vote in the country of residence or in the country of origins for all elections.

title: cdc's public engagement initiative to better inform governmental public health policy decisions (2005-09)
description: a public engagement initiative begun in 2001 to find ways the united states centers for disease control and prevention (cdc) could work with the public to better inform decision making in the short term, and to improve trust over the longer term. nine projects took place between 2005 and 2009.

title: covid 19, citizen's pulse (a national survey on covid 19-nepal)
description: a recent covid 19 survey (telephone) in nepal shows that citizens are aware from covid, know the symptoms but 2/3 of people are living in fear because of the open border & will not get proper treatment if they contract the virus. the major source of information are radio & tv.

title: covid-19: rethinking emergency preparedness and response in cameroon
description: the practice of governance in cameroon during the covid-19 pandemic has exposed lapses in public transparency, accountability, and participation. nevertheless, various adaptation strategies and innovative practices are emerging from both the government and the general public.

title: emerging responses to children's rights during covid 19 in mombasa, kenya
description: in kenya, covid-19 has had a negative impact on child protection and participation in governance. new strategies must be used to provide children with a voice and child governance back on the decision making table.

title: extraordinary online session of the citizens’ convention on climate: finding a way out of the covid-19 crisis
description: the citizens’ convention on climate held an extraordinary online session to discuss the economic and social consequences of the covid-19 crisis within the framework of their mandate, linking the convention's agenda to recommendations on how the government should start thinking about reopening the economy.

title: advocating for women's inclusion in ghana's covid-19 response
description: the ghanaian government’s covid-19 response has had an adverse impact on the poor, especially women and vulnerable groups. netright, a national women’s rights network and its members are working to ensure women’s voices and interests are taken into account.

title: the public engagement project on vaccine prioritization for pandemic influenza
description: an interagency workgroup sponsored by the department of health and human services and the department of homeland security was established in 2006 to revisit initial recommendations made in november 2005 and set forth new national guidance on vaccine use in the case of a pandemic.

title: addressing the impact of covid-19 on landless farmers and smallholders in nepal
description: the covid-19 pandemic has had a major impact on smallholder peasants and farmers in nepal. in this context, the community self reliance centre has been facilitating the micro-macro linkages for the support of smallholder peasants.

title: rights awareness in nigeria through virtual and media engagement during covid-19
description: measures related to the covid-19 pandemic have impacted partners west africa nigeria's (pwan) advocacy visits and awareness campaigns related to human rights and sexual and gender-based violence. lockdown measures have meant exclusive reliance on remote and media engagement.

title: open justice dialogues with the indigenous community in sibundoy, nariño, colombia
description: an open government partnership impact story.

title: community engagement for covid 19 – ethiopia
description: love in action ethiopia (liae) is responding to the covid-19 pandemic by engaging community structures and systems in regions of the country where predominantly underserved and marginalized communities were already facing economic hardships and poor service delivery prior to the spread of the coronavirus.

title: connecting to congress online town halls on the covid-19 emergency
description: connecting to congress organizes single-issue, non-partisan, online town halls. in response to the covid-19 crisis, it uses deliberative town halls to share information between members and their constituents and help identify concerns and issues in the member's district.

title: women's march on washington
virtual design jam 1.0 - vancouver design nerds
description: using the collaborative whiteboard platform mural, the vancouver design nerds host their first ever public virtual design jam to explore this question: how might we take positive, creative steps to stay healthy during the covid-19 pandemic?

title: community perspectives on hiv, violence and health surveillance in rural south africa
description: a range of social and health issues relating to two leading causes of death (hiv/aids and violent assault), identified via community-based participatory methods, led to recommendations to strengthen health systems' confidentiality, sensitivity and ancillary care obligations.

title: deliberative consultation on trade-offs related to using 'covidsafe' contact tracing technology
description: this project explores the trade-offs in using contact tracing technology to manage the risk of community transmission of sars-cov-2. participants make recommendations on how contact tracing technology should and shouldn't be used as a precondition for re-opening organisations and businesses.

title: building cooperative learning to address alcohol and drug abuse
description: alcohol and other drug (aod) abuse is a major public health challenge. participatory action research was initiated to identify how communities can be involved in finding solutions to these issues in three south african rural villages.

title: developing a learning platform to address under-five mortality in rural south africa
description: a learning platform to address under-five mortality was developed by connecting evidence on rural health priorities with the means for action.

title: participatory action research in agincourt socio-demographic surveillance site
description: a participatory action research process was initiated with communities in a low income rural setting. three village-based groups were convened and consulted on health related challenges. a range of structural and social root causes were identified, along with priority actions.

title: introducing visual participatory methods to develop local knowledge on hiv in rural south africa
description: participatory action research (par) was undertaken to gain insights into the perspectives of rural south african communities on hiv-related mortality.

title: we, the internet: internet governance, with and for citizens
description: since 2018, we, the internet  dialogues have brought together thousands of people around the world to discuss the future of the internet and to help decision-makers at all levels  make smart and legitimate choices.

title: public input into pandemic planning: deliberating tradeoffs in covid-19 policymaking
description: this multi-pronged project seeks to provide rapid public input for policymaking. it proposes a repeatable online deliberative process that addresses pressing policy questions and trade-offs related to the covid-19 public health emergency in british columbia.

title: the show must be paused / blackout tuesday
description: blackout tuesday was a social media initiative to post black squares in solidarity or support of the black community against police brutality and systemic racism. it has been criticized on several grounds.

title: black lives matter mural on the road to the white house in washington, dc
description: dc mayor muriel bowser commissioned the painting of a giant mural and renamed a section of 16th street "black lives matter plaza" to support the rights of citizens to, in her words, "peacefully assemble..., bring grievances to your government, and... demand change." [1]

title: george floyd protests
description: following the death of george floyd in police custody in minneapolis, protests erupted around the us and the world calling for an end to police violence against black communities and systemic racism.

title: virtual townhall on anti-racism in bc
description: this virtual townhall will focus on ways people, organizations, and communities can fight racism and make sure bc is a safe and welcoming place for everyone, with a special focus on ways to take action and address systemic racism.

title: community wealth generation and a local cooperative economy (preston, uk)
description: after the financial crisis of 2007/8, the city of preston in lancashire, uk, lost half a huge amount in funding and investments. in response, the city responded by creating a community wealth project to support a local cooperative economy.

title: banco palmas: solidarity finance in conjunto palmeiras
description: banco palmas is one of the early examples of solidarity finance. emerging from a peri-urban slum in brazil, this initiative is based on three key pillars: small, community-sanctioned loans, a local currency and professional training.

title: bpdc: costa rica's worker owned bank
description: banco popular (banco popular y de desarrollo comunal, bpdc) is a cooperative bank that is owned and managed by the workers of costa rica. its diverse clients include workers, farmers, enterprises, and a variety of development associations.

title: europe wide views on sustainable consumption
description: in october 2014, over 1000 european citizens in 11 countries (austria, bulgaria, spain, czech republic, denmark, hungary, ireland, lithuania, the netherlands, portugal, and belgium) participated in discussions and voted on various issues relating to sustainable consumption.

title: eu citizens' dialogue in the hague
description: on may 17, 2019, 120 european citizens from france, ireland, belgium, the netherlands, and germany convened at the eu citizens' dialogue in the hague. using table moderators and simultaneous interpreters, they discussed the topics of social europe, global europe and digital europe.

title: sunbury's water future community panel
description: across 5 sessions from may to june 2019, the 30-35 members of the sunbury's water future community panel deliberated topics and solutions surrounding future water management. these included recycled water and stormwater, catchments and waterways, climate change, and urban growth.

title: scottish crowdsourcing exercise "coronavirus (covid-19): framework for decision making"
description: the scottish government launched a digital platform as part of a public engagement exercise in which it sought public input on the approaches and principles that would guide decision-making related to transitioning out of the coronavirus (covid-19) lockdown arrangements.

title: south australia's youth action plan
description: as part of considering and improving the effectiveness of services available to youth, south australia’s department of human services initiated a youth panel to better understand what issues matter to young south australians and how best to meet those needs.

title: citizens’ jury on community engagement and deliberative democracy
description: on may 27-31, 2005, the citizens’ jury on community engagement and deliberative democracy was held in perth, western australia. the jury evaluated a number of democratic methods, discussed how they might be used, and deliberated citizen engagement in water management.

title: climate assembly uk and the covid-19 crisis
description: the climate assembly uk was convened by six select committees of the house of commons to discuss how the uk should reach its net-zero greenhouse gas emissions target. following the covid-19 crisis, it conducted a discussion of the impacts of the pandemic on climate action.

title: south australia housing and homelessness strategy
description: the sa housing and homelessness strategy took place from june 30 to august 31, 2019. democracyco was convened to conduct 2 'lived experience' deliberations to inform the government on how to make housing more available, suitable, and affordable for all south australians.

title: nuclear fuel cycle citizens' jury
description: the nuclear fuel cycle citizens' jury, also known as citizens' jury two, was a follow-up of citizens' jury one. it convened across 3 weekends from october–november 2016 to determine whether south australia should continue to pursue opportunities related to the nuclear fuel cycle.

title: calgary arts development citizens' reference panel
description: the citizens’ reference panel on calgary’s arts plan consisted of 36 citizens of calgary that met across 4 saturdays from september to october 2012. its purpose was to determine the future of art, art funding, and the city's involvement in artistic communities.

title: duncan-north cowichan citizens' assembly
description: across six days from january to april 2017, the 36 members of the citizens’ assembly on municipal amalgamation formed recommendations on the topic of amalgamating the city of duncan and the municipality of north cowichan.

title: central blackpool health and wellbeing inquiry
description: across 9 sessions from january to may 2017, the 23 members of the central blackpool health and wellbeing inquiry deliberated the following: "for people living in central blackpool what are the main things that affect people’s health and wellbeing and what can be done about them?"

title: blackpool far north health and wellbeing inquiry
description: across 9 sessions from october to december 2017, the 18 members of the blackpool far north health and wellbeing inquiry deliberated: ‘for people living in blackpool far north what are the main things that affect people’s health and well-being and what can be done about them?’

title: blackpool central east (layton) health and wellbeing inquiry
description: across 9 sessions from february to april 2018, the 23 members of the blackpool central east health and wellbeing inquiry deliberated: "for people living in blackpool central east what are the main things that affect people’s health and well-being and what can be done about them?"

title: blackpool south health and wellbeing inquiry
description: across 9 sessions from october to december 2017, the 18 members of the blackpool south health and wellbeing inquiry deliberated the question: "for people living in blackpool south, what are the main things that affect people’s health and wellbeing and what can be done about them?"

title: uk citizens' jury on air quality
description: across three hearings from december 2005 to january 2006, the 22 members of the citizens' jury on air quality—which was established by defra—investigated public views on air quality.

title: citizens' forum on scottish rural priorities
description: as part of a study of scottish public attitudes to the environment, two citizens' forums consisting of 49 people were convened in scotland—one in motherwell, and the other in montrose—to "identify key principles that should underpin the agricultural sector in scotland."

title: communities creating racial equity evaluative follow up
description: an evaluative follow up to support communities towards creating racial equity using the dialogue to change approach.

title: participatory intervention on birth outcomes with women's groups in nepal
description: from 2001 to 2003, a team of researchers did a study to see whether participatory workshops would improve birth outcomes in a poor rural area of nepal.

title: netherley valley citizens' jury on reducing anti-social behaviour
description: netherley valley citizens' jury consisted of 18 people who, across four days in april 2004, developed recommendations for how anti-social behaviour (asb) should be dealt with within their community.

title: deliberative workshops on the collaborative economy in scotland
description: the deliberative workshops on the collaborative economy operated from august to october 2017. they were two public engagement workshops, held in edinburgh and glasgow, in which 52 people explored their opinions and conceptions of the collaborative economy.

title: the second gdańsk citizens' panel
description: across 4 sessions from march to april 2017, the 56 members of the second gdańsk citizens' panel on air quality convened to discuss methods of reducing air pollution.

title: the third gdańsk citizens' panel
description: in 2018, the 56 members of the third gdansk citizens' panel convened across four sessions to deliberate ways to improve civic engagement, as well as support equal treatment of men, women, and lgbtq+ persons.

title: the first gdańsk citizens' panel
description: across three meetings from november to december 2016, the 63 members of the first gdańsk citizens' panel deliberated how the municipality should respond in the event of heavy rain in the context of climate change.

title: uk consensus conference on radioactive waste management
description: in may 1999, the 15 members of the consensus conference on radioactive waste management met to deliberate "long term management of nuclear waste in the uk, both civil and military, concentrating particularly on intermediate and high level waste."

title: lublin city citizens' panel on air quality
description: on december 8th, 2018, the 60 members of the lublin city citizens' panel met to deliberate things that could be done to improve air quality in lublin.

title: public meetings on the enerver project in vercelli
description: the enerver project located in the industrial area of vercelli, involves the construction of a management system for the organic waste fraction for the production of compost and biomethane. the proponent, polioli bioenergy, has decided to invest in a participatory path.

title: pekka: women-headed household empowerment  - economic advancement in indonesia
description: grass-roots member-owned cooperatives for female heads of households in rural indonesia (pekka) empower the female members through economic activities. through their work, members increase their voice and agency, while improving their access to – and control over – resources.

title: illuminating citizens project in ivrea
description: with the unesco recognition of ivrea, an industrial city, some cultural actors wondered if their sector and the public were ready to recognize such an acknowledgment, seizing the opportunities in a creative and participatory way.

title: morioka citizen deliberation meeting for future public facilities
description: in 2014, the 36 members of the morioka citizen deliberation meeting for future public facilities met to deliberate residents' opinions and raise public awareness on public faculties restructuring in response to depopulation.

title: fy 2012: discussion on revising the mitaka city disaster prevention plan
description: in 2012, 43 citizens met to have a discussion about revising the mitaka city disaster prevention plan.

title: fy 2011: discussion of the fourth mitaka city basic plan
description: in 2011, 98 randomly selected japanese citizens met to discuss the fourth mitaka city basic plan. the planning cell was funded by the budget of mitaka city.

title: fy 2015: discussion about the first revision of the fourth mitaka city basic plan
description: in 2015, 81 japanese citizens met to discuss the first revision of the fourth mitaka city basic plan. the project was funded by the budget of mitaka city.

title: deliberative poll on federalism reform in japan
description: on december 9, 2009, the 150 participants of the deliberative poll on federalism reform met for one day to discuss federalism reform. the project was jointly implemented by the kanagawa institute for local autonomy and the tokyo institute of technology.

title: norwegian consensus conference on genetically modified foods
description: 16 norwegian citizens convened at the consensus conference on genetically modified foods in an effort to include non-experts in order to obtain the views of ordinary people on the genetic modification of food.

title: deliberative poll on healthcare and financial ethics in italy
description: on december 3, 2006, the 119 italian participants in the deliberative poll on healthcare and financial ethics discussed health care and financial investment ethics. the project was implemented by ispo and reset.

title: mitaka's 2006 town development discussion on safety
description: in 2006, the 52 participants of the mitaka town development discussion convened to deliberate the development of safety and security in local community and support for children in the city.

title: hobsons bay 2030
description: in 2017, 35 participants took part in hobsons bay 2030—a citizens' jury conducted by hobsons bay city council to deliberate upon the first long-term vision for hobsons bay.

title: citizen deliberation meeting on the utilization of the tama river riverbed
description: in 2009, the 47 members of the citizen deliberation meeting on the utilization of the tama river riverbed convened to discuss restrictions on recreational activities and ways to ameliorate garbage problems in the tama river riverbed.

title: the second revision of the fourth mitaka city basic plan
description: in 2019, 82 residents of mitaka city took part in the town development discussion about the second revision of the fourth mitaka city basic plan. the project was funded by the budget of mitaka city.

title: citizen deliberation meeting on the second municipal implementation plan, shinjuku city
description: in 2011, 55 participants took part in the citizen deliberation meeting on the second municipal implementation plan for shinjuku city. they discussed their priorities among the 19 projects proposed by the municipal office for its implementation plan and public resource investment.

title: citizen deliberation meetings on public transportation in sagamihara city
description: on november 4th and 10th, 2013, 38 citizens took part in the citizen deliberation meetings on public transportation in sagamihara city. the city's road policy division asked them about an alternative public transport system in place of existing public bus systems in minami ward.

title: fy 2018: discussion on the design for a new mitaka city government building
description: in february 2018, 62 citizens of mitaka city took part in the fy 2018: discussion on the basic design for a new city government building (including its chamber hall). the project was funded by the budget of mitaka city.

title: fy 2007: discussion on the second revision of the third mitaka city basic plan
description: in 2007, 49 people took part in the fy 2007: discussion on the second revision of the third mitaka city basic plan. the discussion focused on resilience in disasters and programs for supporting elderly persons.

title: champlain lhin citizens' advisory panel on clinical hospital services distribution plan
description: across three sessions from february to march 2010, the 24 members of the champlain lhin citizens' advisory panel on clinical hospital services distribution plan met to recommend possible models for distributing services among the eastern counties' hospitals.

title: sidewalk toronto residents reference panel
description: across six sessions from april 2018 to january 2019, the 36 members of the sidewalk toronto residents reference panel convened to inform and help shape sidewalk toronto’s master innovation and development plan.

title: 2019 participatory budgeting in desio, italy
description: the municipality of desio developed the participatory budget practice in two editions (2017/18 and 2018/19) after having already undertaken it with satisfaction in 2015. in the last editions, new tools have been introduced for greater interactivity.

title: buen vivir fund: linking participation and economic advancement
description: the buen vivir fund is a participatory impact investment fund operating internationally. the fund promotes a financial model that broadens the definitions of return to include community wellbeing, while avoiding the traditional focus on maximizing capital accumulation.

title: metrolinx regional reference panel
description: from october 2018 to may 2020, the 36 members of the regional reference panel met 11 times to learn about the region while advising metrolinx on major transportation projects and policies.

title: metrolinx residents' reference panel on the regional transportation plan
description: across 5 meetings from march to may 2017, the 36 members of the the residents’ reference panel on the next regional transportation plan met to provide recommendations in terms of fare integration, communications, and more seamless service (among other topics).

title: groupe consultatif de citoyens de l'artm sur la mobilité
description: in 2019, the reference panel brought together 32 randomly selected residents from the greater metropolitan area of montreal to make recommendations on the development of the region's first regional transportation plan.

title: st. joseph's health centre community reference panel
description: in 2015, the 36 members of the st. joseph's health centre community reference panel convened to create a series of recommendations and priorities to help inform the health center's strategic plan for 2020.

title: hamilton citizens' reference panel on cultural policy and planning
description: across three sessions from december 2010 to january 2011, the 30 members of the hamilton citizens' reference panel on cultural policy and planning convened to inform hamilton's new cultural plan. in the end, the panel formed and ratified 70+ recommendations.

title: toronto pearson residents' reference panel on airport growth and noise fairness
description: across 4 sessions from may to september 2017, the 36 members of the toronto pearson residents' reference panel on airport growth and noise fairness met to create recommendations about how the greater toronto airports authority could grow sustainably and responsibly.

title: ghana civil society platform on the imf programme
description: the ghana civil society platform is formed from local civil society organizations working on social accountability, anti-corruption and governance 2014 to influence the design, implementation and monitoring of the international monetary fund's extended credit arrangement.

title: participation in economic advancement: the experience of the brazilian network of community banks (bncb)
description: community development banks in brazil are grass-root initiatives developed and managed by the community, working for the community, based on solidarity economy principles through which people in poor communities improve their local economies.

title: the netherlands’ electoral system civic forum (burgerforum)
description: in 2006, the 143 members of the netherlands’ electoral system civic forum (burgerforum kiesstelsel) met to investigate various electoral systems for choosing members of the parliament, and eventually to decide which system would be most appropriate for the netherlands.

title: g1000enschede
description: from june 10th, 2017 to november 11, 2017, the 320 members of the g1000enschede met to discuss how the citizens of enschede preferred to deal with fireworks in the future.

title: g1000borne
description: on may 24, 2017, the 140 members of the g1000borne met to discuss various issues relevant to borne. these included communication, traffic safety, landscaping, life quality, enforcement, sustainability, and involvement, among others.

title: g1000coevorden
description: on october 29, 2016, 139 citizens of coevorden convened at the g1000coevorden to discuss topics such as quality of life and sustainability. they sought to answer the question, "what do you think is important to coevorden? what should be done?"

title: g1000steenwijkerland
description: on november 18th, 2017, the 254 members of the g1000steenwijkerland met to discuss how the municipality of steenwijkerland could become energy neutral.

title: g1000nijmegen
description: on march 5th, 2016, the 639 members of the g1000nijmegen convened to discuss things that could be improved in the city, as well as the actions and projects needed to accomplish those goals.

title: g1000schiedam, 2017
description: the second g1000schiedam (schiedam citizen summit) took place on march 11, 2017. its 197 members convened to determine their future vision of the city.

title: transformto reference panel on climate action
description: across three sessions from july 27th to august 18th, 2019, the 30 members of the transformto reference panel on climate action worked together to recommend climate actions and priorities for toronto to undertake from 2021 to 2023 to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

title: friese dorpentop
description: on november 5th, 2016, the 499 participants in the friese dorpentop convened to deliberate about what towns in the province consider important for the future of the frisian countryside.

title: g1000schiedam, 2016
description: in 2016, the 450 participants in the g1000schiedam (1st schiedam citizen summit) convened to determine a future vision of the city.

title: the women of liberia mass action for peace protests in liberia
description: women in liberia from all walks of life staged a non-violent sit-in protest at the executive mansion at the seat of the presidency leading to the end of a 14-year brutal civil war and the subsequent resignation of politician and guerrilla leader charles taylor in the country.

title: empowering smallholder farmers in markets (esfim)
description: the empowering smallholder farmers in markets (esfim) program was a collaborative research project to support national farmers' organizations  to use evidence in their advocacy processes. the program utilized participatory research methodologies.

title: participatory planning in città alta, bergamo
description: the municipality of bergamo, with the help of the cst, launched a triple-helix participatory process to submit a revised detailed neighbourhood plan to città alta residents, aiming to respond to their needs and enhance the area.

title: lacittàintorno: participatory urban regeneration in milan
description: a multi-year participatory intervention program in milan involved the area's inhabitants in the process of urban regeneration, which aimed to enhance multi-disciplinarity and average times and express a policy on the suburbs, with the ambition to replicate it across the country.

title: group-based citizenship and malaria control program, mozambique
description: community participation, and especially local elite involvement, shaped the rollout of indoor residual spraying (irs) in mozambique. local elites promote group-based citizenship, which although undemocratic, is critical to the effective adoption of irs.

title: participatory processes and selecting leaders: changes to traditional institutions in liberia
description: the participatory selection of chiefs in post-civil war liberia (rather than top down appointment or ascendance through hereditary rule) enhanced community consultation and participation, but also limited individual contributions to the public good.

title: strengthening accountability of local chiefs, zimbabwe
description: a world bank study was run to understand how to enhance accountability of local chiefs; an examination of this suggests that traditional authorities govern more responsively when structures and spaces of co-governance emerge that empower local civil society leaders.

title: citizens' workshop on amiens urban travel plan
description: a citizen's workshop on urban mobility in amiens brought together 19 residents drawn by lot. during three two-day sessions, participants worked on producing a shared diagnosis and formulating recommendations for public actors.

title: citizen panel of the center-val de loire cop
description: the citizen panel is an approach aimed at developing a citizen's point of view on the transition to action in center-val de loire in relation to environmental issues related to the regional cop. the objective of this process is to draft a collective opinion on the cop agreement.

title: pays de la loire, 2040
description: the pays de la loire region has set up this participatory mechanism to think about the development of the region by 2040. three key themes for the future of the region were discussed at three citizen panels: the aging of the population, energy and the relationship to work.

title: terna meets: public dialogue on updating the electricity grid in isarco valley, italy
description: the terna company owns the italian national electricity grid and for the renewal of its infrastructures, it undertook paths of dialogue and public participation with local communities. the renewal of the network in the isarco valley is an exemplary case.

title: citizens' workshops on grenoble's urban travel plan
description: from 2010 to 2012, missions publiques supported the agglomeration of grenoble and its syndicat mixte des transports en commun (smtc) in developing its urban travel plan by organizing participatory citizen workshops.

title: citizens' day: building public policy in bourgogne franche-comté
description: this participatory process aims to integrate citizens' concerns into the strategic development of the bourgogne-franche-comté region.

title: forum vies mobiles - prototyping a parliament of lifestyles
description: the mobile lives forum (forum vies mobiles) is interested in how physical movement allows everyone to organize their life, in all its dimensions. missions publiques organized citizen workshops and an experimental process of surveying a "parliament of lifestyles."

title: rhône-alpes workshop on climate, air, and energy
description: in 2011, the region rhône-alpes convened 35 randomly drawn residents to discuss issues related to regional policies to fight against global warming. this regional participatory process aims to contribute to the development of the regional climate, air, and energy scheme.

title: participatory waste prevention and management for the center-val-de-loire region
description: this participatory process aims to develop recommendations related to waste management and the circular economy in the center-val-de-loire region.

title: citizens' consultations on breast cancer screening in france
description: this participatory process offers a citizens' contribution to the reflection on how to improve breast cancer screening.

title: 2019 byron shire council: the byron model
description: as part of byron shire council's 2019 byron model of democracy, an 18-person citizens' panel met at 6 sessions across 3 months to provide recommendations on how to make democratic decisions in byron shire that can be widely supported.

title: tchc tenant communications strategy and tenants' reference panel
description: from july 2011 to august 2011, the 28 members of the toronto community housing (tchc) tenant communications strategy and tenants' reference panel convened to ask residents how the tchc could improve the way it communicates with tenants.

title: g1000amersfoort, 2016
description: on april 9, 2016, the 480 participants in the g1000 amersfoort convened to deliberate the question, "what do we think is important for the future of amersfoort?"

title: traditional authorities and fast track land reform in zimbabwe
description: the fast track land reform program (ftlrp) in zimbabwe, which seized and redistributed land from white farm and estate owners, is highly contested and debated. the program has brought about marked change to the relationship between traditional authorities and the state.

title: g1000gemert-bakel
description: on june 4th, 2016, the 232 members of the g1000gemert-bakel convened to answer the question, "what do we think is important for the future of gemert-bakel?"

title: g1000eindhoven
description: on june 25th, 2016, the 389 members of the g1000eindhoven met to discuss the question: "what do we think is important for the future of eindhoven?" they touched on themes such as income, safety, sustainability, communication, and more.

title: citizens' panel on child-friendly vorarlberg
description: in 2005, the 75 members of the citizens' panel on child-friendly vorarlberg convened to produce recommendations for state policy in the areas of parenting skills, family networks, compatibility of family and work, and child care.

title: triestingtaler citizens' council
description: in 2014, the 21 members of the triestingtaler citizens' council convened to gather ideas, needs, and suggestions for the period of 2014–2020 and develop a shared vision of the region in terms of global sustainable development.

title: mödling citizens' council
description: in 2011, the 13 members of the mödling citizens' council met to deliberate on their 10-year vision for mödling.

title: citizens' council on the regional agenda in the leader region national park
description: the 30 members of the citizens' council on the start of the regional agenda in the leader region national park met in 2015 to work together to come up with solutions and suggestions for improvement on municipal issues related to the national park.

title: sulzberger citizens' council
description: in 2010, the 12 members of the sulzberger citizen council convened to discuss the quality of life of young people in sulzberg, vorarlberg.

title: polcevera park urban planning and regeneration project
description: after the collapse of the morandi bridge in genoa, in addition to the reconstruction of the viaduct and the reclamation of the disaster area, below, a competition was announced for projects of regeneration and sustainable development of the urban area surrounding the viaduct.

title: participatory process of defining the referendum without quorum in cattolica, italy
description: the municipality of cattolica, the so-called queen of the adriatic, contemplated introducing the referendum without quorum and to define the regulation, it initiated a participatory process financed by the emilia-romagna region; however, the process was ultimately abandoned.

title: hermagor region citizens' council
description: in 2013, the 11 members of the hermagor region citizens' council met in carinthia, austria, to develop visions, goals and feasible projects for the hermagor region in preparation for the upcoming 2014-2020 eu structural period.

title: neutorgasse citizens' panel
description: from november 2002 to march 2003, the 65 members of the neutorgasse citizens' panel convened to discuss the future development plans of neutorgasse. specific topics included traffic and mobility, village and urban development, housing, and improving living environments.

title: renewable energy for refugees (re4r)
description: the re4r project helps refugees and their communities to access finance, training, technology, and expertise to develop their own renewable energy sources.

title: malawi tea 2020
description: malawi tea 2020 is a collaborative initiative to improve the tea industry in malawi at every stage of the supply chain. its aims include improve working standards for women and increasing the low wages of tea laborers.

title: citizen helpdesks in liberia
description: in liberia, the citizen helpdesks work to address accountability challenges related to large gold mining concessions. their associates are trained in participatory techniques and they work with affected communities to establish agreements with mining companies.

title: "tutti nella stessa barga": civic discussion on kme italy's gasification plant project
description: in the serchio valley, near the lucca paper district, a citizens' committee, in collaboration with the municipality, promoted a process of public discussion in order to provide decision makers with thoughtful opinions on the proposed construction of a gasifier that uses paper mill waste.

title: gambling debate in russellville, arkansas
description: the facebook group, pope county majority, informed county citizens about developments concerning a potential casino in russellville, arkansas, u.s. the group encourages citizen participation at pope county quorum court meetings to discuss their comments and concerns.

title: the united states prison hunger strike of 2016
description: in 2016, prisoners across the united states decided to come together and protest their conditions through a coordinated hunger strike.

title: san lorenzo laboratory: participatory urban planning of the district
description: the san lorenzo workshop project aimed to open spaces for dialogue and discussion around identity and urban regeneration of the san lorenzo-mercato centrale district, an important historic center of florence.

title: civil society and indigenous peoples' mechanism for relations with the un committee on world food security
description: the civil society mechanism (csm), an autonomous unit of the committee on world food security (cfs), is the largest space for civil society organisations working on food security and nutrition.

title: altmünster citizens' council
description: in 2012, the 16 members of the altmünster citizens' council met to discuss future cooperation between the administration and the citizens of altmünster.

title: citizens' council: being a woman in vienna
description: in september 2014, the 15 members of the citizens' council on being a woman in vienna met to answer the question, "how can we work even better towards equality between women and men in vienna?"

title: dialogue with visitors of finnish national parks on interactive maps
description: retkikompassi engages hikers to help develop and preserve the nature in finnish national parks using a ppgis (public participation geographic information system) approach.

title: "santu vitu mia reloaded" (san vito, italy)
description: the municipality of san vito dei normanni started a participatory process to identify a management model for its important abandoned or under-used real estate assets, and ultimately develop a proposal for the municipal regulation of common goods.

title: appea in bitonto, italy: participation and management
description: a participatory process aimed to establish the managing entity of the area paesaggisticamente ed ecologicamente attrezzata (appea) (transl. landscape and ecologically equipped area) of the municipality of bitonto. the strategic objective was to convert to an appea according to current regional guidelines (4.4.2).

title: wolfurt citizens' council
description: from september to november 2006, the 12 members of the wolfurt citizens' council convened to discuss possible ways of effective citizen engagement in policy and community matters.

title: tragwein citizens' council
description: from november 22nd to 23rd, 2013, the 32 members of the tragwein citizens' council convened to discuss future issues, challenges, and opportunities that would be important for tragwein.

title: citizens' council for dealing with land in vorarlberg
description: from september to october 2017, the 27 members of the citizens' council for dealing with land in vorarlberg convened to discuss what a careful and forward-looking use of land in vorarlberg might look like.

title: citizens' council on mobility in vorarlberg
description: from june 15th to 16th, 2018, the 28 members of the citizens' council on mobility in vorarlberg met to develop principles and priorities in the field of mobility and transport in vorarlberg for the next ten to fifteen years.

title: south korean citizens' jury on the national pandemic response system
description: from august to september 2008, the 14 members of the citizens' jury on the national pandemic response system met to provide opinions on south korea's existing national pandemic response system.

title: citizens' jury on the construction of gwangju metropolitan subway line no. 2
description: in 2018, the 250 members of the citizens' jury on the construction of gwangju metropolitan subway line no. 2 met to assist in deciding whether the city should construct a metro line. the jury was convened in response to an ongoing, 16-year disagreement.

title: catalyzing community change through deliberative dialogue
description: a research study that seeks to understand how action and change arise from deliberative dialogue and what support is needed to facilitate action and change.

title: nationwide public deliberation on pre-birth testing in new zealand
description: public deliberation in new zealand hosted by toi te taiao: the bioethics council on the cultural, ethical, spiritual issues of pre-birth testing using face-to-face & online methods based on the kettering foundation's framing and national issues forums' workshop methodologies

title: austrian consensus conference on genetic data
description: in spring of 2003, the 12 members of the consensus conference on genetic data met to discuss policy issues related to genetic data.

title: south korean citizens' jury on nuclear construction
description: from september 13, 2017 until october 15, 2017, a stratified random sample of 471 south korean citizens were educated on the merits and drawbacks of continuing construction on two nuclear reactors, shin-kori 5 and 6.

title: south korean citizens' budget participating group
description: in 2018, the 300 members of the citizens' budget participating group met to provide feedback on how 68 million dollars should be spent with regards to public enterprises.

title: iti sassari living lab
description: sassari living lab is an online and face-to-face participatory platform for solving city problems, where to promote concrete responses to the needs of society by stimulating, informing and involving citizens, who thus become an active part of the entire process

title: roma decide - rome capital's 2019 participatory budget
description: with the 2019 participatory budget of roma capitale, citizens and the administration decide together, for the first time, how to invest 20 million euros throughout the territory for the protection of urban decor. overall, 46,200 people participated.

title: workshop of ideas - belonging and participation. municipality of carapelle
description: the municipality intends to improve urban and social development, starting from the recovery and reuse of public assets, taking into consideration the real needs of citizens, making them protagonists through participatory processes.

title: towards the new pug: leverano designs its own future
description: the participatory comparison for the new apulian urban plans is essential: to identify the invariants, considering the perception of the territory by the populations who reside there, as required by the european landscape convention and the pptr, and to collect proposals that take into account the dynamics of development and aspirations of the entire community.

title: vertical ideas - casciana terme lari
