description: ideas in vertical is a participatory path, promoted by the municipality of casciana terme lari (pisa), with urban regeneration objectives. the path aims to involve the community and local actors to identify the new functional destination of the “skyscraper”, a disused property located in perignano and a symbol of the crisis in the local furniture sector.

title: el observatorio de la ciudad (the city observatory)
description: the 'observatorio de la ciudad' is the world's first example of a permanent deliberative body—implemented in madrid's city council. however, it is also the first one to close down (only a few months after opening)—a fact which reveals the challenges of institutionalisation.

title: protests and participatory journalism in mozambique
description: a series of protests against the rising cost of living in mozambique brought rise to a new form of collaborative journalism through a blog called diário de um sociólogo, or “diary of a sociologist”, which detailed the events as they occurred through real time eye witness reports.

title: taranto near future
description: taranto is the latest italian case of a clash between the industrialist ideology of unlimited growth, which characterized the era of the large factory, and the ideology of survival with its stubborn thinking about a future world, after death.

title: minnesota metro solid waste citizens' jury
description: from june 18th to 22nd, 2001, the 18 members of the metro solid waste citizens' jury met to provide recommendations on what should be done in the metro region regarding solid waste.

title: minnesotan policy jury on school-based clinics
description: in 1988, eight 12-person juries were held around the state of minnesota (one in each congressional district) to evaluate the usefulness of school-based clinics to help prevent teen pregnancy, aids and other stds. a statewide jury of 24 jurors made the final recommendations.

title: citizens' jury on minnesota property tax reform
description: in 1999, the 17 members of the citizens' jury on minnesota property tax reform met to examine the minnesota property tax system and several key reform proposals. its recommendations were used to launch a series of community-based discussions across the state on tax reform issues.

title: citizens' panel on organ transplants in minnesota
description: in 1986, the 24 members of the citizens' panel on organ transplants in minnesota met to review some of the bio-ethical dilemmas regarding organ transplants.

title: citizens' jury on comparing environmental risks
description: in 1996, the 20 members of the citizens' jury on comparing environmental risks convened. twelve environmental issues were presented and discussed, which jurists had to rank in terms of their seriousness vis-à-vis human health, ecological health, and quality of life.

title: citizens' jury on dakota county's comprehensive plan
description: in november 1997, the 24 members of the citizens' jury on dakota county's comprehensive plan met to identify priorities of its residents for the comprehensive land use plan as the county faced tough choices related to its projected growth and how to manage it.

title: chatfield public schools citizens' jury
description: in september 1999, the 18 members of the chatfield public schools citizens' jury convened to examine the facility needs of the chatfield school district and explore solutions to meet those needs.

title: women's empowerment within customary justice systems in namibia
description: namibia's traditions and customs were excluded from a western, colonial approach to citizenship. traditional authorities, the state and ngos mobilized within communities to empower women in customary justice systems (cjs).

title: neighborhood in sight - vignola
description: the municipality of vignola has established a permanent public participation program and wants to define and test the operating methods of some of its tools with the citizens themselves, starting from the neighborhoods.

title: pulsa - permanent laboratory for social agriculture in puglia
description: the promoters of the pulsa process have been waiting for the implementation of the law on social agriculture for a couple of years and thus try to accelerate their knowledge and effective application, involving the actors concerned in a permanent laboratory.

title: resilient day (la journée de la résilience)
description: the brussels environmental administration intends to launch a 'resilience day'. 150 randomly selected citizens will deliberate during 3 days on the question 'how to make brussels a more resilient city' in order to provide public authorities with policy recommendations.

title: make your brussels mobility citizens' panel
description: from october to november 2017, the 40 randomly selected members of the make your brussels mobility citizens' panel met to produce concrete recommendations on how to improve mobility in brussels.

title: climacteurs: 100 voix pour le climat
description: in 2015, bruxelles environnement invited 100 randomly selected youth from brussels to produce recommendations about climate change for the minister to share at the cop21.

title: deliberative poll on the press law in macao
description: on december 4th, 2011, 306 randomly selected macau citizens and media professionals met to partake in a deliberative poll on the "amendment of the press  law and the audio-visual broadcasting act” in macao.

title: european citizens panel on the future of europe
description: at the european citizens panel on the future of europe from may 4th to 6th, 2018, 96 europeans from 27 member states worked together to draft a 12-question online consultation regarding the future of europe.

title: transformative innovation on covid-19's impacts
description: transformative innovation (span. innovación transformadora) is an initiative of the friedrich ebert stiftung in bolivia that seeks to to connect collective innovation initiatives addressing the humanitarian, economic, and social crisis unleashed by the covid-19 pandemic.

title: #movid19 hackathon
description: #movid19 was a hackathon implemented in the city of bogota to develop creative mobility solutions with the aim of reducing the risk of covid-19 contagion. the initiative was implemented by local and international organizations.

title: battle against covid-19
description: “battle against covid-19” (batalla contra covid-19) is an initiative of the dominican political observatory (observatorio político dominicano) that has oversight functions to monitor and analyze government responses against covid-19 and its social implications.

title: "ellas": colombian app for addressing gender-based violence
description: “they” (span. ellas) is a digital initiative of the national women’s network ("red nacional de mujeres") that aims to provide information on gender-based violence in order to facilitate women's actions for the prevention, attention and protection of cases of gender violence.

title: #togetherforpanama
description: #togetherforpanama (span. #juntosporpanamá) is a digital platform that aims to collect citizen proposals and opinions on different topics related to the effects of covid-19 and the future impact management strategies to face them.

title: hack the crisis 2020: women + girls
description: hack the crisis 2020: women + girls (span. hackea la crisis 2020: mujeres + niñas) was a hackathon organized in ecuador with the aim of finding joint solutions to address the challenges faced by women and girls during the covid-19 pandemic.

title: electoral observatory of the international lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans and intersex association for latin america and the caribbean (ilgalac)
description: the electoral observatory of the international lesbian, gay, bisexual, trans and intersex association for latin america and the caribbean (ilgalac) is a citizen oversight mechanism that monitors electoral proposals that relate to relevant lgbti topics.

title: latin american map of femicides
description: the latin american map of femicides (span. mapa latinoamericano de feminicidios) is a digital monitoring tool to collect and provide statistical information on femicides in latin america.

title: the randomly selected neighbourhood council of the city of brussels
citizen summit on climate change: impacts, costs and adaptation in the baltic sea region
description: baltcica (climate change: impacts, costs, and adaptation in the baltic sea region” was a project that ran from february 2009 to january 2012. it aimed to develop and implement strategies to adapt to climate change within the baltic sea region [1].

title: europe on an equal footing: eu citizens' dialogue in passau
description: the 120 members of the eu citizens' dialogue in passau were german, czech and austrian citizens chosen at random. they met on december 6th, 2018, to form proposals and questions about three topics in two languages: border regions, refugee policy and social policy.

title: deliberative poll on transit and traffic issues in la plata, argentina
description: on october 31st, 2009, the 62 participants of the deliberative poll on transit and traffic issues in la plata, argentina met to discuss the transit and traffic issues facing the city's residents.

title: deliberative poll on “tomorrow’s city” in ulaanbaatar, mongolia
description: from december 12th to 13th, 2015, the 317 members of the deliberative poll on “tomorrow’s city” met to to deliberate about major infrastructure projects proposed in ulaanbaatar's master plan.

title: nationwide deliberative polling on constitutional amendment of mongolia, 2017
description: from april 28th to 30th, 2017, 669 members of the deliberative poll on constitutional amendments met to deliberate on six possible constitutional amendments.

title: deliberative poll on career reform for public servants in porto alegre, brazil
description: from june 6th to 7th, 2009, the 228 members of the deliberative poll on career reform for public servants convened to discuss the public service career reform.

title: danish consensus conference: a light-green agricultural sector
description: the 10 members of the consensus conference on a light-green agricultural sector met from november 23rd to november 25th, 1994, to discuss different possible models of integrated production in order to make agricultural production more sustainable in denmark.

title: danish consensus conference on noise
description: from may 12th to 15th, 2000, the 14 members of the consensus conference on noise convened to discuss the issue of noise in the city.

title: danish consensus conference: how can we assign value to the environment?
description: in 2002, the 14 members of the consensus conference met in denmark to answer the question, "how can we determine the price of environmental benefits and pollution so that these factors come to form part of an economic analysis in an acceptable way?"

title: danish citizens’ summit on the hospital of the future
description: on september 1st, 2007, the 300 members of the citizens’ summit on the hospital of the future met in the region of southern denmark to decide on how the emergency reception of citizens will be handled in the future.

title: danish consensus conference on brain research
description: in 2005, the 14 members of the danish consensus conference on brain research met to assess how increased knowledge on the human brain can be used.

title: citizens’ summit on the development of the north denmark region
description: on september 10th, 2011, the 200 members of the citizens’ summit on the development of the north denmark region met to answer the question, "what should the future north jutland look like?"

title: citizen workshop on future research areas in denmark
description: on february 4th, 2017, the 18 members of the citizen workshop on future research areas in denmark met to determine denmark's most important future research areas.

title: future council “bioökonomie nrw 2038?!”
description: the future council is a dialogue-oriented participation format in which randomly selected citizens together with experts spend 1.5 days intensively deliberating and working on a common vision of the future.

title: danish citizens' summit on regional development
description: on november 17th, 2007, the 167 members of the citizens' summit on regional development convened to hear citizens’ ideas and suggestions for the content of the capital region's first development plan. three themes stood out: environment, education and traffic.

title: danish citizens’ summits on health care services
description: on march 5th, 2011, the 5 regions of denmark each hosted a citizens’ summit on health care services to produce visions for the healthcare system. a total of 1000 participants took part in the initiatives.

title: danish consensus conference: testing our genes
description: from may 24th to 27th, 2002, 14 citizens took part in the consensus conference on testing our genes (borgerpanelets test af vores gener)—which was held at the danish parliament—to discuss the ethical, societal and economical consequences of genetic diagnostics and testing.

title: danish consensus conference on technological animals
description: from september 23rd to 25th, 1992, the 14 members of the consensus conference on technological animals met in copenhagen to assess the status of technological animal development by taking up questions related to ethical, health, economical and environmental areas.

title: danish consensus conference on gene therapy
description: from september 22nd to 25th, 1995, the 11 members of the consensus conference on gene therapy met to obtain layman's evaluations of the perspectives on gene therapy and whether the treatment should be allowed in denmark.

title: danish consensus conference on the consumption and environment of the future
description: in 1997, the 14 members of the consensus conference on the consumption and environment of the future met to assess the means that should be employed to make consumption more sustainable.

title: the region of zealand citizens' summit on climate
description: on october 30th, 2010, the 200 members of the region of zealand citizens' summit on climate met to discuss how the region could fulfill the international climate policy goals that denmark had decided to accede to.

title: danish consensus conference on teleworking
description: in 1997, the 13 members of the danish consensus conference on teleworking met to provide insights and recommendations on teleworking.

title: danish consensus conference on infertility
description: from october 29th to november 1st, 1993, the 13 members of the consensus conference on infertility met at the danish parliament to obtain citizen input on issues relating to infertility.

title: danish consensus conference on the future of fishing
description: from november 22nd to 25th, 1996, the 8 members of the consensus conference on the future of fishing met. fishermen and laymen formed recommendations to address a host of barriers and conflicts to an environmentally and economically sustainable fishing industry.

title: #lockdowndebate: rapid online deliberation on contact tracing
description: public policy on the covid-19 crisis requires public engagement. this project trialled an online deliberative process designed to produce rapid public input for decision-making processes in a context where the subject matter is ever-changing.

title: danish consensus conference on genetically modified foods
description: from march 12th to 15th, 1999, the 14 members of the consensus conference on genetically modified foods (borgerpanelets - konsensuskonference om genetisk modificeret mad) met to offer opinions on regulatory and ethical aspects of genetically modified foods.

title: danish citizens’ jury on genetically modified plants
description: from april 28th to may 2nd, 2005, the 16 members of the citizens’ jury on genetically modified plants (borgerjury: nye gm-planter – ny debat) met to produce recommendations on genetically modified plants.

title: consensus conference on chemical substances in food and the environment
description: from june 9th to 12th, 1995, the 14 members of the consensus conference on chemical substances in food and the environment met to create recommendations regarding technical advantages of chemical substances in food, as well as evaluate current regulations in the field.

title: danish conference on drinking water
description: on november 16th, 1996, the 180 members (which included 60 citizens, 60 experts and 60 politicians) of the conference on drinking water met to decide on five action plans for ensuring clean drinking water.

title: finding youth-led solutions to covid-19: lockdown live webinars
description: a series of events/webinars were carried out to address issues that have emerged across platforms as a result of the covid-19 pandemic. the intention was to help find coping mechanisms for the situation as well as find solutions to emerging problems.

title: camden council’s citizens’ assembly on the climate crisis
description: camden council’s citizens’ assembly on the climate crisis took place in july 2019. members discussed potential action on climate change that can be taken in the home, neighbourhood and council. the assembly produced 17 recommendations to inform the council's climate action plan.

title: blue lives matter
description: blue lives matter arose in response to the black lives matter movement. it advocates for police and other emergency service responders to be considered as a victim category for hate crimes.

title: hackathon we girls hack
description: the hackathon we girls hack is an initiative that seeks to promote women and people of non-binary gender to get involved in the development of digital solutions to foster gender equality and perspective.

title: corona in the suburbs: collaborative mapping in brazil
description: corona in the suburbs (pt. mapa corona nas periferias) is a collaborative mapping to visualize the initiatives that civil society is carrying out to fight coronavirus in marginalized areas.

title: covid-19 challenge
description: the "covid-19 challenge" (span. desafío covid-19) is an initiative implemented with the aim of seeking solutions to community and municipal problems related to the covid-19 pandemic in guatemala.

title: national youth consultation 2019
description: the “national youth consultation 2019” (span. consulta nacional de juventudes 2019) was a digital consultation implemented with the aim of knowing the opinions and proposals of the mexican youth to include them in the national youth program 2019-2024.

title: wangki indigenous women assembly
description: the wangki indigenous women assembly (span.  encuentro de mujeres indígenas del wangki) is an annual forum in which women from different indigenous communities from the wangki river region participate in discussing public issues among themselves and with other actors.

title: ballerup municipality citizens' hearing
description: on february 2nd, 2008, the 106 members of the ballerup municipality citizens' hearing met to discuss local democracy and citizen engagement.

title: citizen dialogue meetings in aarhus municipality
description: on february 25th, 2013, the 61 members of the citizen dialogue meetings in aarhus municipality met to deliberate upon how the municipality "should be organized to provide the best service" in the future. they discussed residents' needs and created relevant recommendations.

title: citizens’ meeting on a development plan for tommerup on funen, denmark
description: on may 21st, 2016, the 60 members of the citizens’ meeting on a development plan for tommerup on funen, denmark met to debate the question, "what should tommerup look like in the future and why should one move there?"

title: citizens’ hearing in gentofte on children and young people
description: on april 18th, 2004, the 100 members of the citizens’ hearing in gentofte on children and young people met to provide feedback and ideas on the municipality's policy on children and youth.

title: french citizens' jury on vaccination
description: on october 5th, 2016, the 22 members of the french citizens' jury on vaccination met to propose opinions and recommendations for the new action plan on vaccination regulation, alongside the recommendations of an expert jury.

title: planning cell on usedom: a german-polish island
description: in 2009, the 26 members of the planning cell on usedom: a german-polish island met to discuss how to improve mutual cooperation of german and polish citizens living in the island of usedom.

title: planning cell on improving the neighborhood in sparrplatz
description: in 2000, the 71 members of the planning cell on improving the neighborhood in sparrplatz met to identify action points and proposed solutions for improving the living conditions in the neighborhood from the point of view of the residents as the actual "neighborhood experts".

title: planning cell on "our boulevard" in artern, germany
description: in 2009, the 29 members of the planning cell on "our boulevard" met to produce recommendations on strategic urban planning considerations and create space for elderly citizens to express their opinions.

title: planning cell on municipal and administrative reform in rhineland-palatinate
description: in 2008, the 144 members of the planning cell on municipal and administrative reform in rhineland-palatinate met to discuss municipal and administrative reform in the german state.

title: german planning cell on opportunities and limits of online democracy
description: in 2002, the 78 members of the planning cell on opportunities and limits of online democracy met to discuss possible implementation of online democracy measures.

title: planning cells on health in bavaria, germany
description: in 2004, the 405 randomly selected participants in the planning cells on health in bavaria, germany met to produce recommendations for health policy.

title: nordhausen planning cell
description: in 1997, the 48 members of the nordhausen planning cell met to provide their insights on the new city plan. the planning cell was implemented by the geographical institute of the university of bonn.

title: apolda planning cell
description: in 1997, the 46 members of the apolda planning cell met to produce recommendations on the urban development and the design of the darrplatz.

title: planning cell on the design of lengerich's old town and the town hall square
description: in 1999, the 52 members of the planning cell on the design of the old town and the town hall square in lengerich, germany met to provide recommendations on the renovation of the old town.

title: planning cell on the development of the city of meckenheim
description: in 2000, the 100 members of the planning cell on the development of the city of meckenheim met to discuss a proposed urban development plan.

title: witten planning cell
description: in 1999, the 92 members of the witten planning cell met to provide recommendations on possible future uses of the kornmarkt, which was—at the time—being used as a bus station.

title: leeds climate change citizens' jury
description: leeds climate change citizen jury was commissioned by the leeds climate commission to ensure citizens voices were heard in leeds' vision for achieving carbon zero emissions. the jury produced 12 recommendations which informed leeds city council's 2020 climate emergency strategy.

title: brent climate assembly
description: brent council commissioned a citizens' assembly to address how the council, local businesses, organisations and individuals could work together to limit climate change. the results informed brent's climate action plan.

title: oxford citizens assembly on climate change
description: the oxford citizens assembly on climate change took place on the weekends of 28/09/19 and 19/10/19. participants considered measures to reduce oxford’s carbon emissions to net zero and, as part of this, oxford city council’s own carbon footprint to net zero by 2030.

title: leicester climate assembly
description: the leicester climate assembly was held on 18 january 2020, enabling 50 representative members of the public to provide input on the local council's sustainability action plan. it formed part of a wider programme of engagement by the council called “leicester’s climate conversation”.

title: newham citizens’ assembly on climate change
description: after declaring a climate emergency, newham council established a citizens' assembly to address how to collaboratively reach the goal of carbon neutrality. the response informed the council's climate emergency action plan.

title: wisdom council on bio-based economy: "biobasierte wirtschaft?! welche folgen hat das für meine region?"
description: citizens discussed with experts the opportunities and risks of the bioeconomy, or more precisely, of the cultivation and use of plant-based biomass in northrine-westphalia (nrw). the citizens drew up recommendations for the future design of a sustainable bio-based economy in nrw.

title: waltham forest citizens assembly
description: waltham forest hosted a citizens' assembly on the rise in hate crime in their area and across london. members were asked what work could be done collectively to stop hate and ensure everyone can feel welcome and safe in the borough.

title: kendal climate change citizens’ jury
description: 20 residents of kendal were selected to form a citizens jury. over 9 sessions, they deliberated on "what should kendal do about climate change?". their recommendations will be presented to the council and inform the work of kendal town council’s carbon neutral kendal group.

title: "no to child marriage; yes to education" campaign
description: the foundation for youth empowerment, based in malawi, organized this campaign to address educational availability for girls and address practices and factors that impinge the ability of families to keep them in schools.

title: stadt+um+land 2030 brunswick region planning cells
description: in 2003, the 94 members of the stadt+um+land 2030 brunswick region planning cells met to develop future models and strategies for the greater brunswick area under the conditions of demographic change.

title: bavarian planning cells: opportunities for all
description: in 2008, the 211 members of the bavarian planning cells on opportunities for all met to provide recommendations on a wide range of topics. these included population growth, family, education, the environment, civil rights, and internal security, among others.

title: planning cells on volunteering and social commitment in baden-württemberg, germany
description: in 1998, the 149 members of the planning cells on volunteering and social commitment met in baden-württemberg, germany, to identify new possibilities for civic engagement as well as new forms of citizen inclusion in decisionmaking.

title: planning cells on accessing public transport in berlin
description: in 2016, the 23 members of the planning cells on accessing public transport in berlin met to provide guidelines for the future of electronic access systems for public transport in berlin.

title: planning cells on the future development of the city of meerbusch
description: in 1999, the 132 participants in the planning cells on the future development of the city of meerbusch met to provide recommendations about whether local development should be centralized or decentralized, as well as future uses of the central urban area.

title: planning cells on smart energy and transport changes in berlin's city districts
description: in 2014, the 88 members of the planning cells on smart energy and transport changes in berlin's city districts met to formulate recommendations for implementation of renewable energies and electric cars in urban neighborhoods.

title: planning cells on waste management in the city of aachen
description: in 2007, the 94 members of the planning cells on waste management in the city of aachen met to come up with proposals for a new distribution scheme for waste fees.

title: planning cells on co-operative housing in solingen
description: in 1995, the 66 members of the planning cells on co-operative housing in solingen met to produce guidelines and suggestions for the planning and realization of co-operative housing.

title: üstra planning cells
description: in 1995, the 197 members of the üstra planning cells met to discuss the problems of local public transport in the hanover region and their solution options.

title: german planning cells on the technical possibilities of isdn
description: in 1990, the 519 members of the planning cells on the technical possibilities of isdn met to assess the integrated services digital network (isdn), its usefulness for everyday life, and how the protection of communication data of the citizen should be ensured.

title: planning cells on the development of the district at the tempelhofer damm
description: the 69 members of the planning cells on the development of the district at the tempelhofer damm met to discuss its possible different uses, the design of the neighborhood, and the integration of the district into the urban environment.

title: citizens' councils on the integrated environmental program 2030
description: in 2017, the 79 members of the citizens' councils on the integrated environmental program 2030 met to gather the lifelong perspective of citizens on relevant environmental issues in order to incorporate them in the form of proposals in the new program.

title: planning cell on solingen 2010
description: across 4 days in 1987, 25 citizens took part in the planning cell on solingen 2010. their mandate was to contribute to city planning.

title: german planning cells on energy-efficient urbanism
description: from june 13th to 14th, 2012, the 21 members of the german planning cells on energy-efficient urbanism were brought together in an effort to involve the local population in the design of energy-efficient measures to improve the quality of residence in adlershof.

title: basel planning cells on red-light districts, residential areas, and urban development
description: in 2002, the 25 members of the planning cells on red-light districts, residential areas, and urban development met to provide concrete solutions for central, district-specific concerns in the spatially burdened, ethnically densely populated neighborhoods of basel, switzerland.

title: german planning cells on climate
description: in 1996, the 220 members of the german planning cells on climate met to assess the potential social impact of various co2 reduction measures and help develop and justify a strategy for energy.

title: planning cells on neighborhood management in magdeburger platz
description: in 2000, the 55 members of the planning cells on neighborhood management in magdeburger platz met to help identify strengths and weaknesses and provide ideas for the neighborhood.

title: planning cells on land use in weinheim, germany
description: from june 22nd to 24th, 2012, the 37 members of the planning cells on land use met to to provide recommendations, suggestions and requirements for land use in weinheim, germany.

title: planning cells on consumer protection in bavaria
description: in 2001, the 425 members of the planning cells on consumer protection in bavaria  (bürgergutachten zum verbraucherschutz) met to discuss issues of consumer protection.

title: planning cells on the development of the munich region
description: from september 2016, to may 2017, the 94 members of the planning cells on the development of the munich region met to develop recommendations on regional development that would be used for regional planning.

title: planning cells on urban redevelopment of the knot remscheid central station
description: in 1999, the 95 members of the planning cells on urban redevelopment of the knot remscheid central station met to produce recommendations for the redesigning of remscheid hauptbahnhof area.

title: planning cells on urban development of the neumarkt in osnabrück
description: in 2001, the 129 members of the planning cells on urban development of the neumarkt in osnabrück met to produce recommendations on which direction the city center should develop in the future.

title: planning cell on lengerich 2047
description: in 1997, the 132 members of the planning cells on lengerich 2047 met in lengerich, germany, to discuss and provide recommendations on the future of the industrial wasteland.

title: "guatemala includes you" project's public dialogue
description: the working group of the "guatemala includes you" project (span. guate te incluye) initiated a dialogue process in 2017 to promote the labor insertion of deported guatemalan migrants who are often criminalized and excluded from job opportunities.

title: consultative council of law 19.122 for afro-descendants in uruguay
description: this consultative council was created in 2013 in the framework of the law 19.122 for afro-descendants. the council’s aim is to monitor and advise on measures for the afro-descendant community in uruguay.

title: sectorial strategy to promote youth employment in ecuador
description: the sectorial strategy to promote youth employment is an initiative carried out by the “fundación esquel” and “esquel juventudes ngos”, in alliance with the ministry of labor relations of ecuador, in order to build a strategy to promote youth employment.

title: panama's tripartite roundtable for economic and labor development
description: the round table for economic and labor development was implemented by the ministry of labor development with the aim of having a national dialogue to agree on policies and solutions to prepare for covid-19's economic and labor aftermath.

title: #blackwomendecide
description: the #blackwomendecide (pt. #mulheresnegrasdecidem) initiative focused on producing data-driven indicators on black women’s political participation while monitoring black women's candidacies in brazil.

title: ecuadorian citizen collaboratory on covid-19
description: the citizen collaboratory is an initiative implemented by civil society with the aim of articulating different citizen initiatives to reduce the socially differentiated impact generated by the spread of covid-19 in ecuador.

title: #togetherwehack
description: #togetherwehack is a hackathon organized by argentinian civil society and private sectors in pursuit of solutions that can deal with the impacts of the covid-19 pandemic.

title: citizens’ panel – planning the west midlands’ recovery
description: the west midlands combined authority (wmca) commissioned a citizens’ panel to address the economic and social impacts of the covid-19 public health crisis. the panel sought citizens’ input to inform and guide the priorities for the region’s recovery.

title: covid-19 culturally & linguistically diverse community forums: south australia
description: preparing to avoid a second wave of covid-19 in south australia, sa health engaged democracyco to conduct multiple online forums with 250 multicultural leaders. this work enabled sa health to combat an outbreak two weeks later and ultimately avoid a second wave.

title: vancouver plan 2020
description: "from november 2019 to august 2020 the city of vancouver has heard the hopes, concerns and aspirations of over 12,000 residents, employees, business owners and visitors as part of the initial phase of 'planning vancouver together.'"

title: planning cells on downtown neuss 2010
description: in 2000, the 199 members of the planning cells on downtown neuss 2010 met to develop recommendations on the design of downtown neuss and its accessibility.

title: planning cells on the urban development plan for regensburg, germany
description: in 2000, the 227 members of the planning cells on the urban development plan for regensburg met to provide input for the revised version of the urban development plan for the german city.

title: planning cells on the concept of citizen participation for wolfsburg
description: in 2013, the 90 members of the planning cells on the concept of citizen participation for wolfsburg met to help develop a concept for citizen participation.

title: planning cells on biotechnology and genetic engineering in baden-wurttemberg, germany
description: in 1995, the 194 members of the planning cells on biotechnology and genetic engineering met to provide citizens' opinions on topics of biotechnology and genetic engineering.

title: planning cells on the development of the town of planegg
description: across 4 days in july 2015, the 55 members of the planning cells on the development of the town of planegg met to develop a vision for the city.

title: planning cells on kunstareal münchen: art, culture, knowledge
description: from september 16th to 26th, 2013, the 105 members of the planning cells on kunstareal münchen met to develop suggestions for the art area.

title: planning cells on the meiningen market and city development
description: in 1997, the 49 members of the planning cells on the meiningen market and city development met to produce recommendations and suggestions for the rebuilding of the meiningen market.

title: german planning cell: "we want more"
description: across 3 days in 1986, the 19 members of the leverkusen planning cell on "we want more" met to determine "tasks and actions for the municipal equality bodies".

title: planning cells on bürgeramt hannover south-east
description: in 1999, the 167 members of the planning cells on bürgeramt hannover south-east met to produce recommendations for the choice of location as well as expectations of the services offered by the new hanover city south-east office.

title: planning cells on future wrangelkiez
description: in 1999, the 78 members of the planning cells on future wrangelkiez met to help design a model for the development of the wrangelkiez for the next three decades.

title: planning cells on the future of work in neuberesinchen
description: in 1999, the 104 members of the planning cells on the future of work in neuberesinchen met to provide recommendations on the future of work in the region.

title: planning cell on a cable car for wuppertal
description: on march 7, 2016, the 48 members of the planning cell on a cable car for wuppertal met to consider a controversial project to build a cable car that would connect the city centre in the valley with a school and the university campus on the hillside, passing over inhabited areas.

title: planning cell on administrative, functional, and territorial reform in thuringia
description: in 2016, the 72 members of the planning cells on administrative, functional, and territorial reform in thuringia met to provide recommendations on how to create sustainable and citizen-friendly administrative structures during reorganization in thuringia, germany.

title: guipúzcoa citizens' jury
description: in 1993, the 303 members of the guipúzcoa citizens' jury met to produce recommendations with regards to a new highway.

title: madrid g1000
description: in 2019, the 279 members of the madrid g1000 met to produce proposals for the city of madrid strategy.

title: montornes ii citizens' jury
description: in 1999, the 56 members of the montornes ii citizens' jury met to produce recommendations with regards to the design of an urban park.

title: montornes i citizens' jury
description: in 1998, the 52 members of the montornes i citizens' jury met to produce recommendations with regards to the design of an urban park.

title: st. quirze citizens' jury
description: in 1997, the 93 members of the st. quirze citizens' jury met to produce recommendations with regards to general urban planning.

title: corbera citizens' jury
description: in 1997, the 72 members of the corbera citizens' jury met to produce recommendations with regards to general urban planning.

title: calafell citizens' jury
description: in 1998, the 81 members of the calafell citizens' jury met to produce recommendations with regards to social and economic development.

title: rubí citizens' jury
description: in 1997, the 77 members of the rubí citizens' jury met to produce recommendations with regards to a use of public space.

title: mutual support mérida
description: "mutual support mérida" (spanish: apoyo mutuo mérida) is an initiative to connect volunteers with people in need who have been harshly affected by the covid-19 pandemic.

title: "i want to help": mexican center for philanthropy's online initiative
description: "i want to help" (spanish: "quiero ayudar") is an initiative by the mexican center for philanthropy (cemefi) which aims to build support networks to link different social actors who require help or can volunteer to provide aid.

title: oregon citizens' assembly on covid-19 recovery
description: healthy democracy and oregon’s kitchen table organized the first statewide citizens’ assembly in oregon to inform the policies needed to forge a path beyond the crises engendered by covid-19. thirty-six randomly selected citizens took part in this online deliberative process.

title: citizen panel on the future of walloon brabant
description: in 2011, walloon brabant initiated a citizen's panel to guide the region's policy on the revision of sector plans, encouraging citizens to learn about and engage in deliberation on a relevant issue to them.

title: global classroom: food security design jam
description: launched by the university of toronto scarborough, the global classroom series brings together students from around the world in a collaborative online format for cross cultural engagement and learning.

title: #boliviavsvirus
description: #boliviavsvirus is an initiative focused on generating and promoting innovative solutions to address the effects of the covid-19 pandemic.

title: #citizenresponsebolivia
description: #citizenresponsebolivia is a civil society initiative which aimed to combat misinformation regarding covid-19 by disseminating official, verified information.

title: coronacidades
description: coronacidades is an initiative of civil society organizations in brazil that seeks to advise interested local governments, free of charge, on how to address the challenges generated by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: nina app
description: the nina app is a smartphone application created by a citizen of fortaleza as a mechanism to report sexual harassment in public transport.

title: civic hackathon for innovative public policies in brazil
description: the civic hackathon aimed to be a space for citizen participation in order to promote innovation in the creation and implementation of public policies in brazil.

title: executive tables for exterior commerce: collaborative addressing covid-19's impact in costa rica
description: the executive tables for exterior commerce were a deliberative exercise between the national government of costa rica and the private sector to coordinate actions regarding challenges emerging from the covid-19 pandemic.

title: dominican republic covid-19 citizen oversight commission
description: the covid-19 citizen oversight commission was created in april 2020 by president danilo medina, as an independent body in charge of monitoring the purchases and contracts signed by the government during the emergency triggered by the covid-19 pandemic.

title: virtual hackathon "innovating during quarantine"
description: the virtual hackathon ‘innovating during quarantine’ was a digital campaign that developed in the dominican republican in light of the emergency created by the covid-19 pandemic.

title: citizen pact's covid-19 monitoring initiative
description: "citizen pact”, a group composed of over one hundred civil society organizations, proposed to the guatemalan government a strategy to include civil society in managing the covid-19 pandemic.

title: ayudapy: creating citizen support networks to respond to the covid-19 pandemic in paraguay
description: ayudapy ("helppy") is an initiative implemented by the paraguayan red cross to create citizen support networks to face challenges arising from the covid-19 pandemic. the ayudapy.org website was designed with the support of a group of young civil society programmers.

title: 2018 oklahoma teacher walkout
description: starting on april 2, 2018 and ending on april 12, 2018, tens of thousands of people in the u.s. state of oklahoma, including teachers, administrators and citizens, participated in a walkout to protest issues that plagued the state’s educational system.

title: honduras digital challenge 2020: covid-19
description: “honduras digital challenge 2020: covid-19” is a hackathon that was organized with the aim of seeking joint solutions and technological proposals to meet the challenges arising from the covid-19 pandemic.

title: honduran citizen consultation on mining concessions
description: on december 2nd, 2018, the first citizen consultation in southern honduras was organized in the municipality of el triunfo, choluteca to engage citizens with respect to mining projects in the community.

title: honduran participatory agroclimatic committees
description: the participatory agroclimatic committees are an initiative implemented by the honduran ministry of agriculture and livestock that brings together representatives from different sectors in order to share information on climate change relating to the agricultural sector.

title: mexican public forums for national peace and reconciliation
description: the “public forums for national peace and reconciliation” are dialogues developed by the president of mexico in order to facilitate the sharing of citizen perspectives and ideas about topics such as insecurity and organized-crime.

title: covid-19 mexico challenge
description: the "covid-19 mexico challenge" is an initiative implemented by mexico's network of technology transfer offices in mexico (red ott méxico) with the objective of identifying the main challenges derived from the pandemic in order to connect them to citizen-proposed solutions.

title: "cuidemos a panamá" national plan for post-covid-19 response
description: "cuidemos a panamá" ("let's take care of panama") is an initiative of panama’s civil society, that seeks to create a national plan proposal for the period after the covid-19 pandemic.

title: dialogue and deliberative workshops on covid-19 and the nhs (national health service)
description: the imperial college health partners and ipsos mori, on behalf of nhs england and nhs improvement, convened six dialogue and deliberative workshops in london. the two-stage project gathered insights on londoners’ concerns and explored their views on measures related to covid-19.

title: online public dialogues on covid-19 winter preparedness
description: on behalf of the academy of medical sciences, three online public workshops were conducted in the uk by ipsos mori to explore the public’s concerns and priorities regarding the preparation for a second wave of covid-19 cases over winter 2020-21.

title: noosa community jury on river management
description: in 2015, noosa council, in queensland, australia, convened a community jury on the management of the noosa river. this was the second jury conducted in noosa and formed part of a trial for the council in order to improve the council's community engagement.

title: the positive effect: an online conference against hiv stigma
description: the poz effect two-day and online-only conference was organized to contribute to the understanding and reduction of hiv stigma in canada. it was held synchronously (in real time) online on thursday, june 13th, 2019.

title: citizens' panels on gmos
description: in order to address the issue of genetically modified organisms (gmos), federal public authorities joined forces with the foundation for future generations (fgf) to organize citizens' panels in two belgian municipalities in 2003.

title: nantes métropole citizens' convention
description: nantes métropole is convening an online citizens' convention to learn lessons from the covid-19 pandemic. from november 2020 to february 2021, 80 randomly selected citizens will deliberate and present a series of recommendations to the local elected officials.

title: "lire dans mes gènes": belgian mini-public on biotechnology
description: an ethical debate on the use of genes is arising from rapid advances in biotechnology, so the king baudouin foundation (frb) organized a mini-public with 31 citizens, who deliberated on the use of genetic diagnostic tests during three weekends, from january to march 2003.

title: belgian citizen panel on food security: at what price?
description: the belgian federal agencies for food safety and for the public health asked the foundation roi baudouin to organize a minipublic with 30 randomly selected ordinary citizens in october 2004, who deliberated during 2 days on the principles that should guide the public policy.

title: walloon citizens' panel on eu common agricultural policy
description: the european citizens' panel initiative is supported by the european commission and aimed to include citizens in the debate on the common agriculture policy via 8 citizens' panels. one was implemented in the walloon region of belgium.

title: bristol citizens' assembly
description: bristol citizens' assembly was part of a three-phase process created by the city of bristol to gather public input to inform its covid-19 recovery plan. the sixty randomly selected members met online for four weekends between january to march 2021.

title: participatory drafting of the croatian anti-corruption strategy
description: from 2014-2015, croatia’s national action plan prioritized public participation in the process of drafting their new anti-corruption strategy, including the allocation of budget resources.

title: uk cross-government anti-corruption plan
description: from 2013 to 2015, the uk government engaged non-governmental organizations and civil society in designing the cross-government anti-corruption plan.

title: improving public participation in decision-making in latvia
description: latvia committed to raising awareness and strengthening processes for public participation in decision making from 2017 to 2019.

title: latvian e-portal for collecting signatures on popular initiatives
description: latvia committed to enabling the collection of signatures online in order for citizens to initiate and vote on a referendum, thereby directly participating in democratic processes.

title: 2016 citizens’ dialogues on the national water plan in uruguay
description: the uruguayan government involved civil society in developing a participatory water management system under the national water plan.

title: 2015 irish constitutional referendums
description: the government of ireland held two referendums in may 2015 on proposed constitutional amendments. the amendment permitting same-sex marriage was successful while the amendment to reduce the age of candidacy for presidential elections failed to receive the necessary support to pass.

title: public participation on the lobbying law in chile
description: in order to address a lack of transparency, the chilean government committed to implementing and monitoring the lobbying law, which regulates lobbying activities and was the result of citizen consultations.

title: citizen feedback portal on draft laws in jalisco, mexico
description: the mexican state committed to providing a digital platform for citizen participation in the creation and approval of laws.

title: online consultations on bureaucratic procedures in colombia
description: colombia created automated services to process citizen comments and input into the procedures and services of select prioritized sectors.

title: budget monitor portal for public engagement in georgia
description: georgia committed to enhancing citizen participation and transparency in the supervision process of public finances via an online monitoring portal.

title: meeting of the brusseleirs
description: two days of public workshops and conferences around how to improve participation in the city of brussels.  the meetings were open to all citizens and organized by the city authorities

title: brussels' citizen panel on air pollution
description: the government of the brussels region is organizing a citizens' panel on air pollution generated by cars in the brussels region and to assess the acceptability of potential measures among citizens.

title: participatory architectural planning of the catholic university of louvain campus building "la mémé"
description: this historic case concerns the planning of the social area of the faculty of medicine of the catholic university of louvain and, more specifically, the design, construction and collective transformations of the maison médicale known as "la mémé".

title: the european citizens' consultation (2007 events)
description: the european citizens’ consultations brought together over 1,800 citizens from 27 eu member states to deliberate on the future of the european union. this case describes its second phase: the national consultations from february–march 2007 and various follow-up events throughout 2007. [1]

title: labocitoyens: belgian citizens' panel on healthcare reimbursement
description: 32 people came together over three weekends to participate in a mini-audience on citizens' preferences for healthcare reimbursement.

title: climate citizen parliament
description: the climate citizen parliament brought together 45 citizens drawn by lot to discuss the environment and propose concrete solutions for the provincial council of the province of luxembourg in belgium.

title: mini-public on the future of agriculture in austria
description: in 2012, the mini-public on the future of agriculture in austria (zukunft der landwirtschaft) involved 12 citizens gathering to answer the question, “how should agriculture develop in austria? which expectations do you have towards farmers?”

title: belgian citizen panel on consumer rights
description: thirty citizens met in brussels in 2004 for a citizen panel on consumer rights initiated by the belgian federal government. the deliberative process focused on three predefined themes: labels, sales contracts and transparent prices.

title: meeting of minds: a european citizens’ deliberation on brain science
description: meeting of minds was a citizens’ deliberation created to develop recommendations regarding brain science policy for the european parliament. taking place from 2005 to 2006, the deliberation included 126 citizens from nine european countries. [1]

title: citizen panel of the iris plan
description: the government of the brussels-capital region organized a citizens' panel in 2006 to develop its approach to updating the regional travel plan (iris). thirty panelists examined different options and submitted their recommendations to the government.

title: citizens' conference on the long-term management of radioactive waste
description: the national body for radioactive waste and enriched fissile material organized a deliberative process bringing together 32 belgian citizens in 2010 in order to develop its long-term management plan for category b and c radioactive waste.

title: "notre futur": deliberative process on aging in belgium
description: the foundation for future generations developed a deliberative process in order to obtain the opinions of belgian citizens on the issue of aging. following a consultative process with experts, a citizen panel was set up to respond to the themes selected.

title: g100 grez-doiceau
description: activist residents of the semi-rural town of grez-doiceau organized a minipublic in 2014 on the future of the town. the g100 was open to all citizens and a portion of the participants were selected by lot.

title: mini-public on ensuring long-term living quality (vorarlberg, austria)
description: the mini-public on ensuring long-term living quality in vorarlberg (wie gelingt es uns, lebensqualität langfristig zu sichern?) involved 13 citizens working to form recommendations addressing "how to ensure long-term living quality” over 1.5 days.

title: tele-coaching intervention for persons living with hiv in toronto, canada
description: researchers evaluated the implementation of an online tele-coaching cbe intervention for persons living with hiv (plwh).

title: european citizens’ consultation in belgium
description: the european commission wished to consult citizens before the 2009 elections. it instructed the king baudoin foundation to organize a minipublic in belgium with 49 citizens drawn by lot who must deliberate on the role of the eu in the economy and society in a global world.

title: mini-public on how to create an attractive living space for future generations (vorarlberg, austria)
description: the government of vorarlberg initiated the mini-public on how to create an attractive living space for future generations (wie können wir für nächste generationen einen möglichst attraktiven lebensraum schaffen?) in june 2012. across 1.5 days, 16 people addressed the question, “how can we [combine] sustainability, satisfaction and deceleration with economic growth?”

title: mini-public on how to succeed as a good community (vorarlberg, austria)
description: the mini-public on how to succeed as a good community (wie gelingt gute nachbarschaft?) took place in vorarlberg before a landtags-enquete (regional parliament commission). over 1.5 days, 11 people met to form recommendations regarding the question, “how can good community succeed?”

title: mini-public on what future-proof education looks like (vorarlberg, austria)
description: the mini-public on what future-proof education looks like (wie sieht zukunftstaugliche bildung aus?) involved 20 citizens creating recommendations regarding education across 1.5 days.

title: mini-public on successful development as a region (vorarlberg, austria)
description: the mini-public on successful development as a region (erfolgreiche weiterentwicklung als region) was initiated by the regional government of vorarlberg. due to a high registration count (28), two parallel mini-publics took place, both organized by the büro für zukunftsfragen.

title: youth-future-chances (vorarlberg, austria)
description: youth-future-chances (jugend – zukunft - chancen) was a mini-public initiated by the regional government of vorarlberg. across 1.5 days, 21 citizens created recommendations on what the region's youth needed in order to succeed and have a good life despite societal challenges.

title: mini-public on citizens’ participation in salzburg, austria
description: the mini-public on citizens’ participation (bürgerbeteiligung) was initiated by the parliament of salzburg and its enquete-kommission. across 1.5 days in october 2014, 24 participants created a set of 75 recommendations regarding political participation in salzburg.

title: mini-public on mobility in salzburg, austria
description: the mini-public on mobility (mobilität) was initiated by a member of the salzburg regional government. across 1.5 days, 16 citizens created recommendations regarding the question, “which roadmap is needed for our mobility future in salzburg?”

title: mini-public on successful integration in salzburg, austria
description: due to the influx of refugees in austria in 2015, the regional government in salzburg decided to initiate its third mini-public on integration (gelungene integration). across 1.5 days, 15 citizens created recommendations regarding the questions, “what do we need? what can we do? what can we expect?”

title: youth pb accelerator
description: youthpb accelerator is making visible those citizen participation projects related to participatory budgets in which young people are involved.

title: dunblane young people's project (stirling, uk)
description: the stirling community safety partnership received £65,000 from the scottish government to run a pilot program, the dunblane young people’s project, which encouraged young people in the dunblane area to take accountability for their actions.

title: oakland community land trust
description: oakland community land trust is a model to create affordable housing while also centering community voice.

title: mini-public on the future of agriculture (vorarlberg, austria)
description: the mini-public on the future of agriculture (zukunft der landwirtschaft) took place in october of 2019. it was initiated by a network of people dedicated to agriculture and agricultural development, and commissioned by the büro für zukunftsfragen.

title: citizen panel for youth in wallonia, belgium
description: the citizen panel for youth in wallonia (panel citoyen sur les jeunes en wallonie) covered issues relevant to youth—such as employment, mobility, housing, training, sustainable development, and international openness—for 2025 to 2045, over four meetings held in march 2018.

title: danish consensus conference on electronic surveillance (borgerpanelets elektronisk overvågning)
description: the consensus conference on electronic surveillance (borgerpanelets elektronisk overvågning) was organized by the danish board of technology. across 3 days, 11 citizens heard presentations from experts and public officials, deliberated, and formed recommendations regarding electronic surveillance policies.

title: danish consensus conference on traffic and driving charges (borgerpanelets - konsensuskonference om trafik og kørselsafgifte)
description: the danish board of technology organized the consensus conference on traffic and driving charges (borgerpanelets - konsensuskonference om trafik og kørselsafgifte). across 3 days, 15 citizens participated in expert and public official hearings before forming recommendations.

title: danish deliberative poll on the euro (national folkehøring om euroen), 2000
description: in preparation of the referendum on the euro, danish authorities organized the deliberative poll on the euro (national folkehøring om euroen). across 2 days, 364 citizens discussed the pros and cons of adopting the euro with experts, politicians, and each other.

title: danish deliberative poll on denmark's full integration in the european police force (national folkehøring om europæisk politi)
description: the deliberative poll on denmark's full integration in the european police force (national folkehøring om europæisk politi) was organized by the danish parliament. across 3 days in 2015, 384 citizens deliberated on the advantages and disadvantages of the european police force.

title: danish deliberative poll on the eu (folkehøring om eu), 2017
description: across 2 days in february 2017, 105 citizens debated and discussed eu integration and the future of the eu.

title: danish deliberative poll on the eu (folkehøring 2018 om eu), 2018
description: after the deliberative poll on the eu in 2017, the danish parliament organized another deliberative poll—in which 400 citizens met for 2 days in november 2018—with the same goal of capturing the demands of danish citizens regarding the eu and the role of denmark within the eu.

title: danish deliberative poll on the euro (europahøring), 2006
description: in 2006, the danish parliament organized its second deliberative poll on the euro (europahøring). this time, the agenda was wider and not directly connected to a referendum; across 2 days, 419 citizens debated topics such as eu borders, the role of the eu, and policy tasks.

title: citizens’ jury on finnish democracy: current status, problems and solutions (kansalaisnäkökulma suomalaisen demokratian tilaan, ongelmiin ja ratkaisuihin)
description: the finnish ministry of justice initiated the citizens’ jury on finnish democracy (kansalaisnäkökulma suomalaisen demokratian tilaan, ongelmiin ja ratkaisuihin) while preparing for the government report on democracy policy. participating citizens deliberated over 2 days in 2013.

title: french citizen conference on gmos
description: the citizens' conference on gmos (conférence de citoyens sur les organismes génétiquement modifiés) was initiated by the french government and organized by the opecst. across 3 weekends in 1998, 14 citizens deliberated about gmos in agriculture and nutrition.

title: french citizen conference on climate change
description: the citizen conference on climate change (conférence citoyenne “changements climatiques et citoyenneté”) was held in paris from december 2001 to february 2002, gathering 16 citizens to debate issues related to climate change.

title: french citizen conference on sewage sludge
description: the citizen conference on sewage sludge (conférence citoyenne sur le devenir des boues domestiques issues des stations d'épuration) was initiated and convened by the french environment ministry as part of a national debate on water. ultimately, 15 citizens deliberated for 2 days.

title: permanent mixed body for regional employment and training policies (rhône-alpes, france)
description: the permanent mixed body for regional employment and training policies (ctef) was created in 2004 to coordinate employment and training policies. the ctef began including citizens in 2005—most of whom quit in 2007—but was discontinued in around 2016.

title: mini-public on transport policy in three regions of southern france
description: the mini-public on transport policy in 3 regions of southern france (rhône-alpes, provence-alpes-côte d’azur, languedoc-roussillon) was held as part of a debate on the regulation of rhône valley road traffic. 16 people deliberated for 3 weekends.

title: citizen conference on nanotechnologies (île de france, france)
description: the citizen conference on nanotechnologies (conférence citoyenne sur les nanotechnologies) was established by the regional council of île de france. 16 participants, across 4 weekends, deliberated and wrote a final report about nanotechnologies.

title: mini-public on the future of rural areas (rhônes-alpes, france)
description: the mini-public on the future of rural areas (jury citoyen sur le devenir des zones rurales) was convened by the regional government of rhône-alpes as part of a larger european consultation on the rural world. ultimately, 38 citizens deliberated across 3 weekends.

title: permanent committee for the funding of participatory projects (rhônes-alpes, france)
description: the permanent committee for the funding of participatory projects (comité technique pour le financement des projets de démocratie participative) was formed in 2006 by the government of rhône-alpes. the committee disbanded in 2009.

title: mini-public on regional transportation policies (rhônes-alpes, france)
description: the mini-public on regional transportation policies (atelier citoyen transports et mobilités) was convened by the regional government of rhône-alpes. it took place from january to march 2007, and the 42 participants met over three weekends.

title: mini-public on household waste (île de france, france)
description: the mini-public on household waste (conférence citoyenne sur les déchets ménagers) was convened by the regional government of île de france in 2008. 25 participants met 3 times across 3 weekends to deliberate and write a final report.

title: citizen conference on regional development indicators (nord-pas-de-calais, france)
description: the citizen conference on regional development indicators (conférence citoyenne sur les indicateurs de richesse) was convened by the regional government of nord-pas-de-calais. 15 citizens deliberated and wrote a final report across 4 days.

title: citizens jury on transportation policies (poitou-charentes, france)
description: the citizens jury on transportation policies (le jury citoyen d’évaluation de la politique régionale « transports et mobilités ») was convened by the region of poitou-charentes. for 3 days, 34 citizens evaluated the region’s transport policies with a focus on rural railway transport.

title: french mini-public on end of life care
description: the french mini-public on end of life care (conférence citoyenne sur la fin de vie) was held in the framework of a national debate on bioethics in 2013. 18 participants were gathered across 1 day to discuss a possible revision of laws regulating end-of-life care.

title: french mini-public on healthcare and big data
description: the french mini-public on healthcare and big data (atelier citoyen sur le big data en santé) gathered 17 citizens from may 2016 to june 2016. it was held in the framework of a national debate on big data, but not coupled with a legislative process.

title: french mini-public on addictive behavior at school
description: as part of the mini-public on addictive behavior at school (atelier citoyen sur la prévention des conduites addictives en milieu scolaire), 15 citizens gathered in march and april 2017 to discuss preventive measures against addiction among school-age youths.

title: french mini-public in the framework of a national debate on bioethics
description: the french mini-public in the framework of a national debate on bioethics (comité citoyen des etats généraux de la bioéthique) was a public consultation organized by the ccne. the 22 participants met over 4 weekends from february to may 2018.

title: berlin’s citizen juries (2001-2003)
description: from 2001 to 2003, several citizen juries (berliner bürgerjurys) were held in berlin, with the task of selecting community development projects to be funded and implemented by the city. each jury had 15–30 members, and met regularly to vote on proposals by qualified majority.

title: consensus conference on genetic diagnosis (dresden, germany)
description: the consensus conference on genetic diagnosis (bürgerkonferenz „streitfall gendiagnostik“) brought together 19 randomly selected participants in 2001 across 2 weekends to discuss preimplantation genetic diagnosis, prenatal testing, preventive testing, and stem cell research.

title: planification cells on intergenerational relationships in an aging society (rheinland-pfalz, germany)
description: between june and july 2004, eight planification cells on intergenerational relationships in an aging society (bürgergutachten miteinander der generationen in einer älter werdenden gesellschaft) were commissioned by the ministry of work, family and healthcare of rheinland-pfalz.

title: german citizen conference on high-tech medicine
description: the german citizen conference on high-tech medicine (bürgerreport hightech-medizin – welche gesundheit wollen wir?) was part of a nationwide dialogue on high-tech medicine organized in 2011 by the federal ministry of research. it involved 100 citizens, who deliberated for 1 day.

title: german citizen conference on the future energy technologies
description: the citizen conference on the future energy technologies (bürgerdialog “energietechnologien für die zukunft”) was organized by germany's federal research ministry as part of a larger dialogue on new energy technologies. in november 2011, 100 citizens met to draft recommendations.

title: german citizen conference on climate policy
description: the citizen conference on climate policy (bürgerdialog zum klimaschutzplan 2050) was initiated by the german ministry of the environment as part of a series of environmental consultations. across 1 day, 472 citizens created recommendations for reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

title: regional citizen conferences on the future of bavaria (bavaria, germany)
description: the citizen conferences on the future of bavaria (regionale bürgerkonferenzen “bürgergutachten 2030: bayern, deine zukunft”) involved 8 conferences with 30 citizens in ansbach, bamberg, deggendorf, garmisch-partenkirchen, memmingen, münchen, neumarkt and rhön-grabfeld.

title: irish citizens' assembly on gender equality
description: the citizens' assembly on gender equality is ongoing (since january 2020). it includes 99 randomly selected citizens, who were meant to meet over six weekends throughout the year. due to the covid-19 pandemic, several of these meetings have been postponed (as of march 2021).

title: mini-public on citizen participation in the health budget (tuscany, italy)
description: the mini-public on citizen participation in the health budget (le vie della partecipatione: partecipazione dei cittadini alla spesa sanitaria) was supported by the tuscany region. the town meeting was meant to outline the priorities of the health budget of the tuscany region.

title: a european town meeting on climate change (tuscany, italy)
description: the european town meeting on climate change was a mini-public supported by tuscany region, cornellà de llobregat and poitiers. the town meeting was held in five tuscany cities and two other cities; in total, 600 young citizens from the 8 cities were selected.

title: civilux: citizens’ consultation on constitutional referendum questions in luxembourg
description: civilux was an academic-led project by the research chair in parliamentary studies as part of the referendum campaign on the revision of the luxembourg constitution. in total, 27 citizens were invited to offer an advisory opinion on four referendum questions across 1 day.

title: constitulux: citizens' consultation in luxembourg
description: constitulux was a follow-up of the 2015 citizens’ consultation civilex, to contribute to understanding the expectations of luxembourgish citizens with respect to constitutional reforms. 60 citizens took part in the 2-day deliberation.

title: citizen's assembly on the future of food (north-brabant, netherlands)
description: the citizen's assembly on the future of food (voedsel1000) was was installed by the province of noord-brabant. it dealt with questions such as climate change, air quality, soil fertility, and healthy food. in total, it engaged 420 citizens across 5 days.

title: citizens’ assembly limburg (limburg, netherlands)
description: this was the first citizens’ assembly in limburg, organized simultaneously in three locations. 6 discussion themes were identified, among which were environmental topics, healthcare, and culture. on aggregate, 180 citizens deliberated for 2 days (over 6 months).

title: consultation of citizens: aveiro
description: the consultation of citizens: aveiro (consulta aos cidadãos - aveiro) was organized by the portuguese government. in 2016, 50 citizens were invited to gather for one day and to deliberate on government recent policies and on demands for the future years.

title: the constitutional forum in romania
description: the constitutional forum (forumul constituțional) was established by the romanian parliament in order to organize debates and consultations regarding the revision of the romanian constitution. from march to may 2013, over 1,200 people participated in over 50 of its local debates.

title: the citizen forum of san fernando de henares (madrid, spain)
description: started in 2002, the citizen forum of san fernando de henares (observatorio de la ciudad) is a permanent mini-public. one of its main functions is to evaluate citizen proposals from other institutional participatory mechanisms. it may recommend or reject a referendum for madrid.

title: (e-)skånepanelen: online citizen panel and its citizen groups in skåne, sweden
description: (e-)skånepanelen is a citizen panel and online survey in which 3000 to 5000 citizens in the region are consulted yearly on issues such as healthcare, regional development and the climate. started in 2014, it is part of open skåne 2030: a plan to involve citizens in policymaking.

title: uk climate change citizens’ summit (march 2007)
description: the climate change citizens’ summit involved six regional workshops—in bristol, birmingham, london, newcastle, nottingham and manchester—held during in late march and early april 2007. the workshops involved 28 to 29 people each, for a total of 174 participants.

title: uk climate change citizens’ summit (may 2007)
description: this climate change citizens’ summit was the follow-up event of the six regional workshops held during in late march and early april 2007. all participants in the regional workshops were invited to the reconvened citizens' summit; 152 public participants attended.

title: uk deliberative workshop on the 2007 draft legislative forum
description: the deliberative workshop on the 2007 draft legislative forum was coordinated by the british cabinet office. it involved 9 regional events with local stakeholders, such as local authorities, local businesses, and district councils.

title: mini-public on national pensions debate and national pensions day in the uk
description: the 2006 mini-public on national pensions debate and national pensions day was sponsored by the department of works and pensions. its goal was to “rais[e] awareness of the pension challenges facing society" and understand "public views on [...] reform to the uk pension system.”

title: scottish jury on land use management
description: the scottish jury on land use management gathered 22 citizens for 2 and a half days in the scottish parliament. the jury's recommendations were to inform the work of the scottish parliament’s environment, climate change, and land reform committee.

title: talking energy: mini-public on the future of nuclear power in the uk
description: the  mini-public on the future of nuclear power was launched by the british government in 2007. it involved 949 participants across nine deliberative events—in edinburgh, newcastle, liverpool, leicester, norwich, cardiff, london, exeter and belfast—on 8 september 2007.

title: uk people’s panel (online)
description: in 1998, the new labour government commissioned mori to create the “people’s panel”. its aim was to create a large representative population that could measure public opinion on various public issues. the people's panel was dissolved in 2002.

title: mini-public in the uk: your health, your care, your say
description: in 2005, the uk department of health commissioned a national “listening exercise” about the national health service called “your health, your care, your say." 4 regional events with 50–100 people took place, after which a 986-person “national citizen’s summit” was held.

title: gordon brown’s citizens’ juries in the uk: children & families
description: this citizens' jury on children & families was part of uk prime minister gordon brown's proposal for the use of citizens' juries. five were conducted by the department for children, schools and families; this specific jury met in bristol.

title: gordon brown’s citizens’ juries in the uk: crime
description: this citizens' jury on crime was part of uk prime minister gordon brown's proposal for the use of citizens' juries. five were conducted by the department for children, schools and families; this specific jury met in leicester.

title: gordon brown’s citizens’ juries in the uk: national health service
description: this citizens' jury on the national health service was part of uk prime minister gordon brown's proposal for the use of citizens' juries. 9 nhs citizens' juries took place in 2007, organized simultaneously and connected via livestream.

title: citizen debate on educational reform in french-speaking belgium
description: the french community in belgium organized a deliberative panel bringing together 24 citizens over 3 weekends to discuss the reform of compulsory education in french-speaking belgium.

title: deliberative panel on secondary education reform in flanders
description: the flemish minister of education is organizing a deliberative panel over three weekends to consult 24 citizens drawn by lot on the reform of secondary education then underway in flanders.
