title: “quelle europe pour demain ?": deliberative panel in belgium on the eu
description: the parliament of the french community of belgium organized a two-day deliberative panel with 89 people to raise awareness and consult citizens on the european union.

title: "we are molenbeek" deliberative panel
description: following the 2016 brussels attacks, the municipality of molenbeek saint-jean – where the attackers lived – decided to organize a deliberative panel with 112 citizens. the goal was to set priorities for living together and for fighting the radicalization of its residents.

title: city shapers: cityhive's metro vancouver youth civic education program
description: city shapers was an experiential, cohort-based civic education program for metro vancouver young adults. over 2019-2020, 3 cohorts explored pressing urban issues, with an emphasis on the municipal level and local decision-making.

title: building citizen bonds
description: the municipality of verviers launched a deliberative participation process with 16 citizens in order to find solutions to create links ("social cohesion") between the different districts of the city as well as between elected officials and citizens.

title: maine ranked choice voting
description: in 2016, maine voted to replace its traditional electoral system with ranked-choice voting (rcv). it did so through a ballot initiative after many legislative efforts to institute rcv had failed. after a legal challenge, a 2018 "people's veto" referendum bolstered rcv in maine.

title: ocpm | right of initiative and access routes to mount royal
description: the participatory approach analyzed consists of reducing traffic on the access routes to mount royal, located on the camilien-houde route, in montreal.

title: the dao hack
description: the most famous attack on any blockchain project. the dao hack was a re-entrancy attack on one of the earliest decentralised autonomous organisations.

title: cese citizen group on social inequality in france
description: the cese (economic, social and environmental council) convened a temporary committee to put forward policy recommendations regarding socioeconomic, political and geographic inequalities in france.

title: mini-public on a regional law for citizens’ participation (tuscany, italy)
description: this mini-public is supported by tuscany region. the town meeting was aimed at listing the priorities for the regional law on participation and at transforming these priorities in actual policy proposals.

title: citizens' committee on vaccination against covid-19
description: in order to support the covid-19 vaccination strategy in france, a citizens' committee has been created by the cese. this group is made up of 35 randomly selected citizens and aims to provide advice and recommendations during the vaccination campaign.

title: scottish parliament citizens’ panel on covid-19
description: the covid-19 committee of the scottish parliament convened a citizens’ panel to inform its oversight on the measures put in place by the government. the panel was comprised of 19 citizens randomly selected and organized virtually over four meetings in january and february 2021.

title: neighborhood group support initiative in aurora, il
description: the city of aurora in illinois has created an ongoing program to help establish and support neighborhood groups, which hold meetings and host community events, in an effort to improve community-police relations and decrease violent crime.

title: argentina’s campaign for the right to legal, safe and free abortion
description: since 2005, women’s movements in argentina have been working to articulate and promote the national campaign for the right to legal, safe and free abortion, culminating in the legalization of abortion in december 2020.

title: hisd stucon: covid-19 school reopening survey
description: the houston independent school district student congress “hisd stucon” launched a survey to gain student input about school reopening during the covid-19 pandemic.

title: participatory budgeting in lausanne, switzerland
description: this pilot project is the first city-wide participatory budgeting (pb) in switzerland, starting in 2019, and financed by the swiss confederation for three years.

title: ¡en mi barrio, yo decido! - online participatory budgeting in peñalolén
description: the government of peñalolén, a municipality in the santiago province of chile, developed an online-only participatory budgeting scheme to better engage the citizens with government decisions and to understand their opinions/preferences on budget choices. 24450 citizens took part.

title: deliberative polling® on policies toward the roma in bulgaria
description: bulgaria's second deliberative poll was held due to the generational poverty faced by its roma population. the results show that policy stances changed amongst most participants in relation to housing, education and higher levels of roma representation in public offices.

title: co-management programme of fisheries in lake malombe, malawi
description: the co-management programme was introduced in lake malombe in attempt to resurrect the failing fishery. representatives from the local area were elected to form the institution known as the beach village committee, or commonly referred to as the bvc.

title: participatory budgeting in matam, senegal
description: participatory budgeting in senegal was implemented due to political change which was constrained by budget limits. an ngo called ecopop was contacted to aid in resource mobilisation and improve transparency.

title: parks masterplanning in leighton linslade using planning for real®
description: leighton linslade town council appointed planning for real in order to consult citizens of the town on what features should be considered in their park's 20 year plan.

title: participatory budgeting (pb): city of durham cycle 1
description: in 2018, the durham city council approved $2.4m in funding and appointed a committee to create goals and aid the programmes' administration. each of the 3 wards received $800,000, allowing residents to decide how to allocate this budget for projects within their community.

title: community driven development: community investment in rural areas project in bolivia
description: bo picar community investment in rural areas was a project aiming to fight rural poverty by providing access to basic infrastructure and services in rural bolivia. through this initiative, over 350,000 people were able to gain access to basic infrastructures and services.

title: participatory budgeting in maputo, mozambique, 2008
description: the municipality of maputo, with funding from the world bank, sought to involve the citizens in the allocation of funds to community infrastructure projects.

title: participatory budgeting in the indische buurt, amsterdam
description: in the fall of 2012, the eastern district of amsterdam, the indische buurt neighbourhood, joined the national participatory budgeting scheme, thereby aiding the original aim by allowing for better national budget monitoring.

title: maple wind turbines
description: implementation of a wind farm in the mrc de l'érable in quebec. the project caused great tension, leading to a deterioration of the social climate. legal proceedings initiated by the affected municipalities against the project promoter.

title: citizen channel
citizen panel on early childhood (eupen, belgium)
citizen panel for the esplanade (ottignies-louvain-la-neuve, belgium)
citizen panel on aging issues (namur, belgium)
my dna: all concerned (belgium)
citizen panel on young people in wallonia (namur, belgium)
the brighton and hove climate assembly
description: in 2020, brighton and hove city council commissioned ipsos mori to hold a climate assembly focused on reducing carbon emissions from transportation. the overall aim of this is to bring brighton and hove closer to meeting their goal of becoming carbon neutral by 2030.

title: participatory budgeting in wuxi, china
description: from 2006 to 2008, participatory budgeting in wuxi covered 60 capital projects with a total budget of 55 million rmb. these capital projects mainly focus on the improvement of community environment, citizens' education, healthcare, and so on.

title: 2017 participatory budgeting for migrant workers in taiwan
description: this project involved south-east-asian migrant workers who were living and working in taiwan without citizenship, aiming to create spaces for the provision of equal participation opportunities for those who are disadvantaged, promoting diverse inclusion in taiwanese society.

title: decidim: participatory budgeting in barcelona
description: catalan for 'we decide', decidim is barcelona's first digital democracy tool, where citizens can participate in municipality budgeting.  citizens can decide where up to 75 million euros of the municipal budget will be spent  (5% of the overall budget) between 2020 and 2023.

title: participatory budgeting in wenqiao town, china
description: in wenqiao town of wenling in eastern china’s zhejiang province, the people were given an opportunity few chinese citizens have, to take part in hearings on local government budget plans and suggest ways to spend the money. [1]

title: participatory climate change adaptation planning in santiago de chile
description: in 2010, santiago de chile (mrs) obtained detailed information on climate changes' effect on the region. this led the government to enact the climate adaptation santiago project (cas), a participatory process consisting of policymakers, practitioners, and scientists.

title: camden health and care citizens' assembly
description: the citizens' assembly brought together a representative cross-section of local residents for discussions around health and care services in the london borough of camden. the objective was to give residents the power to inform camden’s new joint health and wellbeing strategy.

title: national participatory budgeting in south korea
description: since 2011, participatory budgeting has been used in every local government of south korea. the ministry of economy and finance, of the korean central government, implemented participatory budgeting nationally for the 2018 fiscal year budget (moef, 2018), and every year since.

title: “small action of happiness": participatory budgeting in xihu district, nanchang city
description: in october 2017, 21 communities in the xihu district, in nanchang city implemented "small action of happiness"—which is the local name of participatory budgeting—in order to enable residents to participate in budget decision-making processes and have their voices be heard.

title: participatory resource monitoring  in yunnan, china
description: a participatory resources monitoring (prm) system was developed and implemented by representatives of 12 villages in yunnan, china. results indicate that participatory monitoring is a valuable tool for villagers to engage in self-owned management actions.

title: connecting to parliament
description: the purpose of the connecting to parliament is to link a representative sample of constituents with their elected official in town hall conversations about the issues that are subject to parliamentary debate in australia. this one focused on mitochondrial disease/donation.

title: dudley council's citizens' assembly: the future of dudley
description: dudley council brought together 50 randomly selected people from around the local area to form a citizens' assembly in november. participants discussed what communities and dudley council can do to make the dudley and brierley hill town centres better.

title: wiltshire: young people influencing decisions about transportation
description: in 2010 in the rural county of wiltshire, young people were unhappy with transport provision. in particular, they focused on the ages at which young people were required to pay full fare, as this varied between different bus companies in the county.

title: system of popular and citizen participation of canoas
description: the canoas popular and citizen participation system consisted of a set of 13 tools geared to collective, individual, collaborative, cooperative, and strategic development demands, enabling the city to better manage resources until it was discontinued after a change in government.

title: productive workers' battles
description: in venezuela, productive workers' battles are restorations of state-owned and worker controlled industrial facilities. since 2016 these battles have been organized by the productive workers' army (epo) in partnership with workers in occupied factories and communal councils.

title: teenagers experience of covid-19 (tec-19)
description: young people (yp) were not prioritized for public health messages during the pandemic. they are uniquely vulnerable to the long-term impact of the pandemic and mental health issues. the tec-19 project supports recommendations to improve communication between yp and government

title: citizen forum in geneva
description: the citizen forum (forum citoyen) is implemented by a team from the university of geneva coordinated by professor nenad stojanović. thirty selected residents deliberated about how to improve the quality of life in the canton of geneva while dealing with climate change.

title: 2019 participatory budgeting in speke, merseyside
description: speke in merseyside  is among five sites that the home office has supported to explore the issue of tackling serious and organised crime through strengths based engagement.

title: civic space citizens’ panel in belfast
description: the initiative for civic space citizens’ panel brought together a diverse group of people from across northern ireland to explore how the northern ireland assembly could better capture ‘citizen voice’ in future approaches to engagement and participation in decision making.

title: participatory budgeting in meilan district, haikou, china
description: the participatory budgeting in meilan district, haikou, china ran from 8 december 2016 to 7 april 2017. the government of meilan district distributed 6 million rmb to renmin street and haidian street. the budgeting included engineering and social service projects.

title: participatory budgeting in newry, mourne and down, northern ireland (2018)
description: in 2018, participatory budgeting was introduced in communities within northern ireland in order to alleviate problems facing citizens the most, via democratic measures to vote on where public funding should be spent.

title: participatory budgeting in glasgow to tackle child poverty
description: after a change in scotland's political dynamic after the 2014 referendum, pb schemes were introduced to promote national identity and political sovereignty, which resulted in the introduction of 4 pb schemes in glasgow, one tackling child poverty levels in the calton district.

title: 2012-2015 travelsmart programme using participatory budgeting in surrey
description: from 2012 to 2015, as part of a larger (travelsmart) programme to promote and build sustainable travel infrastructure and lower unemployment, surrey county council used participatory budgeting to allow citizens to decide how to spend a portion of funds on community projects that pursued those aims. 222 local projects were funded.

title: participatory budget in shunde district, foshan, china
description: in 2020, participatory budgeting was used to allocate funding for 41 projects in the shunde district of the city of foshan.

title: fairy creek blockades
description: a series of ongoing protests in the fairy creek and caycuse watersheds on southern vancouver island, protesting the logging of the bc's remaining old-growth forests and demanding the restoration of indigenous governance over the area.

title: #strongascedar
description: #strongascedar is an online campaign by the heiltsuk nation to empower indigenous people, and communities of colour, to fight racism in canada by sharing and gathering stories, and highlighting solutions for change.

title: deliberative polling® on crime in bulgaria
description: in october 2002, bulgaria held the first national deliberative polling® event of eastern europe. randomly sampled citizens came together to deliberative over how to deal with crime.

title: a pilot citizens assembly on electricity and energy justice in lebanon
description: the pilot citizens' assembly on energy justice and electricity was a conceptual and a methodological experiment conducted over five sessions in beirut in october 2020.

title: citizens’ assembly on restrictions and recommendations in response to the covid-19 pandemic
description: researchers at the university of turku in finland convened 70 people for a citizens’ assembly on covid-19 policies. the goal was to research the evolution of the participants’ attitudes concerning containment measures and the extent to which expert hearings influenced them.

title: deliberative commission on the deployment of 5g in the brussels region
description: 45 randomly selected citizens and 15 members of the brussels parliament discussed between april 29 and june 5 the modalities of 5g deployment in the brussels region, taking into account the environment, health, economy, employment and technological aspects.

title: permanent citizens' council of saint-gilles
description: the municipality of saint-gilles has established a permanent citizens' council composed of 35 randomly selected citizens, in order to promote citizen participation and interaction between residents and elected officials, and involve residents in the development of public policies

title: deliberative commission on homelessness in brussels
description: 45 randomy selected brussels citizens and 15 members of the brussels parliament discussed a citizens' interpellation: "the brussels-capital region has at least 5,313 homeless and poorly housed people. what measures do we want to take to resolve this situation in the long term?"

title: a deliberative forum on disinformation
description: the voices of ordinary filipinos are neglected in the initiatives against disinformation. to address this, a group of researchers conducted a deliberative forum to ask randomly selected filipinos to generate recommendations on how to respond to election-related disinformation.

title: baltimore covid-19 asset map
description: baltimore city council created an interactive map to help residents locate vital resources during the covid-19 pandemic, such as food distribution sites and medical facilities where people without health insurance can receive care.

title: baltimore free food map site
description: the baltimore free food locator map is an online mapping initiative that allows users to enter their location and find somewhere nearby where they can source free food. it was developed during the covid-19 pandemic by the city council, to ensure that vulnerable residents have access to food.

title: jefferson county coronavirus response hub
description: jefferson county in tennessee developed an online hub for the community to access information about healthcare. it uses maps to show residents where available hospital beds are and where they can get tested for covid-19 in their area.

title: montgomery county coronavirus case tracker
description: montgomery county in pennsylvania has created a central hub where residents can access information about where free food can be accessed for children and adults, as well as regional information on covid-19 cases.

title: cobb county covid-19 community hub
description: in cobb county, georgia, residents can access the community hub online to find out and contribute to information on covid-19 in their area. users can locate food assistance programs and medical facilities.

title: global citizens' assembly on genome editing
description: the global citizens' assembly on genome editing is a deliberative event that will synthesize inputs from several national level deliberative processes on different applications of genome editing and provide global and national reports on the future uses genome editing. specifically, it will bring together between 24–100 participants for 5 days to discuss the moral and ethical dimensions of genome editing; after hearing presentations from scientists, ethicists, and stakeholders, participants will develop recommendations surrounding genome editing governance.

title: participatory budgeting during covid-19 in chitungwiza, zimbabwe
description: chitungwiza municipality in zimbabwe undertook participatory budgeting during the covid-19 pandemic, where participation in local democracy was threatened by lockdowns in a context which participation usually takes place face to face.

title: conference 2021: just ask the citizens ?! - recipes for success of citizen-oriented communication
description: this year's conference is dedicated to the topic “just ask the citizens ?! - recipes for success in citizen-oriented communication ”and will take place on september 30, 2021 as an online event.

title: arkansas’s battle by the ballot: is decriminalizing marijuana next?
description: policy tends to move slower than social trends. however, arkansas empowers the people via a ballot initiative program where medical marijuana appeared and passed.

title: yiaga africa: youth participation in nigerian politics
description: the movement for effective governance in nigeria is based on accountability and transparency. yiaga africa functions to hold the nigerian government accountable. its targeted activities involve educating and empowering nigerian youths to play active roles in political advancement

title: paradigm leadership supportive initiative (plsi)
description: paradigm leadership supportive initiative serves as an intermediary between the government and the governed in public audit process. this is to increase citizens access to public audit data and other datasets in the accountability space through multiple technology platforms.

title: the vancouver dialogues project
description: the vancouver dialogues project (also known as the vancouver dialogues) sought to increase discourse and exchange information among indigenous and immigrant communities. the aim was to build stronger relations between "first comers and new comers" to vancouver.

title: primorg: strengthening anti-corruption and accountability by amplifying corruption related investigative reports on the radio and through social media
description: the “strengthening anti-corruption and accountability by amplifying corruption related investigative reports on the radio and through social media” project serves as a medium for good governance through amplification of investigative reports.

title: the participatory role of ghanaians in the 2012 ghana elections
description: the 2012 elections participatory process engaged the major political parties of ghana, which are the national democratic congress (ndc), the new patriotic party (npp), and eyewitnesses of voter fraud (citizens) in verifying the accuracy of the 2012 presidential elections.

title: safe babies court team monthly dialogues
description: the safe babies court team is a monthly dialogue event hosted in pulaski county arkansas. the dialogue is hosted and organized by the nonprofit zero to three of pulaski county. the dialogue is co-organized by the pulaski county 10th division juvenile court.

title: ghana youth environmental movement’s water sharing “kyensu” project (treba, ghana)
description: the ghana youth environmental movement, a youth-led environmental policy advocacy and campaign group, adopted a layered democratic process of deliberation with the leadership and residents of treba, a low-income rural community in ghana to solve the water insecurity plaguing them

title: orange shirt day #everychildmatters
description: orange shirt day is a regional grass roots indigenous-led initiative that became a national campaign by providing a space and support for recognition, remembrance, recovering, and conversations about residential schools, survivors and their legacy in canada.

title: bürgerforum corona
description: the german state of baden-württemberg set up a panel of 50 citizens selected through stratified random selection to gather opinions, understand needs, related to the covid-19 pandemic and the political handling of it.

title: the national reconciliation commission in ghana
description: in 2002, the ghanaian government appointed the national reconciliation commission to establish a historical record of human rights violations inflicted on persons by public institutions and public officers between 1957 and 1993 and to propose recommendations for reconciliation.

title: truth and reconciliation commission of liberia
description: the truth and reconciliation commission (trc) of liberia is a parliament-enacted organization that provides an environment for constructive interchange between victims and perpetrators of human violations and armed conflicts in liberia to recommend mechanisms for healing.

title: partick and thornwood ideas fund
description: partick and thornwood ideas fund is a participatory budgeting (pb) initiative funded by the scottish government investing in communities fund. residents can apply to fund an idea and grants range from £150 to £1,000 then residents cast three votes for their favourite ideas.

title: truth and reconciliation commission of canada
description: from 2008 to 2015 the truth and reconciliation commission (trc) of canada conducted research across the country and heard testimony from over 6000 witnesses and survivors of residential schools, culminating in the publication of the trc’s final report in december 2015.

title: community voices for health
description: community voices for health is focused on strengthening civic infrastructure to create more pathways for the public’s voice in health policy.

title: america talks
description: in response to increased decisiveness and hostility in the country, america talks was created and launched with a goal of connecting citizens across political and regional lines through thoughtful conversation.

title: participatory budgeting in tartu, estonia
description: tartu’s participatory budget (pb) allows citizens to decide how 1% of the year’s investment budget (as of 2021 this is around 150,000 eur) is spent. citizens are responsible for both submitting proposals and voting to decide which proposals should be implemented by the city [1].

title: demogames: analog and digital game-based-learning tools for youth work
description: demogames is an erasmus+ youth in action project which provides educational tools, methods and materials for democracy education in non-formal youth work. it allows young people to approach democracy in a participative and engaging way through analog and digital games.

title: the belfast agreement northern ireland referendum 1998
description: following the agreement between the united kingdom, northern ireland, and the republic of ireland regarding constitutional reforms, northern ireland held a referendum to gain citizens' approval necessary for finalizing the agreement.

title: omastadi - participatory budgeting in helsinki, finland (2018-ongoing)
description: in 2018, the city of helsinki began a participatory budgeting process known as omastadi with the objective to facilitate urban development project proposal and design, primarily through the use of an online platform and workshops.

title: nova scotia power customer energy forum
description: on november 19-20, 2004, nova scotia power's (nsp) customer energy forum was implemented as the first deliberative poll initiative in canada designed to meet the needs of future generations in the context of increasingly strict emissions requirements.

title: participatory budgeting in the dominican republic
'oor bit fife- places and spaces' participatory budgeting case study: fife council
description: ‘oor bit’ was a participatory budgeting initiative that was implemented in late 2016 and concluded in january 2017implemented by fife council with the objective to empower the people of fife in the ongoing push for a greater level of community participation within politics.

title: direct democracy and resource allocation: experimental evidence from afghanistan, 2016
description: this case reports the results of an experimental study that compares the impact of participatory budgeting versus direct democracy at the sub-national level in afghanistan.

title: participatory budgeting in bratislava (slovakia)
description: the capital of slovakia, bratislava, has seen participatory budgeting since 2011 with it becoming an increasingly popular tool to be used by local authorities. multiple cases have been implemented within bratislava with different types of methods being adopted.

title: warsaw participatory budget
description: the warsaw participatory budget (pb) is a series of annual budgets in the 18 individual districts of warsaw. the budget aims to allow citizens to take responsibility for urban life in the city.

title: italian constitutional referendum, 2020
description: in 2020 a referendum was held on whether to the amend the italian constitution, to reduce the number of deputies from 630 to 400, the number of senators from 300 to 215, and limit the number of new life senators.  69.96% of votes were cast in favour of the amendments.

title: #jendouba_wants_real_development (#jendouba_tourid_tanmiya_hakekeya)
description: in 2016, small and medium farmers in jendouba began protesting over lack of government development assistance, service provision and subsidies, and corruption along multiple supply chains.

title: social activism
urban health: hamilton and smog
description: this is a project to address the issue of smog in cities and its negative impact on health. this project focused on the pollution within hamilton, ontario and methods to ameliorate the air quality. this case worked with invest in hamilton and the initiative for change.

title: map kibera
description: kibera  was a blank spot on the map and thus could not receive any needed resources (e.g. sanitation, security, etc.). map kibera undertook an interactive community mapping framework that focused on developing better outcomes through both the process and the results.

title: innovative participation during the development of the vauban sustainable district
description: the vauban sustainable district in the city of freiburg, used innovative forms of participatory planning to develop into a world-class sustainable neighborhood. the creation of resident stakeholder groups like “forum vauban” largely allowed for open and transparent participation.

title: vancouver’s chinatown revitalization plan: analysis of public participation
description: an analysis of the city of vancouver’s consultation process between 2015 and 2018 using archon fung’s democracy cube. we also provide a few key takeaways to increase meaningful participation through a justice and equity-based lens.

title: auckland 2050: public participation in state-led strategic & indigenous planning
description: this case analyzes the role of public participation in state-led strategic and indigenous planning through the development of auckland council's auckland plan 2050.

title: false creek south conceptual development plan
big bar landslide: a collaborative governance response
description: the big bar landslide prevented migrating #pacificsalmon from reaching their spawning grounds in the upper fraser river in british columbia. the emergency response saw diverse state, non-state & #indigenous groups to work together on stewardship planning for salmon recovery.

title: understanding councillor views on public participation in surrey
description: using the iap2 spectrum of participation councillors were surveyed to demonstrate whether they are in favour of participatory methods. this was for a masters dissertation looking to understand if local authorities in the uk have the right conditions to use participatory methods.

title: prospective of the jesús maría and pinto river basin to the year 2030
description: the prospective study of the basin of the jesús maría and pinto rivers (córdoba, argentina) was developed. in order to build a participatory roadmap with priority axes and strategic actions for the integrated management of the basin.

title: university of arkansas town hall on race relations
description: administrators and students engaged in a town hall debate on the university of arkansas' campus in fayetteville, arkansas, united states on march 12, 2018 in response to a racially insensitive social media post. the event discussed better ways to promote diversity and inclusion.

title: gambling debate in russ-vegas
description: facebook group pope county majority informs county citizens about recent developments of a potential casino in russellville, ar in the u.s. as of june 2019. the group encourages citizen participation at pope county quorum court meetings to discuss their comments and concerns.

title: mississippians redesign state flag
description: the mississippi commission to redesign the state flag was established to choose a new state flag for mississippi, a state in the united states, following state and national pressures to replace the former state flag, which featured the confederate battle emblem.

title: observations and analysis of the #metoo social movement and debate on twitter
description: the #metoo movement originated on twitter, and has raised awareness for women who have been affected by sexual violence. the movement amplified the problem through social media, causing #metoo to trend on a global level.

title: icelandic women’s strike
description: on october 24, 1975, 90% of icelandic women went on strike for one day to remind the country of their importance.

title: the use of the reach app in alexandria ocasio-cortez’s 2018 campaign for u.s. congress in new york, usa.
description: the reach app was fundamental in getting alexandria ocasio-cortez (aoc) elected in the 2018 midterm elections by promoting a new political organizing strategy. this campaign was for a seat from new york in the u.s. congress.

title: national turmoil inspires peace rally at lyon college
description: a student united her college campus and community through a peace rally on september 29, 2016 in batesville, arkansas. taylor donnerson felt that the tragic events were dividing the united states so she wanted to set a peaceful atmosphere in the community.

title: gang violence in little rock '92
description: in 1992, the murder rate climbed to 76 in little rock, arkansas. the murders primarily sparked from the gang and drug violence in low-income african american communities. as a result, community activists and philanthropists rose to defend the communities.

title: participatory intervention on birth outcomes with women's groups in nepal
description: from 2001 to 2003, a team of researchers did a study to see whether participatory workshops would improve birth outcomes in a poor rural area of nepal.

title: auckland 2050: analyzing public participation in state-led strategic & indigenous planning
description: this case analyzes public participation in the creation of the auckland 2050 plan, with emphasis on steps taken to involve indigenous people in new zealand's largest city.

title: danish citizens' parliament on climate
description: the assembly, comprising 99 citizens, was tasked with debating various citizen-related dilemmas associated with the climate challenges, to contribute to climate policymaking. after five months, 119 recommendations for the green transition were produced.

title: citizens’ assembly of mostar
description: the citizen’s assembly of mostar, bosnia and herzegovina, will bring a group of 40 people together who are broadly representative of the city's population. they will learn, discuss and make recommendations on city cleanliness and maintenance of public spaces.

title: devote - the meanings of 'voting' for citizens
description: devote is a research project funded by the european research council (erc) from january 2021 to december 2025.  a research team at the university of vienna led by ass.-prof. carolina plescia aims to provide first-time evidence on what ‘voting’ means for ordinary citizens.

title: townsville citizens’ forum — great barrier reef futures
description: research driven pilot study using a citizens' jury format combined with gis based participatory evaluation exercises to assess and demonstrate potential for public input into complex issues such as the future management of the great barrier reef

title: australian citizens' jury on genome editing
description:
a three day citizens' jury involving a national sample of citizens to discuss genome editing technologies with the aim of enhancing public conversation and political decision-making. 
this is part of the global citizens' assembly on genome editing.

title: demokratiefabrik: a new digital democratic innovation
description: the demokratiefabrik, a digital democratic innovation, was conducted in the municipality of köniz in switzerland. with an input from local parties, randomly selected citizens autonomously created a questionnaire that served as a voting advice application for a local election.

title: the greensboro truth and reconciliation commission
description: in november 1979, a group of white supremacists confronted anti-kkk demonstrators in greensboro, north carolina. five demonstrators were killed, at least ten others were wounded, and numerous residents and witnesses were left traumatized. in 2002, the gtrc was established.

title: engage memphis youth summit
description: the engage memphis event was held by facing history and ourselves and bridges in an effort to increase voter turn out in the city and to engage the community’s future voters. the event took place in memphis, tennessee (united states), on september 28, 2018.

title: “glass of milk” or vaso de leche committees.
description: vaso de leche committees are ongoing committees, established in 1985, as a nutrition program for pregnant and lactating women that provides daily portions of milk and staple foods in peru. [1].

title: genherous 2
description: genherous is an event for women in their 20s to 70s and beyond to share stories about their lives, advice for other generations based on their experiences, and share hopes for the future. the goals of the event are to build connections and create a space for authenticity.

title: deer park fire disaster town halls
description: after the 2019 petroleum plant explosion in deer park, texas, usa, citizens and advocacy groups organized town halls to address the fallout, response, and reaction to the fire.

title: platte river power authority (prpa) community focus groups
description: the cpd at csu provided a public deliberative event in spring 2020 in each of the four colorado communities that a wholesale electricity provider serves to help their energy planning process on the best way to decarbonize, focusing on tradeoffs between 4 plans.

title: a conversation on service years for north carolina’s youth.
description: service year nc and movement of youth partnered to sponsor a conversation on march 13, 2019 in raleigh, north carolina, usa. in order to facilitate nonprofits, policy makers, private companies, and concerned residents to learn more about the two organizations and service years.

title: rock ar vote gotv outreach
description: rock ar vote is a political initiative launched by get out the vote [1] college outreach to educate, register, and engage college students in central arkansas to participate in the election cycle.

title: little rock community members take control of lrsd stakeholder meetings
description: in little rock, arkansas, usa, the state department of education held stakeholder meetings to determine the future of a failing school district. the meetings allowed community members to provide input on the future of the district, which is currently under state control.

title: commission on the truth for el salvador (comisión de la verdad para el salvador)
description: from 1980 to 1991, el salvador was immersed in a war that plunged its society into violence. on january 16, 1992, the parties reconciled and signed the peace agreement in mexico. in july, a trc was established, which published its final report in 1993.

title: libya’s voice of change youth debates
description: hosted by the national democratic institute, the “voice of change” project is a youth debate program to foster the development of the basic tenets of democracy within libya’s youth.

title: west virginia teachers’ strike of 2018
description: in 2018, teachers in the u.s. state of west virginia went on strike to protest low salaries and diminishing benefits. the strike included teachers and personnel, and they also had the support of students, students’ parents, and other supporters.

title: the big event: students’ biggest day of public service
description: this case study will cover the 2018 big event at the university of mississippi and texas a&m university. before its inception, there was no active way for students to connect with community members through service.

title: chilean constitutional reform: the 1988 plebiscite
description: when the plebiscite is activated, citizens engage in direct democratic participation to enact or strike down proposed constitutional reforms. this was first activated in 1988 with a vote on whether general pinochet should serve another 8 years as the leader of chile.

title: crowdsourcing a constitution in mexico city, mexico (ciudad de mexico, mexico)
description: crowdsourcing a constitution was a process in which citizens of mexico city, mexico provided input in writing an autonomous governing document.  the measure was sponsored by the mexican federal government and administered by mayor miguel angel mancera from 2016-2018.

title: 2019 hong kong way demonstration
description: hong kong citizens organized a peaceful protest imitating the baltic way protest on its 30th anniversary. hong kong protestors formed a human chain to protest the fugitive offender amendment bill, engage citizens and raise international support for their cause.

title: hong kong protestors implement methods to avoid facial recognition technology and government tracking
description: hong kong authorities have implemented tracking methods in an attempt to curtail civil unrest by tracking protestors via facial recognition cameras and their cell phones. residents protesting against a bill that would allow hong kong citizens to be extradited to china.

title: the truth, justice and reconciliation commission of kenya (tjrc)
description: the truth, justice and reconciliation commission of kenya (tjrc) was established in 2008 to address injustices from 1963 to 2008 including ethnic conflicts, marginalization, political violence, and the 2007 post-election violence.

title: national institute of youth in chile online platform
description: this platform aims to develop spaces that favor youth citizens' participation, strengthening the role of these members in their public spheres. through different projects, these young citizens will be able to express their ideas.

title: imagining the future with citizens: the village of marcoussis in 2028
description: marcoussis has engaged around 600 people (out of a population of 8000 inhabitants) in 25 moments over a period of 2 years, using very diverse methods and techniques (forum-theater, market of ideas, collective distillation) to explore the future and set up its territiorial agenda.

title: the constitutional review in tanzania 2014.
description: in 2014, the citizens of tanzania successfully sought changes in the constitution, dividing the government into three parts; tanzania mainland, tanzania island, and the republic of tanzania. they also reduced and reinstated the power of the president (shilla, p. 2014, april 14).

title: the people’s budget in long beach, california
description: diverse community members from across the city of long beach, california, in the united states, released a #peoplesbudget for fiscal year 2020 on july 23, 2019, in order to bring their values and priorities to bear on the city budget.

title: how arkansas moms stopped sb484
description: the united states, arkansas chapter of moms demand action for gun sense in america mobilized to actively oppose sb484 otherwise known as “ the stand your ground bill” during the 2019 legislative session. the bill failed to pass in a 3-4 vote on april 2, 2019.

title: protest against police shootings in arlington, texas
description: a protest was held at at&t stadium in arlington, home to the dallas cowboys on september 16, 2018. the event was formed to protest police shootings in the area and was held at the stadium in hopes of mobilizing support from jerry jones, owner of the football team [1].

title: 2018 midterm elections voter disenfranchisement: dodge city, ks
description: during the 2018 midterm elections, the one polling location in dodge city, kansas in the united  states was moved outside of city limits, fostering voter disentrancement amongst the majority  latinx community.

title: twitter campaign successfully removes confederate statues in memphis parks
description: social media campaign #takeemdown901 mobilized u.s. citizens in the city of memphis, tennessee to protest confederate statues in memphis parks. the successful campaign ran may- december 2017.

title: maori women act for indigenous rights
description: the maori people have a long history of protests in defense of their cultural heritage. in new zealand, many major battles have occurred over land igniting a new wave of activism in younger generations aiming to preserve their connection to their cultural heritage.

title: south african commission of truth and reconciliation (trc)
description: in 1996, nelson mandela and desmond tutu authorized a trc in south africa, in which victims and witnesses could publicly testify their experiences under apartheid. perpetrators could also request amnesty from prosecution in exchange for providing testimony.

title: consultation publique du parc jean-drapeau
description: afin de se doter d'un plan directeur d'aménagement et de développement pour les 10 prochaines années (2020-2030), la société du parc jean-drapeau (spjd) a opté au printemps 2018 pour le déclenchement d'un processus de consultation publique pilotée par l'office de consultation publique de montréal (ocpm). fruit d’une démarche participative et de consultation, les différentes activités de la consultation, en personne et en ligne, ont dénombré plus de 7 100 participations. le rapport de l’ocpm, avec ses 19 recommandations, a été rendu public le 10 avril 2019.

title: participation observatory
description: the participation observatory is the space that collects and presents monitoring activities, analyzes, data and statistics on participation in emilia-romagna and italy.

title: park(ing) day
description: park(ing) day is an annual, international event to reclaim street space from cars. it began in san francisco in 2005, when the design collective rebar transformed a parking space into a pop-up public park for the duration of the 'rental' enabled through a  parking meter.

title: heiltsuk women and fisheries protest on canada's pacific coast
description: to protect the herring population on canada's pacific coast and gain greater decision-making power in fisheries governance, heiltsuk women led a series of protests against the department of fisheries and oceans following the contested reopening of a depleting herring fisheries.

title: truth and reconciliation commission of south korea
description: the truth and reconciliation commission of south korea was established on december 1, 2005 and sought to address incidents and human rights abuses in korean history that occurred between 1910 and 1993.

title: participatory mapping and women's empowerment in mozambican small-scale fisheries
description: the role of smartphone technology and participatory mapping in enhancing democratic participation among small-scale women fisherfolk in mozambique.

title: south africa women in fisheries workshop
description: the role of the wif south africa workshop in addressing the challenges faced by women fisherfolk in south african fisheries by building their leadership capacity to make south africa’s small-scale fisheries more equitable and accessible for women.

title: promoting women’s participation in arctic fisheries governance
description: an international working group of nation-states and permanent members of the arctic council deliberated on policies for women’s inclusion in decision-making processes regarding fisheries resource management in the arctic.

title: promoting social relations in fish value-chain activities by women in small-scale fisheries in lake malawi, and lake chilwa.
description: the role of women in small-scale fisheries that engage in social relations along the value-chains of production to democratically represent and participate in lake malawi and lake chilwa. the generic methods used by women in a social-relational approach aim towards focusing on ways of interacting and communicating with communities to embody values of respect, inclusiveness, and corporation. social relational approaches influence women's participation, engagement, and outcomes in small-scale fishing villages in malawi.

title: the participation of uganda’s fisheries women in integrated lake management
description: as part of the way forward, the adoption of integrated fisheries lake management as an inclusive management regime brings together multiple sectors to coordinate planning and inclusion of informal citizens (women). it uses uganda's experience in fisheries lake management implementing diversity of power, influence, and assets, and the ability to challenge institutional arrangements that obstruct equal access to the advantages of fisheries resources. to enhance access and empower the participation of women fisherfolks.

title: 10c shared space: 42 carden street community bond initiative
description: 10c shared space is a non-profit community hub and shared workspace in guelph, ontario that aims to create a platform for collaborative work to improve communities. people work, meet, eat, create, and brainstorm together at 10c.

title: the united states prison hunger strike of 2016
description: in 2016, prisoners across the united states decided to come together and protest their conditions through a coordinated hunger strike.

title: iraqi women lead reconciliation strategies symposium
description: in an initiative supported by the national democratic institute (ndi) 40 iraqi women from isis liberated provinces anbar, kirkuk, ninewa, and salahaddin, put together a comprehensive policy plan for reconstruction in iraq.

title: nigerian advocacy against sexual assault
description: the reaction of nigerians in seeking justice for sexual assault victims in nigeria.

title: urban plan of the city of mont-saint-hilaire
description: the case presented here is that of the redesign of the urban plan of the city of mont-saint-hilaire in 2015. the process was spread over 18 months and was characterized by numerous participatory activities and communications to stakeholders. .

title: harvest impact by 10c seeded by our food future
description: harvest impact was created by 10c and seeded by our food future. their goal is to provide access to nutritious food and promote a circular food economy through community-based lending in the guelph-wellington county.

title: arkansans unite against “bad” legislation
description: in response to the effort by the republican-controlled state legislature to enact laws that targeted marginalized groups, several dozen arkansans launched the first veto referendum movement in the state in decades.

title: citizens’ participation in niger’s 2021 elections
description: the 2021 elections in niger resulted in claims that there was fraud which led to a number to consequential protests in the country for several days before the intervention of authorities to cease the protest and calm things down.

title: north dakota access pipeline protest
description: back in 2016, the construction of the dakota access pipeline, which was scheduled to continue being built underneath a section of the missouri river, was met with resistance from the standing rock sioux tribe.

title: pointe-ala-hache residents fight to be heard
description: during a series of plaquemines parish council meetings and media outreach processes, east pointe-a la-hache citizens let their voices be heard in the fight to keep their ferry up and running.

title: citizens initiative to raise the minimum wage in arkansas, 2018
description: on november 6, 2018, a majority of arkansans voted “yes” on ballot issue 5 commonly known as the minimum wage increase initiative.

title: “mi senado” or “my senate”
description: “my senate” is a digital program created by the colombian congress for citizen participation regarding bills within the congress. this digital program is an app you can download on your smartphone. this app also allows for citizens to do in depth research on the congress members.

title: global refugee-led network
description: the global refugee-led network (grn) is a coalition of refugee leaders and refugee-led organizations that seeks to increase the direct representation of refugees' voices and perspectives within regional and global governance structures [1].

title: conference on the future of europe
description: the conference on the future of europe (may 9, 2021–spring 2022) encompassed a multilingual digital platform for idea sharing, decentralized events, european citizens’ panels, and conference plenary. topics ranged from covid-19 to climate change, democracy, and equality. according to missions publiques, however, the plenary was the conference’s central democratic innovation.

title: oregon citizens' initiative review - measure 90: oregon open primary initiative
description: in august 2014, there was an ocir on measure 90, the oregon open primary initiative, which would have created a top-two system of voting for most elections in the state.

title: san francisco fines and fees task force
description: san francisco's fines and fees task force sought to examine the impact of fines, fees, and other financial penalties on low income people and people of color and recommend reforms to mitigate any undue negative impacts.

title: colorado’s independent congressional redistricting commission
description: colorado law places a group of citizens, rather than elected officials, in charge of creating the state’s new congressional district maps following the decennial census. twelve selected commissioners met virtually in 2021 to generate these maps.

title: citizens' assembly on democracy in the united kingdom
montréal, quebec deliberative dialogue workshop for women living with hiv.
description: hiv patients engaged in a face to face, deliberative group dialogue in order to discuss improving medical care and treatment of women living with hiv in quebec.

title: croydon's citizen's assembly on climate change
description: local citizen's assembly on climate change undertaken between january and february 2020.

title: kendal climate citizens' jury
description: 20 residents of kendal were selected to form a citizens jury. over 9 sessions, they deliberated on "what should kendal do about climate change?". their recommendations were presented to the council and inform the work of kendal town council’s carbon neutral kendal group.

title: north of tyne citizens' assembly on climate change
description: the north of tyne 50 assembly members met between the 24th of february and march 2021 to deliberate on the climate change issue. then they shared their ideas, and deliberated on the issues, before creating a set of recommendations for ntca cabinet to consider.

title: jersey assisted dying citizen's jury
description: the jersey assisted dying citizen’s jury was commissioned by the minister for health and social services in response to a petition signed by 1,861 people. the jury considered whether assisted dying should be legalised and the circumstances under which it should be permitted.

title: the irish citizens’ assembly on gender equality
description: the 2020-2021 irish citizens’ assembly on gender equality was created by the oirechtas to deliberate upon issues of gender equality and create policy recommendations.

title: capta citizens review panel in southwest arkansas
description: the columbia county citizens review panel in arkansas, met monthly to evaluate the state’s department of human services division of children and family services. the citizens review panel is federally mandated by the child abuse prevention and treatment act.

title: little rock: #justiceforroxsana national week of action
description: intransitive, an immigrant-led transgender justice organization based in little rock, arkansas in the united states, participated in the #justiceforroxsana national week of action. this was done in memory of roxsana hernandez, in support of all transgender people in ice custody.

title: otpor! student non-violent mobilization for democracy
northside voyagers: the transformation of the northside
description: ordinary citizens of a historically prominent neighborhood in a small town form a leadership committee to help their neighborhood get back to glory in spartanburg, south carolina, usa.

title: aleppo citizens’ clean water initiative
description: with the conflict arising in syria, residents were suffering a severe humanitarian crisis. with water shut down on an entire city, the citizens of aleppo arranged an initiative in 2014 to create a network that provides clean water to the city.

title: religious monuments on the state capitol grounds.
description: satan and god clash on the steps of the arkansas capitol after the arkansas state legislature blocks a permit for a satanic monument to be placed on the arkansas capitol grounds.

title: malaria eradication campaign in evbotubu community
taiwan 2021 holopolis citizen deliberation
description: taiwan’s government launched holopolis which are virtual reality (vr) experiments that seek to empower citizens and create strong relationships with the government. vr technology helps to foster dialogue through online participation. taiwan’s government aims to promote democracy and enhance citizens’ participation in different issues.

title: the orléans-style democratic approach to climate action
description: finding innovative methods to meet the eu climate goals using public participatory means. orléans métropole is developing a new, innovative approach intended to mobilize long-term participation from orléans citizens.

title: the orléans peoples panel assembly on climate change
description: this climate assembly took shape as assises de la transition écologique, or forums for ecological transition. the assises model draws on a forum where citizens, experts, and elected officials within local authorities  aim to design policy solutions together

title: scotland climate assembly on climate change
description: 100 assembly members met online for seven weekends. the assembly learned about climate change, mitigation, adaptation, fairness, and how change happens before splitting into three streams: diet, land use and lifestyle; homes and communities; and travel and work.

title: copeland people’s panel on climate change
description: copeland peoples panel on climate change citizens’ jury consists of 30 members of the public that come together to deliberate and make recommendations on climate change. the panel met every week between july and september 2021. all meetings took place online.

title: we are the future
description: we are the future was a conference of children and young people from around the world who met in bucharest, romania at the same time at a european policy forum on education and developed position statements and questions that they presented to ministers.

title: jersey peoples' panel assembly on climate change
description: the jersey citizens’ assembly on climate change was made up of 45 randomly selected islanders. they took part in 15 virtual meetings between march and may 2021. they considered the question ‘how we should work together to become carbon neutral’.

title: establishment of the citizen panel for the climate
description: a citizen panel was set up. during 13 meetings, the panellists exchanged and debated the measures to be implemented in order to achieve -55% of greenhouse gases (ghg) by 2030 compared to the ghg emitted in 1990. at the end of their exchanges, 168 recommendations for reducing ghgs were retained.

title: wallonië citizen panel for the climate
description: the wallonië citizens’ assembly on air climate energy plan (pace) was made up of 50 randomly selected locals. they took part in 15 virtual meetings between march and may 2021.

title: bonn peoples panel on climate change
description: the first of four bonn climate peoples panel took place on september 10th and 11th, 2021 in the schauspielhaus bad godesberg. 1oo randomly selected citizens participated with 25 professional organisations. they worked together on positive future images for bonn 2035

title: rouen citizens assembly on climate change
description: a deliberative body was established to collectively discuss and review policy recommendations on a plan to work on how rouen could adapt to climatic and health risks. 30 diverse residents will engage with the latest expert knowledge and research between january and march 2022.

title: brighton & hove climate assembly
description: brighton & hove’s climate assembly brought together 50 randomly selected groups of people to learn about climate issues, discuss them with one another, and make recommendations. they met online between september and november 2021.

title: uster citizen panel for climate protection
description: the citizen panel for more climate protection in uster met on two weekends, 28th  august and 12th  september 2021. 20 randomly drawn residents dealt with how the climate in uster can be protected, consciously consumed and waste avoided.

title: the blaenau gwent people's panel climate assembly
description: the blaenau gwent people's panel climate assembly met on the 21st of march 2021. 50 randomly selected participants will hear evidence and produce recommendations for what local public service organisations, communities and individuals can do to address the climate crisis.

title: budapest peoples's panel assembly on climate change.
description: the citizen panel for more climate protection in budapest met on two weekends, the 12th and 26th of september 2020. 50 randomly drawn residents dealt with what needs to be done in budapest to build a more environmentally friendly society.

title: krakow people panel on climate change
description: the citizen panel for more climate protection in krakow met between 4 september and 20 november 2021. 60 randomly drawn residents dealt with what needs to be done in krakow to reduce energy consumption and increase the use of renewable energy

title: poznań citizens' panel
description: poznań assembly brought together 80 randomly selected residents from across poznań city between september and november 2019, to figure out, how can the poznań authorities act to counteract and adapt to climate change and the climate crisis.

title: gdansk citizens' panel
description: gdansk citizens' panel climate assembly brought together 80 randomly selected residents from across the gdansk region between november 19th and december 3rd 2016, to figure out what be done to improve rainwater retention in their area.

title: lublin climate assembly on air control
description: the citizen panel for more climate protection in lublin met on six weekends, between april and june 2018. 60 randomly selected people together with experts were looking for an answer to the question of what to do to breathe clean air.

title: citizens' report by the adlershof planning cell "energy-efficient urbanity"
description: the planning cell adlershof took place  in the schrödinger center of the humboldt university berlin in adlershof , the aim of which is to develop local application possibilities for forms of cooperation for common identify increases in efficiency in the use of energy

title: berlin city districts peoples' climate change assembly
description: from 19 to 28 june 2014, a total of 88 randomly selected berliners took part in the citizen participation process on the topic of intelligent energy and transport transition in berlin city districts.

title: citizens' forum on climate-friendly energy supply in baden-württemberg
description: baden-württemberg peoples' assembly on climate change is aimed to enable randomly selected 220 citizens to discuss between march and april 1996 the social effects of various measures to reduce co2 and evaluate academy scenarios and finally design and justify an energy scenario.

title: global citizens' dialogue on the future of the internet
description: the global citizens' dialogue on the future of the internet met in october 2020, bringing together roughly 5,500 participants from over 70 countries. discussion topics included digital identity, internet governance, the digital public sphere, disinformation, and ai.

title: uster citizens' panel for more climate protection
description: the city of uster, switzerland, randomly selected a representative sample of twenty citizens for a citizens’ panel to discuss how and why the city should protect the climate, consume consciously, and avoid waste, producing forty-four recommendations for municipal consideration.

title: conference on the future of europe
description:
the european union (eu)  organized this conference to discuss the future of europe between april 2021 and may 2022. 
making use of multiple deliberation mechanisms, 9 main topics were debated and deliberated regarding which direction should take the future of europe.

title: devon peoples climate assembly
description: devon peoples panel climate assembly brought together 70 randomly selected groups of people to learn about climate issues, discuss them with one another, and proffer solutions to the public consultation of the interim devon carbon plan. they met online between june and july 2021.

title: the blaenau gwent climate assembly
description: the blaenau gwent climate assembly brought together 50 randomly selected residents from across the blaenau gwent council in march 2021, to figure out what could be done to address the climate crisis in a way that is fair and improves living standards for everyone.

title: oxford citizens assembly on climate change
description: the oxford citizens assembly on climate change brought together 50 randomly selected groups of people to learn about climate issues, discuss them with one another, and make recommendations. they met online between 28th september and 20 october 2019.

title: cambridge citizens' assembly on air quality
description:
the greater cambridge citizens’ assembly on congestion, air quality and public
transport brought together 53 randomly selected residents from greater
cambridge and the wider travel to the work area for two weekends during september and october 2019.

title: warwick district people’s climate change inquiry
description: warwick district climate assembly brought together 30 randomly selected residents from across the warwick district city region between november 2020 and february 2021, to figure out what warwick district could do about the emergency of climate change.

title: leeds climate change citizens’ assembly
description: leeds climate assembly brought together 25 randomly selected residents from across the leeds city region between september and november 2019, to figure out what leeds could do about the emergency of climate change.

title: blackpool climate assembly
description: blackpool climate assembly brought together 40 randomly selected residents from across the blackpool city region between january and february 2021, to figure out how to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2030.

title: lancaster district people’s jury on climate change
description: lancaster climate assembly brought together 30 randomly selected residents from across the lancaster city region between february and april 2020, to figure out what could be done in homes, neighbourhoods and districts to respond to the emergency of climate change.

title: citizen assembly: solution-oriented deliberative democracy
description:
we take turns presenting various ideas for how to improve our societies. we deliberate those ideas while maintaining real freedom of speech. we build support for those ideas so we can organize to implement the best solutions.

topic:
https://egora-ilp.org/ideas/1ap/preview

title: deliberative polling®: texas electric utilities
description: in 1996, 8 texas electric utilities polled their customers to determine what energy options they preferred to meet future electric requirements. the results were unanticipated; and affected commitment to renewables and efficiency as a result of what they heard from customers.

title: deliberative polling® on the referendum to make australia a republic
description: australia had a referendum to vote on a constitutional amendment to make australia a republic, cut its remaining constitutional ties to the british crown, and replace the queen and governor-general with a parliament-chosen president. the referendum was rejected by 55-45.

title: by the people: a national issues convention in philadelphia
description: a national issues convention was built around a deliberative opinion poll, having a random sample of americans from all walks of life exchange opinions, learn from each other, and question experts, and analyzing their changed opinions after the event.

title: deliberative polling® on foreign policy and the 2004 presidential election
description: 2000 americans in communities around the country participated in a common deliberation about the nation's stakes as they approach the polls. the focus was on two challenges: national security and american jobs in the global economy.

title: by the people: a national deliberation on healthcare and education
description: americans engaged in an experiment to see what the public thinks about education and health care—once informed about the issues and discussing them together. their views changed significantly about policy options, about public officials and about each other.

title: deliberative polling® on immigrant voting and high speed rail in italy
description: over the weekend of march 24-25 a scientific sample of the residents of the torino region engaged in a unique experiment in public consultation about two difficult issues—the right to vote for immigrants and the proposed tav high speed train for connecting turino and lyon.

title: dialogues in democracy: citizenship in 21st century america
description: citizen deliberations around the country focused on the rights and responsibilities of citizens, as they relate to issues of local importance. the local deliberations were accompanied by a national online deliberative poll exploring 21st century citizenship in america.

title: deliberative polling® on unemployment and job creation in kaposvár hungary
description: the institute of sociology and social policy of the corvinus university of budapest conducted a deliberative poll in the summer of 2008 in kaposvár, hungary. the topics were employment, job creation and the employment policy of the european union.

title: deliberative polling® on the uses of a stadium in poznań, poland
description: participants from the polish city of poznań deliberated on the possible uses of a stadium at the conclusion of euro 2012. they considered pros and cons of four scenarios for the future of the stadium.  this is the first time deliberative polling® has been used in poland.

title: deliberative polling® on the pension system in japan
description: a deliberative poll “pension system, a generational choice” was held at keio university. the 127 participants discussed three themes including “social insurance method or all tax method” in small groups.

title: deliberative polling® on food safety in japan
description: a poll was held at hokkaido university on the subject of on bovine spongiform encephalopathy (bse) – “mad cow disease”.

title: deliberative polling® on snow and snow removal in sapporo, japan
description: a city-wide deliberative poll was conducted in the city of sapporo, japan. the deliberative polling® event focused on the important issue of snow removal and how to manage snow efficiently and effectively for the safety and livelihood of its residents.

title: tanzania: first national deliberative poll in africa
description: soon after tanzania’s discovery of major natural gas reserves, we invited a nationally representative sample of voters to an intensive public deliberation of policy options featuring nationally recognized experts and small-group discussions.

title: deliberative polling® in tivaouane peulh, senegal
description: an initiative has been launched to conduct deliberative polling® in tivaoune peul, to promote resilience and help bridge the gap between researchers, experts, civil society and communities.

title: deliberative polling® for summit public schools
description: over 200 california public high school seniors from the bay area participated in a deliberative poll on the issues of voting rights and the value of being informed about politics and public policy. students deliberated with one another and heard from leading experts in the field.

title: deliberative polling® in nsanje district, southern malawi
description: the nsanje district in malawi is home to 2 regions that face severe challenges from recurrent flooding. residents met to discuss policy options on the topics of relocation and resettlement, reducing vulnerabilities, and population pressure, gender and access to social services.

title: specialist conference "mobility as a pioneer - municipal climate protection and citizen participation"
description: on september 14, 2022, the specialist conference of who thinks was gmbh will be about citizen participation in the context of municipal mobility and climate protection measures. content: best practice, requirements and challenges in citizen participation, funding opportunities for municipalities, network.

title: intervention of the roundabout de las residentas - fernando de la mora
description: the pedestrian spaces of the las residentas roundabout were often invisible, in poor condition and occupied by vehicles as alternative lanes or parking. the proposal presented by the "urbtac" team, made up of students and teaching professionals from the architecture and urban planning degree at the national university of asunción, proposes tactical urban planning actions promoting citizen participation and the use of sustainable means of mobility.

title: educational transformation plan in paraguay
description: the government of paraguay, through the ministries of education and science, finance and other government entities, as well as representatives of civil society, began an articulated process to build a plan and a consensus roadmap on education in the country.

title: yarra valley water citizens' jury 2022
description: adopting a similar process to the one in 2017, yarra valley water conducted a year-long engagement process to hear from citizens for the next five-year water plan. this included organising a citizens' jury about what matters most to the community regarding water.

title: tool for digital participation in public hearings created by the municipality of belo horizonte in the context of the covid-19 pandemic.
description: citizen participation is a constitutional right and, in times of a pandemic, the exercise of this right is limited due to the social distancing measures adopted to prevent the spread of the virus. this study aims to analyze the initiative adopted by the municipality of belo horizonte (cmbh) to enable citizen digital participation, specifically participation in public hearings, during the coronavirus pandemic. this is a research with secondary data, in which the investigation took place through a bibliographic review on e-democracy, digital participation and governmental experiences in the use of information and communication technologies (ict), together with an empirical analysis of the platform of digital participation made available by cmbh.

title: pipe relining melbourne
description: roots from trees can grow into pipes and damage them. if you are unsure if pipe relining is necessary, you can call a plumber to come and inspect your pipes.if you are in need of a pipe relining service, it is important to choose a qualified plumber.

title: public consultation on the return of face-to-face classes in mogi das cruzes/sp
description: public consultation carried out by the education department of the municipality of mogi das cruzes, a municipality in the interior of são paulo (brazil), between january and february 2021, on the return of face-to-face classes in schools - which were suspended due to the invid-19 pandemic .

title: marco civil da internet in brazil: the collaborative construction of law 12.965/2014
description:
on april 23, 2014, president dilma rousseff sanctioned the
law 12.965/2014, known as the civil rights framework for the internet,
responsible for establishing “principles, guarantees, rights and duties
for the use of the internet in brazil”.

title: austria climate change citizens’ assembly
description: randomly selected 84 citizens from all regions of austria and all sections of society sat down between january and june 2022 to figure out what to do today to live in a climate-neutral future tomorrow.

title: spain climate change citizens’ assembly
description: spain's climate assembly brought together 100 randomly selected residents from across spain's society between october 2021 and may 2022, to figure out what action the spanish government could do to safeguard the environment, health and safety of the population. citizenship.

title: macedonia deliberative poll
description: the european policy institute under the guidance of the cdd implemented the 1st deliberative poll in macedonia. this event gathered a random sample of the entire country for 1 weekend.  the participants engaged in a discussion on the country’s ascension to the european union.

title: future of britain
description: leaving the eu will present the uk with a new set of policy options that are currently largely determined by decisions made in brussels. we are now pursuing a research project on the choices that the public think the uk should make once it has left the eu.

title: the truth and justice commission of mauritius
description: slavery and slavery-related practices plagued the lives of slaves and indentured labourers in mauritius from the island's colonization in 1638. in 2009, the parliament of mauritius created a truth and justice commission to research socioeconomic class abuses and its implications.

title: how to empower teens to manage their health
description: this guide how to empower teens to manage their health, developed for health professionals, provides information on four important areas in teen lives: 1. healthy snacking, 2. physical activity, 3. sedentary behavior, and 4. screen time.

title: solomon islands truth and reconciliation commission (trc)
